Function.Name: ARMCONV
Function.Definition: Converts a SAS System 9 or later ARM log written in simple format to the more readable label=item format that was used in SAS 8.2.
Function.Description1: Is the physical name of the input ARM log.
Function.Description2: Is the physical name of the output ARM log.

Function.Name: ARMEND
Function.Definition: Indicates the termination of an application.
Function.Description1: Options: APPID=numeric variable or constant; APPIDVAR=numeric variable; LEVEL= variable; MACONLY=NO | YES; SCL=NO | YES.
Function.Description2: Options: APPID=numeric variable or constant; APPIDVAR=numeric variable; LEVEL= variable; MACONLY=NO | YES; SCL=NO | YES.

Function.Name: ARMGTID
Function.Definition: Assigns a unique identifier to a transaction class.
Function.Description1: Is a required transaction name that is a SAS character variable or quoted literal value, up to 127 characters.
Function.Description2: Options: APPID=numeric variable or constant; APPIDVAR=numeric variable; LEVEL=numeric constant or variable; MACONLY=NO | YES; METRNAM1-7='aname'; METRDEF1-7=option; SCL=NO | YES; TXNDET='aname'; TXNIDVAR=numeric variable.

Function.Name: ARMINIT
Function.Definition: Starts the initialization of an application.
Function.Description1: Is the required application name that is a SAS character variable or quoted literal value.
Function.Description2: Options: APPIDVAR=numeric variable; APPUSER='aname'; GETID=NO | YES; LEVEL=numeric constant or variable; MACONLY=NO | YES; SCL=NO | YES; TXNIDVAR=numeric variable; TXNDET='aname'; TXNNAME='aname'
Function.Description3: Options: APPIDVAR=numeric variable; APPUSER='aname'; GETID=NO | YES; LEVEL=numeric constant or variable; MACONLY=NO | YES; SCL=NO | YES; TXNIDVAR=numeric variable; TXNDET='aname'; TXNNAME='aname'

Function.Name: ARMJOIN
Function.Definition: Reads the six SAS data sets created by the %ARMPROC macro, and creates SAS data sets and SQL views that contain common information about applications and transactions.
Function.Description1: Options: LIBIN=libref; LIBOUT=libref; TXNDS=YES | NO; UPDTDS=YES | NO.
Function.Description2: Options: LIBIN=libref; LIBOUT=libref; TXNDS=YES | NO; UPDTDS=YES | NO.

Function.Name: ARMPROC
Function.Definition: Processes an input ARM log, and outputs six SAS data sets that contain the gathered information from the log.
Function.Description1: Options: LIB=libref; LOG=pathname; LOGNEW=pathname.
Function.Description2: Options: LIB=libref; LOG=pathname; LOGNEW=pathname.

Function.Name: ARMSTOP
Function.Definition: Specifies the end of a transaction instance.
Description1: Options: LEVEL=numeric constant or variable; MACONLY=NO | YES; METRVAL1-7='aname'; SCL=NO | YES; SHANDLE=numeric variable or constant; SHDLVAR=numeric variable; STATUS=numeric variable or numeric constants.

Options: LEVEL=numeric constant or variable; MACONLY=NO | YES; METRVAL1-7='aname'; SCL=NO | YES; SHANDLE=numeric variable or constant; SHDLVAR=numeric variable; STATUS=numeric variable or numeric constants.

Function.Name: ARMSTRT
Function.Definition: Specifies the start of execution of a transaction instance, and returns a unique handle that is passed to %ARMUPDT and %ARMSTOP.
Function.Description1: Options: APPID=numeric variable or constant; APPIDVAR=numeric variable; CORR=n; GETID=NO | YES; LEVEL=numeric constant or variable; MACONLY=NO | YES; METRVAL1-7='aname'; PARNTVAR=numeric variable; SCL=NO | YES; SHDLVAR=numeric variable; TXNDET='aname'; TXNID=numeric variable or constant; TXNIDVAR=numeric variable; TXNNAME='aname'.
Function.Description2: Options: APPID=numeric variable or constant; APPIDVAR=numeric variable; CORR=n; GETID=NO | YES; LEVEL=numeric constant or variable; MACONLY=NO | YES; METRVAL1-7='aname'; PARNTVAR=numeric variable; SCL=NO | YES; SHDLVAR=numeric variable; TXNDET='aname'; TXNID=numeric variable or constant; TXNIDVAR=numeric variable; TXNNAME='aname'.

Function.Name: ARMUPDT
Function.Definition: Updates a transaction instance that has been previously started.
Function.Description1: Is a SAS character variable or a quoted literal user-supplied data buffer that contains text to pass to the ARM_UPDATE function call. DATA = is not required but highly recommended.
Function.Description2: Options: LEVEL=numeric constant or variable; MACONLY=NO | YES; METRVAL1-7='aname'; SCL=NO | YES; SHANDLE=numeric or constant; SHDLVAR=numeric variable.
Function.Description3: Options: LEVEL=numeric constant or variable; MACONLY=NO | YES; METRVAL1-7='aname'; SCL=NO | YES; SHANDLE=numeric or constant; SHDLVAR=numeric variable.

Function.Name: ABS
Function.Definition: Returns the absolute value.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: ADDR
Function.Definition: Returns the memory address of a variable on a 32-bit platform. The value that is returned is numeric.
Function.Description1: Specifies a variable name.

Function.Name: ADDRLONG
Function.Definition: Returns the memory address of a variable on 32-bit and 64-bit platforms. The return value is a character string that contains the binary representation of the address. To display this value, use the $HEXw. format to convert the binary value to its hexadecimal equivalent.
Function.Description1: Specifies a variable.

Function.Name: AIRY
Function.Definition: Returns the value of the Airy function.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: ALLPERM
Function.Definition: Generates all permutations of the values of several variables in a minimal change order.
Function.Description1: Specifies an integer variable that ranges from 1 to the number of permutations.
Function.Description2: Specifies either all numeric variables, or all character variables that have the same length. The values of these variables are permuted.
Function.Description3: Specifies either all numeric variables, or all character variables that have the same length. The values of these variables are permuted.

Function.Name: ANYALNUM
Function.Definition: Searches a character string for an alphanumeric character, and returns the first position at which the character is found.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression to search.
Function.Description2: Is an optional integer that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

Function.Name: ANYALPHA
Function.Definition: Searches a character string for an alphabetic character, and returns the first position at which the character is found.
Function.Description1: Is the character constant, variable, or expression to search.
Function.Description2: Is an optional integer that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

Function.Name: ANYCNTRL
Function.Definition: Searches a character string for a control character, and returns the first position at which that character is found.
Function.Description1: Is the character constant, variable, or expression to search.
Function.Description2: Is an optional integer that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

Function.Name: ANYDIGIT
Function.Definition: Searches a character string for a digit, and returns the first position at which the digit is found.
Function.Description1: Is the character constant, variable, or expression to search.
Function.Description2: Is an optional integer that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

Function.Name: ANYFIRST
Function.Definition: Searches a character string for a character that is valid as the first character in a SAS variable name under VALIDVARNAME=V7, and returns the first position at which that character is found.
Function.Description1: Is the character constant, variable, or expression to search.
Function.Description2: Is an optional integer that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

Function.Name: ANYGRAPH
Function.Definition: Searches a character string for a graphical character, and returns the first position at which that character is found.
Function.Description1: Is the character constant, variable, or expression to search.
Function.Description2: Is an optional integer that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

Function.Name: ANYLOWER
Function.Definition: Searches a character string for a lowercase letter, and returns the first position at which the letter is found.
Function.Description1: Is the character constant, variable, or expression to search.
Function.Description2: Is an optional integer that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

Function.Name: ANYNAME
Function.Definition: Searches a character string for a character that is valid in a SAS variable name under VALIDVARNAME=V7, and returns the first position at which that character is found.
Function.Description1: Is the character constant, variable, or expression to search.
Function.Description2: Is an optional integer that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

Function.Name: ANYPRINT
Function.Definition: Searches a character string for a printable character, and returns the first position at which that character is found.
Function.Description1: Is the character constant, variable, or expression to search.
Function.Description2: Is an optional integer that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

Function.Name: ANYPUNCT
Function.Definition: Searches a character string for a punctuation character, and returns the first position at which that character is found.
Function.Description1: Is the character constant, variable, or expression to search.
Function.Description2: Is an optional integer that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

Function.Name: ANYSPACE
Function.Definition: Searches a character string for a white-space character (blank, horizontal and vertical tab, carriage return, line feed, and form feed), and returns the first position at which that character is found.
Function.Description1: Is the character constant, variable, or expression to search.
Function.Description2: Is an optional integer that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

Function.Name: ANYUPPER
Function.Definition: Searches a character string for an uppercase letter, and returns the first position at which the letter is found.
Function.Description1: Is the character constant, variable, or expression to search.
Function.Description2: Is an optional integer that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

Function.Name: ANYXDIGIT
Function.Definition: Searches a character string for a hexadecimal character that represents a digit, and returns the first position at which that character is found.
Function.Description1: Is the character constant, variable, or expression to search.
Function.Description2: Is an optional integer that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

Function.Name: ARCOS
Function.Definition: Returns the arccosine.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. Range is between -1 and 1.

Function.Name: ARCOSH
Function.Definition: Returns the inverse hyperbolic cosine.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. Range is greater than or equal to 1.

Function.Name: ARSIN
Function.Definition: Returns the arcsine.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. Range is between -1 and 1.

Function.Name: ARSINH
Function.Definition: Returns the inverse hyperbolic sine.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. Range is from negative infinity to infinity.

Function.Name: ARTANH
Function.Definition: Returns the inverse hyperbolic tangent.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. Range is between -1 to 1.

Function.Name: ATAN
Function.Definition: Returns the arc tangent.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: ATAN2
Function.Definition: Returns the arc tangent of the ratio of two numeric variables.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description2: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: ATTRC
Function.Definition: Returns the value of a character attribute for a SAS data set.
Function.Description1: Specifies the data set identifier that the OPEN function returns.
Function.Description2: Is an attribute name. If attr-name is invalid, a missing value is returned. Valid values are: "CHARSET", "ENCRYPT", "ENGINE", "LABEL", "LIB", "MEM", "MODE", "MTYPE", "SORTEDBY", "SORTLVL", "SORTSEQ", "TYPE".

Function.Name: ATTRN
Function.Definition: Returns the value of a numeric attribute for a SAS data set.
Function.Description1: Specifies the data set identifier that the OPEN function returns.
Function.Description2:
Is the name of the SAS data set attribute whose numeric value
is returned. If the value of attr-name is invalid, a missing
value is returned. The following values are valid: "ALTERPW",
"ANOBS", "ANY", "ARAND", "ARWU", "AUDIT", "AUDIT_DATA",
"AUDIT_BEFORE", "AUDIT_ERROR", "CRDTE", "ICONST", "INDEX",
"ISINDEX", "ISSUBSET", "LRECL", "LRID", "MAXGEN", "MAXRC",
"MODTE", "NDEL", "NEXTGEN", "NLOBS", "NLOBSF", "NOBS", "NVARS",
"PW", "RADIX", "READPW", "TAPE", "WHSTMT", "WRITEPW".

Function.Name: BAND
Function.Definition: Returns the bitwise logical AND of two arguments. If either argument contains a missing value, then the function returns a missing value and sets _ERROR_ equal to 1.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description2: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: BETA
Function.Definition: Returns the value of the beta function.
Function.Description1: Is the first shape parameter, where a > 0.
Function.Description2: Is the second shape parameter, where b > 0.

Function.Name: BETAINV
Function.Definition: Returns a quantile from the beta distribution with shape parameters a and b.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric probability. Range: 0 ≤ p ≤ 1.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric shape parameter. Range: a > 0.
Function.Description3: Is a numeric shape parameter. Range: b > 0.

Function.Name: BLACKCLPRC
Function.Definition: Calculates call prices for European options on futures, based on the Black model.
Function.Description1: Is a non-missing, positive value that specifies exercise price. Specify E and F in the same units.
Function.Description2: Is a non-missing value that specifies time to maturity.
Function.Description3: Is a non-missing, positive value that specifies future price. Specify F and E in the same units.
Function.Description4: Is a non-missing, positive fraction that specifies the risk-free interest rate between the present time and t. Specify a value for r for the same time period as the unit of t.
Function.Description5: Is a non-missing, positive fraction that specifies the volatility (the square root of the variance of r). Specify a value for sigma for the same time period as the unit of t.

Function.Name: BLACKPTPRC
Function.Definition: Calculates put prices for European options on futures, based on the Black model.
Function.Description1: Is a non-missing, positive value that specifies exercise price. Specify E and F in the same units.
Function.Description2: Is a non-missing value that specifies time to maturity.
Function.Description3: Is a non-missing, positive value that specifies future price. Specify F and E in the same units.
Function.Description4: Is a non-missing, positive fraction that specifies the risk-free interest rate between the present time and t. Specify a value for r for the same time period as the unit of t.
Function.Description5: Is a non-missing, positive fraction that specifies the volatility (the square root of the variance of r). Specify a value for sigma for the same time period as the unit of t.

Function.Name: BLKSHCLPRC
Function.Definition: Calculates call prices for European options on stocks, based on the Black-Scholes model.
Function.Description1:
Is a non-missing, positive value that specifies exercise price.

RequirementSpecify E and S in the same units.
Data typeDOUBLE
Function.Description2:
Is  a nonmissing value that specifies the time to maturity, in years.

Data typeINTEGER
Function.Description3:
Is  a nonmissing, positive value that specifies the share price. 
    
RequirementSpecify S and E in the same units.
Data typeDOUBLE
Function.Description4:
Is a nonmissing, positive value that specifies the annualized risk-free interest rate, continuously compounded.

Data typeDOUBLE
Function.Description5:
Is a nonmissing, positive fraction that specifies the volatility of the underlying asset.
Data typeDOUBLE

Function.Name: BLSHIFT
Function.Definition: Returns the bitwise logical left shift of two arguments. If either argument contains a missing value, then the function returns a missing value and sets _ERROR_ equal to 1.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. Range: between 0 and 2³²-1 inclusive.
Function.Description2: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. Range: 0 to 31, inclusive.

Function.Name: BNOT
Function.Definition: Returns the bitwise logical NOT of an argument.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. Range: between 0 and 2³²-1 inclusive.

Function.Name: BOR
Function.Definition: Returns the bitwise logical OR of two arguments. If either argument contains a missing value, then the function returns a missing value and sets _ERROR_ equal to 1.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. Range: between 0 and 2³²-1 inclusive.
Function.Description2: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. Range: between 0 and 2³²-1 inclusive.

Function.Name: BRSHIFT
Function.Definition: Returns the bitwise logical right shift of two arguments. If either argument contains a missing value, then the function returns a missing value and sets _ERROR_ equal to 1.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. Range: between 0 and 2³²-1 inclusive.
Function.Description2: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. Range: 0 to 31, inclusive.

Function.Name: BXOR
Function.Definition: Returns the bitwise logical EXCLUSIVE OR of two arguments. If either argument contains a missing value, then the function returns a missing value and sets _ERROR_ equal to 1.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. Range: between 0 and 2³²-1 inclusive.
Function.Description2: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. Range: between 0 and 2³²-1 inclusive.

Function.Name: BYTE
Function.Definition: Returns one character in the ASCII or the EBCDIC collating sequence.
Function.Description1: Specifies an integer that represents a specific ASCII or EBCDIC character. Range: 0-255.

Function.Name: ALLCOMB
Function.Definition: Generates all combinations of the values of n variables taken k at a time in a minimal change order.
Function.Description1: Specifies an integer variable that is assigned from 1 to the number of combinations in a loop.
Function.Description2: Specifies either all numeric variables, or all character variables that have the same length. The values of these variables are permuted.

Function.Name: ALLCOMBI
Function.Definition: Generates all combinations of the indices of n objects taken k at a time in a minimal change order.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the total number of objects.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the number of objects in each combination.
Function.Description3: Is a numeric variable that contains indices of the objects in the returned combination. Indices are integers between 1 and N inclusive.
Function.Description4: Is a numeric variable in which ALLCOMBI returns the value of the index that was added.
Function.Description5: Is a numeric variable in which ALLCOMBI returns the value of the index that was removed.

Function.Name: CATS*1
Function.Definition: Removes leading and trailing blanks, and returns a concatenated character string.
Function.Description1: Specifies a SAS character string.

Function.Name: CATS*2
Function.Definition: Removes leading and trailing blanks, and returns a concatenated character string.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character variable.
Function.Description2: Specifies a constant, variable, or expression, either character or numeric. If item is numeric, then its value is converted to a character string using the BESTw. format. In this case, SAS does not write a note to the log.

Function.Name: CATT*1
Function.Definition: Removes trailing blanks, and returns a concatenated character string.
Function.Description1: Specifies a SAS character string.

Function.Name: CATT*2
Function.Definition: Removes trailing blanks, and returns a concatenated character string.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character variable.
Function.Description2: Specifies a constant, variable, or expression, either character or numeric. If item is numeric, then its value is converted to a character string using the BESTw. format. In this case, SAS does not write a note to the log.

Function.Name: CATX*1
Function.Definition: Removes leading and trailing blanks, inserts delimiters, and returns a concatenated character string.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character string that is used as a delimiter between concatenated strings.
Function.Description2: Specifies a constant, variable, or expression, either character or numeric. If item is numeric, then its value is converted to a character string using the BESTw. format. In this case, SAS does not write a note to the log.

Function.Name: CATX*2
Function.Definition: Removes leading and trailing blanks, inserts delimiters, and returns a concatenated character string.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character string that is used as a delimiter between concatenated strings.
Function.Description2: Specifies a character variable.
Function.Description3: Specifies a constant, variable, or expression, either character or numeric. If item is numeric, then its value is converted to a character string using the BESTw. format. In this case, SAS does not write a note to the log.

Function.Name: COMPCOST
Function.Definition: Sets the costs of operations for later use by the COMPGED function.
Function.Description1: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies an operation that is performed by the COMPGED function.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the cost of the operation that is indicated by the preceding argument. Must be an integer that ranges from -32767 to 32767, or a missing value.
Function.Description3: Optional additional operation-value pairs.

Function.Name: EXECUTE
Function.Definition: Resolves the argument, and issues the resolved value for execution at the next step boundary.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character expression, a DATA step variable, or a character constant (enclosed in quotation marks) that yields a macro invocation or a SAS statement.

Function.Name: GRAYCODE*1
Function.Definition: Generates all subsets of n items in a minimal change order.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric variable. Initializing k to a negative number causes CALL GRAYCODE to initialize the subset to be empty.
Function.Description2: Specifies numeric variables that have values of 0 or 1 which are updated when CALL GRAYCODE is executed.

Function.Name: GRAYCODE*2
Function.Definition: Generates all subsets of n items in a minimal change order.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric variable. Initializing k to a negative number causes CALL GRAYCODE to initialize the subset to be empty.
Function.Description2: Specifies a character variable that has a length of at least n characters. The first n characters indicate which items are in the subset.
Function.Description3: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. By default, n is the length of character-variable.
Function.Description4: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression. The default value is "IO." The first character is used to indicate that an item is in the subset. The second character is used to indicate that an item is out of the subset.

Function.Name: IS8601_CONVERT
Function.Definition: Converts an ISO 8601 interval to datetime and duration values, or converts datetime and duration values to an ISO 8601 interval.
Function.Description1:
Specifies a keyword in single quotation marks that indicates whether the source for the conversion is an interval, a datetime and duration value, or a duration value.

      Convert-from can have one of the following values:
      'dn' specifies a date value, where n is a value from 1 to 6. The default value is 1. N is the number
          of components in the from-variables or the to-variables arguments. The following components are valid:
          •year
          •month
          •day
          •hour
          •minute
          •second
      'dtn' specifies a datetime value, where n is a value from 1 to 6. The default value is 1. N is the number 
          of components in the from-variables or the to-variables arguments. The following components are valid:
          •year
          •month
          •day
          •hour
          •minute
          •second
      'dt/dt' specifies that the source value for the conversion is a datetime/datetime value.
      'dt/du' specifies that the source value for the conversion is a datetime/duration value.
      'dun' specifies that the source value for the conversion is a duration value, where n is a value from 
          1 to 6. The default value is 1. N is the number of components in the from-variables or the to-variables 
          arguments. The following components are valid:
          •year
          •month
          •day
          •hour
          •minute
          •second
      'du/dt' specifies that the source value for the conversion is a duration/datetime value.
      'intvl' specifies that the source value for the conversion is an interval value.
Function.Description2:
Specifies a keyword in single quotation marks that indicates the results of the conversion.

      Convert-to can have one of the following values:
      'dn' specifies a date value, where n is a value from 1 to 6. The default value is 1. N is the number
          of components in the from-variables or to-variables arguments. The following components are valid:
          •year
          •month
          day
          •hour
          •minute
          •second
      'dtn' specifies a datetime value, where n is a value from 1 to 6. The default value is 1. N is the number 
          of components in the from-variables or the to-variables arguments. The following components are valid:
          •year
          •month
          •day
          •hour
          •minute
          •second
      'dt/dt' specifies to create a datetime/datetime interval.
      'dt/du' specifies to create a datetime/duration interval.
      'dun' specifies to create a duration, where n is a value from 1 to 6. The default value is 1. N is the number 
          of components in the from-variables or the to-variables arguments. The following components are valid:
          •year
          •month
          •day
          •hour
          •minute
          •second
      'du/dt' specifies to create a duration/datetime interval.
      'end' specifies to create a value that is the ending datetime or duration of an interval value.
      'intvl' specifies to create an interval value.
      'start' specifies to create a value that is the beginning datetime or duration of an interval value.
Function.Description3: Specifies one or two variables that contain the source value. Specify one variable for an interval value and two variables, one each, for datetime and duration values.
Function.Description4: Specifies one or two variables that contain converted values. Specify one variable for in interval value and two variables, one each, for datetime and duration values.
Function.Description5: Specifies date or time component values to use when a month, day, or time component is omitted from an interval, datetime, or duration value. date-time-replacements is specified as a series of numbers separated by a comma to represent, in this order, the year, month, day, hour, minute, or second.

Function.Name: LABEL
Function.Definition: Assigns a variable label to a specified character variable.
Function.Description1: Specifies any SAS variable. If variable-1 does not have a label, the variable name is assigned as the value of variable-2.
Function.Description2: Specifies any SAS character variable. Variable labels can be up to 256 characters long; therefore, the length of variable-2 should be at least 256 characters to avoid truncating variable labels.

Function.Name: LEXCOMB
Function.Definition: Generates all distinct combinations of the non-missing values of n variables taken k at a time in lexicographic order.
Function.Description1: Specifies an integer value that is assigned values from 1 to the number of combinations in a loop.
Function.Description2: Specifies an integer constant, variable, or expression between 1 and n, inclusive, that specifies the number of items in each combination.
Function.Description3: Specifies either all numeric variables, or all character variables that have the same length. The values of these variables are permuted.

Function.Name: LEXCOMBI
Function.Definition: Generates all combinations of the indices of n objects taken k at a time in lexicographic order.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the total number of objects.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the number of objects in each combination.
Function.Description3: Is a numeric variable that contains indices of the objects in the combination that is returned. Indices are integers between 1 and n, inclusive.

Function.Name: LEXPERK
Function.Definition: Generates all distinct permutations of the non-missing values of n variables taken k at a time in lexicographic order.
Function.Description1: Specifies an integer variable that is assigned a value from 1 to the number of permutations in a loop.
Function.Description2: Specifies an integer constant, variable, or expression between 1 and n, inclusive, that specifies the number of items in each permutation.
Function.Description3: Specifies either all numeric variables, or all character variables that have the same length. The values of these variables are permuted.

Function.Name: LEXPERM
Function.Definition: Generates all distinct permutations of the non-missing values of several variables in lexicographic order.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric variable that has an integer value that ranges from 1 to the number of permutations.
Function.Description2: Specifies either all numeric variables, or all character variables that have the same length. The values of these variables are permuted by LEXPERM.

Function.Name: LOGISTIC
Function.Definition: Applies the logistic function to each argument.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric variable.

Function.Name: MISSING
Function.Definition: Assigns missing values to the specified character or numeric variables.
Function.Description1: Specifies the name of SAS character or numeric variables.

Function.Name: MODULE
Function.Definition:
Calls an external routine without any return code. 
    
Syntax: CALL MODULE(<control-string,> module-name <, argument-1, ..., argument-n>); 

Required Argument:
module-name - is the name of the external module to use.

Optional Arguments:
control-string
is an optional control string whose first character must be an asterisk (*), followed by any combination of the following characters:
  I
  prints the hexadecimal representations of all arguments to the CALL MODULE routine. You can use this option to help diagnose problems that are caused by incorrect arguments or attribute tables. If you specify the I option, the E option is implied.
  E
  prints detailed error messages. Without the E option (or the I option, which supersedes it), the only error message that the CALL MODULE routine generates is "Invalid argument to function," which is usually not enough information to determine the cause of the error. The E option is useful for a production environment, whereas the I option is preferable for a development or debugging environment.
  H
  provides brief information about the syntax of the CALL MODULE routine, the attribute file format, and suggested SAS formats and informats. 

argument - is one or more arguments to pass to the requested routine.

Details
Working with Attribute Tables
  The CALL MODULE routine executes a routine that resides in an external library. The routine uses the 
  required module-name argument to identify the name of the library, as well as optional arguments.
  
  CALL MODULE builds a parameter list by using the information in the arguments and a routine description 
  and argument attribute table that you define in a separate file. The attribute table is a sequential text 
  file that contains descriptions of the routines that you can invoke with the CALL MODULE routine. The 
  purpose of the table is to define how CALL MODULE interprets its supplied arguments when it builds a 
  parameter list to pass to the external routine. The attribute table contains a description for each 
  external routine that you intend to call, and descriptions of each argument associated with that routine.
  
  Before you invoke CALL MODULE, you must define the fileref of SASCBTBL to point to the external file 
  that contains the attribute table. You can name the file whatever you want when you create it. In this way, 
  you use SAS variables and formats as arguments to CALL MODULE and ensure that these arguments are 
  properly converted before being passed to the external routine. If you do not define this fileref, CALL 
  MODULE calls the requested routine without altering the arguments. 
  
Using Special Formats with the CALL MODULE Routine
Numeric Alignment
By default, the CALL MODULE routine forces numeric alignment for fields that are defined with the IBw., 
PIBw., and RBw. formats within the SASCBTBL table. Therefore, the fields are padded to provide an 
appropriate 4-byte or 8-byte boundary. Most current compilers expect this alignment.

New formats were created specifically for the CALL MODULE routine to accommodate routines that were 
built with a compiler that does not expect alignment. These new formats are IBUNALNw., PIBUNALNw., 
and RBUNALNw. Use these formats instead of the IBw., PIBw., and RBw. formats.
Function.Description1:
Is an optional control string whose first character must be an asterisk (*), followed by any
      combination of the following characters:
      I prints the hexadecimal representations of all arguments to the CALL MODULE routine.
      E prints detailed error messages
      H provides brief information about the syntax of the CALL MODULE routine, the attribute 
      file format, and suggested SAS formats and informats.
Function.Description2: Is the name of the external module to use.
Function.Description3: Is one or more arguments to pass to the requested routine.

Function.Name: POKE
Function.Definition: Writes a value directly into memory on a 32-bit platform.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that contains a value to write into memory.
Function.Description2: Specifies a character string that contains the virtual address of the data that the CALL POKE routine alters.
Function.Description3: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression that contains the number of bytes to write from the source to the address that is indicated by pointer.
Function.Description4: Specifies that the value of source is stored as a floating-point number. The value of floating-point can be any number.

Function.Name: POKELONG
Function.Definition: Writes a value directly into memory on 32-bit and 64-bit platforms.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that contains a value to write into memory.
Function.Description2: Specifies a character string that contains the virtual address of the data that the CALL POKELONG routine alters.
Function.Description3: Specifies a numeric SAS expression that contains the number of bytes to write from the source to the address that is indicated by the pointer.
Function.Description4: Specifies that the value of source is stored as a floating-point number. The value of floating-point can be any number.

Function.Name: PRXDEBUG
Function.Definition: Enables Perl regular expressions in a DATA step to send debugging output to the SAS log.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. If the value of on-off is positive and non-zero, then debugging is turned on. If the value of on-off is zero, then debugging is turned off.

Function.Name: PRXFREE
Function.Definition: Frees memory that was allocated for a Perl regular expression.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric variable with a value that is the identification number that is returned by the PRXPARSE function. regular-expression-id is set to missing if the call to the PRXFREE routine occurs without error.

Function.Name: PRXNEXT
Function.Definition: Returns the position and length of a substring that matches a pattern, and iterates over multiple matches within one string.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric variable with a value that is the identification number that is returned by the PRXPARSE function.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric variable that specifies the position at which to start the pattern matching in source.
Function.Description3: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the last character to use in source. If stop is -1, then the last character is the last non-blank character in source.
Function.Description4: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that you want to search.
Function.Description5: Is a numeric variable with a returned value that is the position in source at which the pattern begins. If no match is found, CALL PRXNEXT returns zero.
Function.Description6: Is a numeric variable with a returned value that is the length of the string that is matched by the pattern. If no match is found, CALL PRXNEXT returns zero.

Function.Name: PRXPOSN
Function.Definition: Returns the start position and length for a capture buffer.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric variable with a value that is a pattern identifier that is returned by the PRXPARSE function.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression with a value that identifies the capture buffer from which to retrieve the start position and length.
Function.Description3: Is a numeric variable with a returned value that is the position at which the capture buffer is found.
Function.Description4: Is a numeric variable with a returned value that is the position at which the capture buffer is found.

Function.Name: PRXSUBSTR
Function.Definition: Returns the position and length of a substring that matches a pattern.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric variable with a value that is an identification number that is returned by the PRXPARSE function.
Function.Description2: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that you want to search.
Function.Description3: Is a numeric variable with a returned value that is the position in source where the pattern begins. If no match is found, CALL PRXSUBSTR returns zero.
Function.Description4: Is a numeric variable with a returned value that is the length of the substring that is matched by the pattern. If no match is found, CALL PRXSUBSTR returns zero.

Function.Name: RANBIN*1
Function.Definition: Returns a random variate from a binomial distribution.
Function.Description1: Is an integer. If seed is less than or equal to 0, the time of day is used to initialize the seed stream. Range: seed < 2³¹ - 1.
Function.Description2: Is an integer number of independent Bernoulli trials. Range: n > 0.
Function.Description3: Is a numeric probability of success parameter. Range: 0 < p < 1.

Function.Name: RANBIN*2
Function.Definition: Returns a random variate from a binomial distribution.
Function.Description1: Is the seed value. A new value for seed is returned each time CALL RANBIN is executed. Range: seed < 2³¹ - 1.
Function.Description2: Is an integer number of independent Bernoulli trials. Range: n > 0.
Function.Description3: Is a numeric probability of success parameter. Range: 0 < p < 1.
Function.Description4: Is a numeric SAS variable. A new value for the random variate x is returned each time CALL RANBIN is executed.

Function.Name: RANCAU*1
Function.Definition: Returns a random variate from a Cauchy distribution.
Function.Description1: Is an integer. If seed is less than or equal to 0, the time of day is used to initialize the seed stream.  Range: seed < 2³¹ - 1.

Function.Name: RANCAU*2
Function.Definition: Returns a random variate from a Cauchy distribution.
Function.Description1: Is the seed value. A new value for seed is returned each time CALL RANCAU is executed. Range: seed < 2³¹ - 1.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric SAS variable. A new value for the random variate x is returned each time CALL RANCAU is executed.

Function.Name: RANEXP*2

Function.Description1: Is the seed value. A new value for seed is returned each time CALL RANEXP is executed. Range: seed < 2³¹ - 1.

Function.Name: RANGAM*2
Function.Definition: Returns a random variate from a gamma distribution.
Function.Description1: Is the seed value. A new value for seed is returned each time CALL RANGAM is executed. Range: seed < 2³¹ - 1.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric shape parameter. Range: a > 0.
Function.Description3: Is a numeric variable. A new value for the random variate x is returned each time CALL RANGAM is executed.

Function.Name: RANNOR*1
Function.Definition: Returns a random variate from a normal distribution.
Function.Description1: Is an integer. If seed is less than or equal to 0, the time of day is used to initialize the seed stream.  Range: seed < 2³¹ - 1.

Function.Name: RANNOR*2
Function.Definition: Returns a random variate from a normal distribution.
Function.Description1: Is the seed value. A new value for seed is returned each time CALL RANNOR is executed. Range: seed < 2³¹ - 1.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric variable. A new value for the random variate x is returned each time CALL RANNOR is executed.

Function.Name: RANPERK
Function.Definition: Randomly permutes the values of the arguments, and returns a permutation of k out of n values.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric variable that contains the random number seed.
Function.Description2: Is the number of values that you want to have in the random permutation.
Function.Description3: Specifies all numeric variables, or all character variables that have the same length. K values of these variables are randomly permuted.
Function.Description4: Specifies all numeric variables, or all character variables that have the same length. K values of these variables are randomly permuted.

Function.Name: RANPERM
Function.Definition: Randomly permutes the values of the arguments.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric variable that contains the random number seed.
Function.Description2: Specifies all numeric variables or all character variables that have the same length. The values of these variables are randomly permuted.
Function.Description3: Specifies all numeric variables or all character variables that have the same length. The values of these variables are randomly permuted.

Function.Name: RANPOI*1
Function.Definition: Returns a random variate from a Poisson distribution.
Function.Description1: Is an integer. If seed is less than or equal to 0, the time of day is used to initialize the seed stream.  Range: seed < 2³¹ - 1.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric mean parameter greater than or equal to zero.

Function.Name: RANPOI*2
Function.Definition: Returns a random variate from a Poisson distribution.
Function.Description1: Is the seed value. A new value for seed is returned each time CALL RANPOI is executed. Range: seed < 2³¹ - 1.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric mean parameter greater than or equal to zero.
Function.Description3: Is a numeric variable. A new value for the random variate x is returned each time CALL RANPOI is executed.

Function.Name: RANTBL*1

Function.Name: RANTBL*2
Function.Definition: Returns a random variate from a tabled probability distribution.
Function.Description1: Is the seed value. A new value for seed is returned each time CALL RANTBL is executed. Range: seed < 2³¹ - 1.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric SAS value.
Function.Description3: Is a numeric SAS variable. A new value for the random variate x is returned each time CALL RANTBL is executed.

Function.Description1: Is an integer. If seed is less than or equal to 0, the time of day is used to initialize the seed stream.  Range: seed < 2³¹ - 1.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric SAS value. Range: 0 < h < 1.

Function.Name: RANTRI*2
Function.Definition: Returns a random variate from a triangular distribution.
Function.Description1: Is the seed value. A new value for seed is returned each time CALL RANTRI is executed. Range: seed < 2³¹ - 1.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric SAS value. Range: 0 < h < 1.

Function.Name: RANUNI*1

Function.Definition: Returns a random variate from a uniform distribution.
Function.Description1: Is the seed value. A new value for seed is returned each time CALL RANUNI is executed. Range: seed < 2³¹ - 1.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric variable. A new value for the random variate x is returned each time CALL RANUNI is executed.

Function.Name: SET
Function.Definition: Links SAS data set variables to DATA step or macro variables that have the same name and data type.
Function.Description1: Is the identifier that is assigned by the OPEN function when the data set is opened.

Function.Name: SOFTMAX
Function.Definition: Returns the softmax value.
Function.Description1: Is numeric.

Function.Name: SORTC
Function.Definition: Sorts the values of character arguments.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character variable.

Function.Name: SORTN
Function.Definition: Sorts the values of numeric arguments.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric variable.

Function.Name: STDIZE
Function.Definition: Standardizes the values of one or more variables.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character expression whose values can be uppercase, lowercase, or mixed case letters. Leading and trailing blanks are ignored.
Function.Description2: Is numeric. These values will be standardized according to the method that you use.
Function.Description3: Is numeric. These values will be standardized according to the method that you use.

Function.Name: STREAMINIT
Function.Definition: Specifies a seed value to use for subsequent random number generation by the RAND function.
Function.Description1: Is an integer seed value.  Range: seed < 2³¹ - 1.

Function.Name: SYMPUT
Function.Definition: Assigns DATA step information to a macro variable.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character expression that identifies the macro variable that is assigned a value. If the macro variable does not exist, the routine creates it.
Function.Description2: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that contains the value that is assigned.

Function.Name: SYMPUTX
Function.Definition: Assigns a value to a macro variable, and removes both leading and trailing blanks.
Function.Description1: A character constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description2: Specifies a character or numeric constant, variable, or expression. If value is numeric, SAS converts the value to a character string using the BEST. format and does not issue a note to the SAS log.
Function.Description3: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression. The following values are valid as the first non-blank character in symbol-table: G (global symbol table), L (local symbol table), F (any symbol table).

Function.Name: SYSTEM
Function.Definition: Submits an operating environment command for execution.
Function.Description1: Specifies any of the following: a system command that is enclosed in quotation marks (character string), an expression whose value is a system command, or the name of a character variable whose value is a system command that is executed.

Function.Name: VNEXT
Function.Definition: Returns the name, type, and length of a variable that is used in a DATA step.
Function.Description1: Is a character variable that is updated by the CALL VNEXT routine.
Function.Description2: Is a character variable whose input value is ignored. The value that is returned is "N" or "C".
Function.Description3: Is a numeric variable. The input value of varlength is ignored.

Function.Name: CAT
Function.Definition: Does not remove leading or trailing blanks, and returns a concatenated character string.
Function.Description1: Specifies a constant, variable, or expression, either character or numeric. If item is numeric, then its value is converted to a character string by using the BESTw. format.

Function.Name: CATQ
Function.Definition: Concatenates character or numeric values by using a delimiter to separate items and by adding quotation marks to strings that contain the delimiter.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression in which each non-blank character modifies the action of the CATQ function. Blanks are ignored.
Function.Description2: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that is used as a delimiter between concatenated strings. If you specify this argument, then you must also specify the D modifier.
Function.Description3: Specifies a constant, variable, or expression, either character or numeric. If item is numeric, then its value is converted to a character string by using the BESTw. format.

Function.Name: CDF
Function.Definition:
Returns a value from a cumulative probability distribution.

Syntax: CDF(distribution, quantile <, parameter-1, …, parameter-k>)
Function.Description1:
Is a character constant, variable, or expression that identifies the distribution. Valid distributions are as follows:

      Bernoulli distribuion: BERNOULLI
      Beta distribuion: BETA
      Binomial distribuion: BINOMIAL
      Cauchy distribuion: CAUCHY
      Chi-Square distribuion: CHISQUARE
      Conway-Maxwell-Poisson distribuion: CMP
      Exponential distribuion: EXPONENTIAL
      F distribuion: F
      Gamma distribuion: GAMMA
      Generalized Poisson distribuion: GENPOISSON
      Geometric distribuion: GEOMETRIC
      Hypergeometric distribuion: HYPERGEOMETRIC
      Laplace distribuion: LAPLACE
      Logistic distribuion: LOGISTIC
      Lognormal distribuion: LOGNORMAL
      Negative binomial distribuion: NEGBINOMIAL
      Normal distribuion: NORMAL|GAUSS
      Normal mixture distribuion: NORMALMIX
      Pareto distribuion: PARETO
      Poisson distribuion: POISSON
      T distribuion: T
      Tweedie distribuion: TWEEDIE
      Uniform distribuion: UNIFORM
      Wald (inverse Gaussian) distribuion: WALD|IGAUSS
      Weibull distribuion: WEIBULL

Note: Except for T, F, and NORMALMIX, you can minimally identify any distribution by its first four characters.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the value of the random variable.
Function.Description3: Are optional constants, variables, or expressions that specify shape, location, or scale parameters appropriate for the specific distribution.

Function.Name: CEIL
Function.Definition: Returns the smallest integer that is greater than or equal to the argument, fuzzed to avoid unexpected floating-point results.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: CEILZ
Function.Definition: Returns the smallest integer that is greater than or equal to the argument, using zero fuzzing.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: CEXIST
Function.Definition: Verifies the existence of a SAS catalog or SAS catalog entry.
Function.Description1: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies a SAS catalog, or the name of an entry in a catalog. If the entry value is a one- or two-level name, then it is assumed to be the name of a catalog.
Function.Description2: tests whether the catalog can be opened for updating.

Function.Name: CHAR
Function.Definition: Returns a single character from a specified position in a character string.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description2: Is an integer that specifies the position of the character to be returned.

Function.Name: CHOOSEC
Function.Definition: Returns a character value that represents the results of choosing from a list of arguments.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description2: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression. The value of this argument is returned by the CHOOSEC function.
Function.Description3: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression. The value of this argument is returned by the CHOOSEC function.

Function.Name: CHOOSEN
Function.Definition: Returns a numeric value that represents the results of choosing from a list of arguments.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description2: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. The value of this argument is returned by the CHOOSEN function.
Function.Description3: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. The value of this argument is returned by the CHOOSEN function.

Function.Name: CINV
Function.Definition: Returns a quantile from the chi-square distribution.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric probability. Range: 0 ≤ p < 1
Function.Description2: Is a numeric degrees of freedom parameter. Range: df > 0.
Function.Description3: Is an optional numeric noncentrality parameter. Range: nc ≥ 0.

Function.Name: CLOSE
Function.Definition: Closes a SAS data set.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric variable that specifies the data set identifier that the OPEN function returns.

Function.Name: CMISS
Function.Definition: Counts the number of missing arguments.
Function.Description1: Specifies a constant, variable, or expression. Argument can be either a character value or a numeric value.
Function.Description2: Specifies a constant, variable, or expression. Argument can be either a character value or a numeric value.

Function.Name: CNONCT
Function.Definition: Returns the noncentrality parameter from a chi-square distribution.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric random variable greater than or equal to zero.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric degrees of freedom parameter. Range:  df > 0.
Function.Description3: Is a probability. Raange: 0 < prob < 1.

Function.Name: COALESCE
Function.Definition: Returns the first non-missing value from a list of numeric arguments.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description2: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: COALESCEC
Function.Definition: Returns the first non-missing value from a list of character arguments.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description2: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: COLLATE*1
Function.Definition: Returns a character string in ASCII or EBCDIC collating sequence.
Function.Description1: Specifies the numeric position in the collating sequence of the first character to be returned.
Function.Description2: Specifies the numeric position in the collating sequence of the last character to be returned.

Function.Name: COLLATE*2
