Function.Description1: Specifies the numeric position in the collating sequence of the first character to be returned.
Function.Description2: Specifies the number of characters in the collating sequence. Default value: 200.

Function.Name: COMB
Function.Definition: Computes the number of combinations of n elements taken r at a time.
Function.Description1: Is a non-negative integer that represents the total number of elements from which the sample is chosen.
Function.Description2: Is a non-negative integer that represents the number of chosen elements. Range: r ≤ n.

Function.Name: COMPARE
Function.Definition: Returns the position of the leftmost character by which two strings differ, or returns 0 if there is no difference.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description2: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description3: Specifies a character string that can modify the action of the COMPARE function. You can use one or more of the following characters as a valid modifier: i or I (to ignore case), l or L (to remove leading blanks), n or N (to remove quotaion marks), : (to truncate the longer of string-1 or string-2 to the length of the shorter string, or to one, whichever is greater.

Function.Name: COMPBL
Function.Definition: Removes multiple blanks from a character string.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression to compress.

Function.Name: COMPGED
Function.Definition: Returns the generalized edit distance between two strings.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description2: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description3: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression. If the actual generalized edit distance is greater than the value of cutoff, the value that is returned is equal to the value of cutoff.
Function.Description4: Specifies a character string that can modify the action of the COMPGED function. You can use one or more of the following characters as a valid modifier:  i or I (to ignore case), l or L (to remove leading blanks), n or N (to remove quotaion marks), : (to truncate the longer of string-1 or string-2 to the length of the shorter string, or to one, whichever is greater.

Function.Name: COMPLEV
Function.Definition: Returns the Levenshtein edit distance between two strings.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description2: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description3: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. If the actual Levenshtein edit distance is greater than the value of cutoff, the value that is returned is equal to the value of cutoff.
Function.Description4: Specifies a character string that can modify the action of the COMPLEV function. You can use one or more of the following characters as a valid modifier: i or I (to ignore case), l or L (to remove leading blanks), n or N (to remove quotaion marks), : (to truncate the longer of string-1 or string-2 to the length of the shorter string, or to one, whichever is greater.

Function.Name: COMPOUND
Function.Definition: Returns compound interest parameters.
Function.Description1: Is numeric, and specifies the initial amount. Range: a ≥ 0.
Function.Description2: Is numeric, and specifies the future amount (at the end of n periods). Range: f ≥ 0.
Function.Description3: Is numeric, and specifies the periodic interest rate expressed as a fraction. Range: r ≥ 0.
Function.Description4: Is an integer, and specifies the number of compounding periods. Range: n ≥ 0.

Function.Name: COMPRESS
Function.Definition: Returns a character string with specified characters removed from the original string.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression from which specified characters will be removed.
Function.Description2: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that initializes a list of characters.
Function.Description3: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression in which each non-blank character modifies the action of the COMPRESS function. Blanks are ignored.

Function.Name: CONSTANT
Function.Definition: Computes machine and mathematical constants.
Function.Description1: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that identifies the constant to be returned. Valid constants are as follows: 'E', 'EULER', 'PI', 'EXACTINT', 'BIG', 'LOGBIG', 'SQRTBIG', 'SMALL', 'LOGSMALL', 'SQRTSMALL', 'MACEPS', 'LOGMACEPS', 'SQRTMACEPS'.
Function.Description2: Is an optional numeric parameter. Some of the constants specified in constant have an optional argument that alters the functionality of the CONSTANT function.

Function.Name: CONVX
Function.Definition: Returns the convexity for an enumerated cash flow.
Function.Description1: Specifies the effective per-period yield-to-maturity, expressed as a fraction. Range: 0 < y < 1.
Function.Description2: Specifies the frequency of cash flows per period. Range: f > 0.
Function.Description3: Specifies a list of cash flows.

Function.Name: CONVXP
Function.Definition: Returns the convexity for a periodic cash flow stream, such as a bond.
Function.Description1: Specifies the par value. Range: A > 0
Function.Description2: Specifies the nominal per-period coupon rate, expressed as a fraction. Range: 0 ≤ c < 1.
Function.Description3: Specifies the number of coupons per period. n > 0 and is an integer.
Function.Description4: Specifies the number of remaining coupons. Range: K > 0
Function.Description5: Specifies the time from the present date to the first coupon date, expressed in terms of the number of periods. Range: 0 < ko ≤ 1/n.
Function.Description6: Specifies the nominal per-period yield-to-maturity, expressed as a fraction. Range: y > 0.

Function.Name: COS
Function.Definition: Returns the cosine.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression and is expressed in radians.

Function.Name: COSH
Function.Definition: Returns the hyperbolic cosine.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: COUNT
Function.Definition: Counts the number of times that a specified substring appears within a character string.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression in which substrings are to be counted. Enclose a literal string of characters in quotation marks.
Function.Description2: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the substring of characters to count in string. Enclose a literal string of characters in quotation marks.
Function.Description3: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies one or more modifiers. The following modifiers can be in uppercase or lowercase: i (ignores character case), t (trims trailing blanks).

Function.Name: COUNTC
Function.Definition: Counts the number of characters in a string that appear or do not appear in a list of characters.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression in which characters are counted. Enclose a literal string of characters in quotation marks.
Function.Description2: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that initializes a list of characters. COUNTC counts characters in this list, provided that you do not specify the V modifier in the modifier argument.
Function.Description3: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression in which each non-blank character modifies the action of the COUNTC function. Blanks are ignored.

Function.Name: COUNTW
Function.Definition: Counts the number of words in a character string.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression in which words are counted.
Function.Description2: Specifies an optional character constant, variable, or expression that initializes a list of characters. The characters in this list are the delimiters that separate words, provided that you do not use the K modifier in the modifier argument. If you specify the K modifier, then all characters that are not in this list are delimiters.
Function.Description3: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression in which each non-blank character modifies the action of the COUNTW function.

Function.Name: CSS
Function.Definition: Returns the corrected sum of squares.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. At least one nonmissing argument is required.

Function.Name: CUROBS
Function.Definition: Returns the observation number of the current observation.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric value that specifies the data set identifier that the OPEN function returns.

Function.Name: CV
Function.Definition: Returns the coefficient of variation. At least two arguments are required.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description2: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: DACCDB
Function.Definition: Returns the accumulated declining balance depreciation.
Function.Description1: Is numeric, the period for which the calculation is to be done. For noninteger p arguments, the depreciation is prorated between the two consecutive time periods that precede and follow the fractional period.
Function.Description2: Is numeric, the depreciable initial value of the asset.
Function.Description3: Is numeric, the lifetime of the asset. Range: y > 0.
Function.Description4: Is numeric, the rate of depreciation expressed as a decimal. Range: r > 0.

Function.Name: DACCDBSL
Function.Definition: Returns the accumulated declining balance with conversion to a straight-line depreciation.
Function.Description1: Is numeric, the period for which the calculation is to be done.
Function.Description2: Is numeric, the depreciable initial value of the asset.
Function.Description3: Is an integer, the lifetime of the asset. Range y > 0.
Function.Description4: Is numeric, the rate of depreciation that is expressed as a fraction. Range r > 0.

Function.Name: DACCSL
Function.Definition: Returns the accumulated straight-line depreciation.
Function.Description1: Is numeric, the period for which the calculation is to be done. For fractional p, the depreciation is prorated between the two consecutive time periods that precede and follow the fractional period.
Function.Description2: Is numeric, the depreciable initial value of the asset.
Function.Description3: Is numeric, the lifetime of the asset. Range y > 0.

Function.Name: DACCSYD
Function.Definition: Returns the accumulated sum-of-years-digits depreciation.
Function.Description1: Is numeric, the period for which the calculation is to be done. For noninteger p arguments, the depreciation is prorated between the two consecutive time periods that precede and follow the fractional period.
Function.Description2: Is numeric, the depreciable initial value of the asset.
Function.Description3: Is numeric, the lifetime of the asset. Range y > 0.

Function.Name: DACCTAB
Function.Definition: Returns the accumulated depreciation from specified tables.
Function.Description1: Is numeric, the period for which the calculation is to be done. For noninteger p arguments, the depreciation is prorated between the two consecutive time periods that precede and follow the fractional period.
Function.Description2: Is numeric, the depreciable initial value of the asset.
Function.Description3: Are numeric, the fractions of depreciation for each time period with t1+t2+...tn≤1.

Function.Name: DAIRY
Function.Definition: Returns the derivative of the AIRY function.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: DATDIF
Function.Definition: Returns the number of days between two dates.
Function.Description1: Specifies a SAS date value that identifies the starting date. If sdate falls at the end of a month, then SAS treats the date as if it were the last day of a 30-day month.
Function.Description2: Specifies a SAS date value that identifies the ending date. If sdate falls at the end of a month, then SAS treats the date as if it were the last day of a 30-day month.
Function.Description3: Identifies a character constant or variable that describes how SAS calculates the date difference in the securities industry. The following character strings are valid: '30/360' (30-day month and a 360-day year), 'ACT/ACT' (uses actual number of days between dates), 'ACT/360' (uses actual number of calendar days in a month, and 360 days for the year), 'ACT/365' (uses actual number of calendar days for each month, and 365 days for the year).

Function.Name: DATE
Function.Definition:
Returns the current date as a SAS date value. 
    
Alias: TODAY 

Interaction:
If the value of the TIMEZONE= system option is set to a time zone name or time zone ID, the date and time values that are returned for this function are determined by the time zone.

Function.Name: DATEJUL
Function.Definition: Converts a Julian date to a SAS date value.
Function.Description1: Specifies a SAS numeric expression that represents a Julian date. A Julian date in SAS is a date in the form yyddd or yyyyddd, where yy or yyyy is a two-digit or four-digit integer that represents the year and ddd is the number of the day of the year. The value of ddd must be between 1 and 365 (or 366 for a leap year).

Function.Name: DATEPART
Function.Definition: Extracts the date from a SAS datetime value.
Function.Description1: Specifies a SAS expression that represents a SAS datetime value. For example: conn='01feb94:8:45'dt; servdate=datepart(conn);

Function.Name: DATETIME
Function.Definition:
Returns the current date and time of day as a SAS datetime value. 
    
Interaction:
If the value of the TIMEZONE= system option is set to a time zone name or time zone ID, the date and time values that are returned for this function are determined by the time zone.

Function.Name: DAY
Function.Definition: Returns the day of the month from a SAS date value.
Function.Description1: Specifies a SAS expression that represents a SAS date value. For example: now='05may97'd; d=day(now);

Function.Name: DCLOSE
Function.Definition: Closes a directory that was opened by the DOPEN function.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric variable that specifies the identifier that was assigned when the directory was opened by the DOPEN function.

Function.Name: DCREATE
Function.Definition: Returns the complete pathname of a new, external directory.
Function.Description1: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the name of the directory to create. This value cannot include a pathname.
Function.Description2: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that contains the complete pathname of the directory in which to create the new directory. If you do not supply a value for parent-directory, then the current directory is the parent directory.

Function.Name: DEPDB
Function.Definition: Returns the declining balance depreciation.
Function.Description1: Is numeric, the period for which the calculation is to be done. For noninteger p arguments, the depreciation is prorated between the two consecutive time periods that precede and follow the fractional period.
Function.Description2: Is numeric, the depreciable initial value of the asset.
Function.Description3: Is numeric, the lifetime of the asset. Range: y > 0.
Function.Description4: Is numeric, the rate of depreciation that is expressed as a fraction. Range: r > 0.

Function.Name: DEPDBSL
Function.Definition: Returns the declining balance with conversion to a straight-line depreciation.
Function.Description1: Is an integer, the period for which the calculation is to be done.
Function.Description2: Is numeric, the depreciable initial value of the asset.
Function.Description3: Is an integer, the lifetime of the asset. Range: y>0.
Function.Description4: Is numeric, the rate of depreciation that is expressed as a fraction. Range: r > 0.

Function.Name: DEPSL
Function.Definition: Returns the straight-line depreciation.
Function.Description1: Is numeric, the period for which the calculation is to be done. For fractional p, the depreciation is prorated between the two consecutive time periods that precede and follow the fractional period.
Function.Description2: Is numeric, the depreciable initial value of the asset.
Function.Description3: Is numeric, the lifetime of the asset. Range: y > 0.

Function.Name: DEPSYD
Function.Definition: Returns the sum-of-years-digits depreciation.
Function.Description1: Is numeric, the period for which the calculation is to be done. For noninteger p arguments, the depreciation is prorated between the two consecutive time periods that precede and follow the fractional period.
Function.Description2: Is numeric, the depreciable initial value of the asset.
Function.Description3: Is numeric, the lifetime of the asset in number of depreciation periods. Range: y > 0.

Function.Name: DEPTAB
Function.Definition: Returns the depreciation from specified tables.
Function.Description1: Is numeric, the period for which the calculation is to be done. For noninteger p arguments, the depreciation is prorated between the two consecutive time periods that precede and follow the fractional period.
Function.Description2: Is numeric, the depreciable initial value of the asset.
Function.Description3: are numeric, the fractions of depreciation for each time period with t1+t2+...tn≤1.

Function.Name: DEQUOTE
Function.Definition: Removes matching quotation marks from a character string that begins with a quotation mark, and deletes all characters to the right of the closing quotation mark.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: DEVIANCE
Function.Definition: Returns the deviance based on a probability distribution.
Function.Description1: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that identifies the distribution. Valid distributions are: 'BERNOULLI' | 'BERN', 'BINOMIAL' | 'BINO', 'GAMMA', 'IGAUSS' | 'WALD', 'NORMAL' | 'GAUSSIAN', 'NORMAL' | 'GAUSSIAN'.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description3: Are one or more distribution-specific numeric parameters that characterize the shape of the distribution.
Function.Description4: Is an optional numeric small value used for all of the distributions, except for the normal distribution.

Function.Name: DHMS
Function.Definition: Returns a SAS datetime value from date, hour, minute, and second values.
Function.Description1: Specifies a SAS expression that represents a SAS date value.
Function.Description2: Is numeric.
Function.Description3: Is numeric.
Function.Description4: Is numeric.

Function.Name: DIF
Function.Definition: Returns differences between an argument and its nth lag. n specifies the number of lags.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: DIGAMMA
Function.Definition: Returns the value of the digamma function.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: DIM*1
Function.Definition: Returns the number of elements in an array. n specifies the dimension, in a multidimensional array, for which you want to know the number of elements.
Function.Description1: Specifies the name of an array that was previously defined in the same DATA step. This argument cannot be a constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: DIM*2
Function.Definition: Returns the number of elements in an array.
Function.Description1: Specifies the name of an array that was previously defined in the same DATA step. This argument cannot be a constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the dimension, in a multidimensional array, for which you want to know the number of elements. Use bound-n only when n is not specified.

Function.Name: DIM*3
Function.Definition: Returns the dimensions of a list variable
Function.Description1: A list variable.

Function.Name: DINFO
Function.Definition: Returns information about a directory.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric variable that specifies the identifier that was assigned when the directory was opened by the DOPEN function.
Function.Description2: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the information item to be retrieved. DINFO returns a blank if the value of the info-item argument is invalid. The information available varies according to the operating environment.

Function.Name: DIVIDE
Function.Definition: Returns the result of a division that handles special missing values for ODS output.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: DNUM
Function.Definition: Returns the number of members in a directory.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric variable that specifies the identifier that was assigned when the directory was opened by the DOPEN function.

Function.Name: DOPEN
Function.Definition: Opens a directory, and returns a directory identifier value.
Function.Description1: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the fileref assigned to the directory.

Function.Name: DOPTNAME
Function.Definition: Returns directory attribute information.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric variable that specifies the identifier that was assigned when the directory was opened by the DOPEN function.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the sequence number of the option.

Function.Name: DOPTNUM
Function.Definition: Returns the number of information items that are available for a directory.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric variable that specifies the identifier that was assigned when the directory was opened by the DOPEN function.

Function.Name: DREAD
Function.Definition: Returns the name of a directory member.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric value that specifies the identifier that was assigned when the directory was opened by the DOPEN function.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the sequence number of the member within the directory.

Function.Name: DROPNOTE
Function.Definition: Deletes a note marker from a SAS data set or an external file.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric variable that specifies the identifier that was assigned when the data set or external file was opened, generally by the OPEN function or the FOPEN function.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric value that specifies the identifier that was assigned by the NOTE or FNOTE function.

Function.Name: DSNAME
Function.Definition: Returns the SAS data set name that is associated with a data set identifier.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric variable that specifies the data set identifier that is returned by the OPEN function.

Function.Name: DUR
Function.Definition: Returns the modified duration for an enumerated cash flow.
Function.Description1: Specifies the effective per-period yield-to-maturity, expressed as a fraction. Range: y > 0.
Function.Description2: Specifies the frequency of cash flows per period. Range: f > 0.
Function.Description3: Specifies a list of cash flows.

Function.Name: DURP
Function.Definition: Returns the modified duration for a periodic cash flow stream, such as a bond.
Function.Description1: Specifies the par value. Range: A > 0.
Function.Description2: Specifies the nominal per-period coupon rate, expressed as a fraction. Range: 0 ≤ c < 1.
Function.Description3: Specifies the number of coupons per period. Range: n > 0 and is an integer.
Function.Description4: Specifies the number of remaining coupons. Range: K > 0 and is an integer.
Function.Description5: Specifies the time from the present date to the first coupon date, expressed in terms of the number of periods. Range: 0 < c ≤ 1/n.
Function.Description6: Specifies the nominal per-period yield-to-maturity, expressed as a fraction. Range: y > 0.

Function.Name: ENVLEN
Function.Definition: Returns the length of an environment variable.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character variable that is the name of an operating system environment variable. Enclose argument in quotation marks.

Function.Name: ERF
Function.Definition: Returns the value of the (normal) error function.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: ERFC
Function.Definition: Returns the value of the complementary (normal) error function.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: EUCLID
Function.Definition: Returns the Euclidean norm of the non-missing arguments.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: EXIST
Function.Definition: Verifies the existence of a SAS library member.
Function.Description1: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the SAS library member.
Function.Description2: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the type of SAS library member.
Function.Description3: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the generation number of the SAS data set whose existence you are checking.

Function.Name: EXP
Function.Definition: Returns the value of the exponential function.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: FACT
Function.Definition: Computes a factorial.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: FAPPEND
Function.Definition: Appends the current record to the end of an external file.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric variable that specifies the identifier that was assigned when the file was opened, generally by the FOPEN function.
Function.Description2: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies a carriage-control character: blank (start record on a new line), 0 (skip one blank line), - (skip two blanks), 1 (start a new page), + (overstrike a previous line), P (computer prompt), = (contains carriage control info), all else (start a new line).

Function.Name: FCLOSE
Function.Definition: Closes an external file, directory, or directory member.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric variable that specifies the identifier that was assigned when the file was opened, generally by the FOPEN function.

Function.Name: FCOL
Function.Definition: Returns the current column position in the File Data Buffer (FDB).
Function.Description1: Is a numeric variable that specifies the identifier that was assigned when the file was opened, generally by the FOPEN function.

Function.Name: FDELETE
Function.Definition: Deletes an external file or an empty directory.
Function.Description1: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the fileref that you assigned to the external file, or an empty directory that you want to delete.

Function.Name: FETCH
Function.Definition: Reads the next non-deleted observation from a SAS data set into the Data Set Data Vector (DDV).
Function.Description1: Is a numeric variable that specifies the data set identifier that is returned by the OPEN function.
Function.Description2: Prevents the automatic passing of SAS data set variable values to macro or DATA step variables even if the SET routine has been called.

Function.Name: FETCHOBS
Function.Definition: Reads a specified observation from a SAS data set into the Data Set Data Vector (DDV).
Function.Description1: Is a numeric variable that specifies the data set identifier that is returned by the OPEN function.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the number of the observation to read.
Function.Description3: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that names one or more options, separated by blanks: ABS (obs-number is absolute), NOSET (prevents automatic passing of SAS data set variable values even if the SET routine has been called).

Function.Name: FEXIST
Function.Definition: Verifies the existence of an external file that is associated with a fileref.
Function.Description1: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the fileref that is assigned to an external file.

Function.Name: FGET
Function.Definition: Copies data from the File Data Buffer (FDB) into a variable.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric variable that specifies the identifier that was assigned when the file was opened, generally by the FOPEN function.
Function.Description2: In a DATA step, specifies a character variable to hold the data. In a macro, specifies a macro variable to hold the data. If variable is a macro variable and it does not exist, it is created.
Function.Description3: Specifies the number of characters to retrieve from the FDB. If length is omitted, all characters in the FDB from the current column position to the next delimiter are returned.

Function.Name: FILEEXIST
Function.Definition: Verifies the existence of an external file by its physical name.
Function.Description1: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies a fully qualified physical filename of the external file in the operating environment.

Function.Name: FILENAME
Function.Definition: Assigns or deassigns a fileref to an external file, directory, or output device.
Function.Description1: Specifies the fileref to assign to the external file.
Function.Description2: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the external file.
Function.Description3: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the type of device. Valid values: DISK, PRINTER, TEMP, DUMMY, PIPE, PLOTTER, TAPE, TERMINAL, GTERM, UPRINTER.
Function.Description4: Specifies host-specific details such as file attributes and processing attributes.
Function.Description5: Specifies the fileref that was assigned to the directory or partitioned data set in which the external file resides.

Function.Name: FILEREF
Function.Definition: Verifies whether a fileref has been assigned for the current SAS session.
Function.Description1: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the fileref to be validated. Range: 1 to 8 character.

Function.Name: FINANCE*1
Function.Definition: Computes the accrued interest for a security that pays periodic interest.
Function.Description1: Use the 'accrint' string-identifier to compute the accrued interest for a security that pays periodic interest.
Function.Description2: Specifies the issue date of the security.
Function.Description3: Specifies the first interest date of the security.
Function.Description4: Specifies the settlement date.
Function.Description5: Specifies the interest rate.
Function.Description6: Specifies the par value of the security. If you omit par-value, SAS uses the value $1000.
Function.Description7: Specifies the number of coupon payments per year. For annual payments, frequency=1; for semiannual payments, frequency=2; for quarterly payments, frequency=4.
Function.Description8: Specifies the optional day count value.

Function.Name: FINANCE*2
Function.Definition: Computes the accrued interest for a security that pays interest at maturity.
Function.Description1: Use the 'accrintm' string-identifier to compute the accrued interest for a security that pays interest at maturity.
Function.Description2: Specifies the issue date of the security.
Function.Description3: Specifies the settlement date.
Function.Description4: Specifies the interest rate.
Function.Description5: Specifies the par value of the security. If you omit par-value, SAS uses the value $1000.

Function.Name: FINANCE*3
Function.Definition: Computes the depreciation for each accounting period by using a depreciation coefficient.
Function.Description1: Use 'amordegrc' string-identifier to compute the depreciation for each accounting period by using a depreciation coefficient.
Function.Description2: Specifies the initial cost of the asset.
Function.Description3: Specifies the date of the purchase of the asset.
Function.Description4: Specifies the date of the end of the first period.
Function.Description5: Specifies the value at the end of the depreciation (also called the salvage value of the asset).
Function.Description6: Specifies the depreciation period.
Function.Description7: Specifies the rate of depreciation.
Function.Description8:
Specifies the optional day count value. 
    
Tip:
When the first argument of the FINANCE function is AMORDEGRC and the value of basis is 2, the function returns a missing value.

Function.Name: FINANCE*4
Function.Definition: Computes the depreciation for each accounting period.
Function.Description1: Use 'amorlinc' string-identifier to compute the depreciation for each accounting period.
Function.Description2: Specifies the initial cost of the asset.
Function.Description3: Specifies the date of the purchase of the asset.
Function.Description4: Specifies the date of the end of the first period.
Function.Description5: Specifies the value at the end of the depreciation (also called the salvage value of the asset).
Function.Description6: Specifies the depreciation period.
Function.Description7: Specifies the rate of depreciation.
Function.Description8:
Specifies the optional day count value. 
    
Tip:
When the first argument of the FINANCE function is AMORLINC and the value of basis is 2, the function returns a missing value.

Function.Name: FINANCE*5
Function.Definition: Computes the number of days from the beginning of the coupon period to the settlement date.
Function.Description1: Use the 'coupdaybs' string-identifier to compute the number of days from the beginning of the coupon period to the settlement date.
Function.Description2:
Specifies the settlement date of the security. The security settlement date is the date after the issue date when the security is traded to the buyer.
    
Note: Dates should be entered using the DATE function, or as results of other formulas or functions. For example, use DATE(2011,5,23) for the 23rd day of May 2011. Problems can occur if dates are entered as text.
Function.Description3:
Specifies the maturity date of the security. The maturity date is the date the security expires.
    
Note: Dates should be entered using the DATE function, or as results of other formulas or functions. For example, use DATE(2011,5,23) for the 23rd day of May 2011. Problems can occur if dates are entered as text.
Function.Description4: Specifies the number of coupon payments per year. For annual payments, frequency=1; for semiannual payments, frequency=2; for quarterly payments, frequency=4.
Function.Description5: Specifies the optional day count value.

Function.Name: FINANCE*6
Function.Definition: Computes the number of days in the coupon period that contains the settlement date.
Function.Description1: Use the 'coupdays' string-identifier to compute the number of days in the coupon period that contains the settlement date.
Function.Description2: Specifies the settlement date.
Function.Description3: Specifies the maturity date.
Function.Description4: Specifies the number of coupon payments per year. For annual payments, frequency=1; for semiannual payments, frequency=2; for quarterly payments, frequency=4.
Function.Description5: Specifies the optional day count value.

Function.Name: FINANCE*7
Function.Definition: Computes the number of days from the settlement date to the next coupon date.
Function.Description1: Use the 'coupdaysnc' string-identifier to compute the number of days from the settlement date to the next coupon date.
Function.Description2: Specifies the settlement date.
Function.Description3: Specifies the maturity date.
Function.Description4: Specifies the number of coupon payments per year. For annual payments, frequency=1; for semiannual payments, frequency=2; for quarterly payments, frequency=4.
Function.Description5: Specifies the optional day count value.

Function.Name: FINANCE*8
Function.Definition: Computes the next coupon date after the settlement date.
Function.Description1: Use the 'coupncd' string-identifier to compute the next coupon date after the settlement date.
Function.Description2: Specifies the settlement date.
Function.Description3: Specifies the maturity date.
Function.Description4: Specifies the number of coupon payments per year. For annual payments, frequency=1; for semiannual payments, frequency=2; for quarterly payments, frequency=4.
Function.Description5: Specifies the optional day count value.

Function.Name: FINANCE*9
Function.Definition: Computes the number of coupons that are payable between the settlement date and the maturity date.
Function.Description1: Use the 'coupnum' string-identifier to compute the number of coupons that are payable between the settlement date and the maturity date.
Function.Description2: Specifies the settlement date.
Function.Description3: Specifies the maturity date.
Function.Description4: Specifies the number of coupon payments per year. For annual payments, frequency=1; for semiannual payments, frequency=2; for quarterly payments, frequency=4.
Function.Description5: Specifies the optional day count value.

Function.Name: FINANCE*10
Function.Definition: Computes the previous coupon date before the settlement date.
Function.Description1: Use the 'couppcd' string-identifier to compute the previous coupon date before the settlement date.
Function.Description2: Specifies the settlement date.
Function.Description3: Specifies the maturity date.
Function.Description4: Specifies the number of coupon payments per year. For annual payments, frequency=1; for semiannual payments, frequency=2; for quarterly payments, frequency=4.
Function.Description5: Specifies the optional day count value.

Function.Name: FINANCE*11
Function.Definition: Computes the cumulative interest paid between two periods.
Function.Description1: Use the 'cumipmt' string-identifier to compute the cumulative interest paid between two periods.
Function.Description2: Specifies the interest rate.
Function.Description3: Specifies the total number of payment periods.
Function.Description4: Specifies the present value or the lump-sum amount that a series of future payments is worth currently.
Function.Description5: Specifies the first period in the calculation. Payment periods are numbered beginning with 1.
Function.Description6: Specifies the last period in the calculation.
Function.Description7:
Specifies the number 0 or 1 and indicates when payments are due. If type is omitted, it is assumed to be 0.

If payments are due at the end of the period, then either omit the type argument or set it to 0. If payments are due at the beginning of the period, then set type to 1.

Function.Name: FINANCE*12
Function.Definition: Computes the cumulative principal that is paid on a loan between two periods.
Function.Description1: Use the 'cumprinc' string-identifier to compute the cumulative principal that is paid on a loan between two periods.
Function.Description2: Specifies the interest rate.
Function.Description3: Specifies the total number of payment periods.
Function.Description4: Specifies the present value or the lump-sum amount that a series of future payments is worth currently.
Function.Description5: Specifies the first period in the calculation. Payment periods are numbered beginning with 1.
Function.Description6: Specifies the last period in the calculation.
Function.Description7:
Specifies the number 0 or 1 and indicates when payments are due. If type is omitted, it is assumed to be 0.

If payments are due at the end of the period, then either omit the type argument or set it to 0. If payments are due at the beginning of the period, then set type to 1.

Function.Name: FINANCE*13
Function.Definition: Computes the depreciation of an asset for a specified period by using the fixed-declining balance method.
Function.Description1: Use the 'db' string-identifier to compute the depreciation of an asset for a specified period by using the fixed-declining balance method.
Function.Description2: Specifies the initial cost of the asset.
Function.Description3: Specifies the value at the end of the depreciation (also called the salvage value of the asset).
Function.Description4: Specifies the number of periods over which the asset is depreciated (also called the useful life of the asset).
Function.Description5: Specifies the period for which you want to calculate the depreciation. Period must use the same time units as life.
Function.Description6: Specifies the number of months (month is an optional numeric argument). If month is omitted, it defaults to a value of 12.

Function.Name: FINANCE*14
Function.Definition: Computes the depreciation of an asset for a specified period by using the double-declining balance method or some other method that you specify.
Function.Description1: Use the 'ddb' string-identifier to compute the depreciation of an asset for a specified period by using the double-declining balance method or some other method that you specify.
Function.Description2: Specifies the initial cost of the asset.
Function.Description3: Specifies the value at the end of the depreciation (also called the salvage value of the asset).
Function.Description4: Specifies the number of periods over which the asset is depreciated (also called the useful life of the asset).
Function.Description5: Specifies the period for which you want to calculate the depreciation. Period must use the same time units as life.
Function.Description6: Specifies the rate at which the balance declines. If factor is omitted, it is assumed to be 2 (the double-declining balance method).

Function.Name: FINANCE*15
Function.Definition: Computes the discount rate for a security.

Function.Name: FINANCE*48

Function.Description6: Specifies the last period in the calculation.
Function.Description7: Specifies the rate at which the balance declines. If factor is omitted, it is assumed to be 2 (the double-declining balance method).
Function.Description8: Specifies a logical value that determines whether to switch to straight-line depreciation when the depreciation is greater than the declining balance calculation. If noswitch is omitted, it is assumed to be 1

Function.Name: FINANCE*49
Function.Definition: Computes the internal rate of return for a schedule of cash flows that is not necessarily periodic.
Function.Description1: Use the 'xirr' string-identifier to compute the internal rate of return for a schedule of cash flows that is not necessarily periodic.
Function.Description2: Specifies a series of cash flows that corresponds to a schedule of payments in dates. The first payment is optional and corresponds to a cost or payment that occurs at the beginning of the investment. If the first value is a cost or payment, it must be a negative value. All succeeding payments are discounted based on a 365-day year. The series of values must contain at least one positive value and one negative value.
Function.Description3: Specifies a schedule of payment dates that corresponds to the cash flow payments. The first payment date indicates the beginning of the schedule of payments. All other dates must be later than this date, but they can occur in any order.
Function.Description4: Specifies an optional number that you guess is close to the result of XIRR.

Function.Name: FINANCE*50

Function.Description2: Specifies the interest rate.
Function.Description3: Specifies a series of cash flows that corresponds to a schedule of payments in dates. The first payment is optional and corresponds to a cost or payment that occurs at the beginning of the investment. If the first value is a cost or payment, it must be a negative value. All succeeding payments are discounted based on a 365-day year. The series of values must contain at least one positive value and one negative value.
Function.Description4: Specifies a schedule of payment dates that corresponds to the cash flow payments. The first payment date indicates the beginning of the schedule of payments. All other dates must be later than this date, but they can occur in any order.
