Function.Name: FIND*1
Function.Definition: Searches for a specific substring of characters within a character string.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that will be searched for substrings. Enclose a literal string of characters in quotation marks.
Function.Description2: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the substring of characters to search for in string. Enclose a literal string of characters in quotation marks.
Function.Description3: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies one or more modifiers. The following modifiers can be in uppercase or lowercase: i (ignore character case), t (trim trailing blanks from string and substring).
Function.Description4: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression with an integer value that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction of the search.

Function.Name: FIND*2
Function.Definition: Searches for a specific substring of characters within a character string.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that will be searched for substrings. Enclose a literal string of characters in quotation marks.
Function.Description2: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the substring of characters to search for in string. Enclose a literal string of characters in quotation marks.
Function.Description3: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression with an integer value that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction of the search.
Function.Description4: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies one or more modifiers. The following modifiers can be in uppercase or lowercase: i (ignore character case), t (trim trailing blanks from string and substring).

Function.Name: FINDC*1
Function.Definition: Searches a string for any character in a list of characters.
Function.Description1: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the character string to be searched. Enclose a literal string of characters in quotation marks.
Function.Description2: Is an optional constant, variable, or character expression that initializes a list of characters. FINDC searches for the characters in this list provided that you do not specify the K modifier in the modifier argument.

Function.Name: FINDC*2
Function.Definition: Searches a string for any character in a list of characters.
Function.Description1: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the character string to be searched. Enclose a literal string of characters in quotation marks.
Function.Description2: Is an optional constant, variable, or character expression that initializes a list of characters. FINDC searches for the characters in this list provided that you do not specify the K modifier in the modifier argument.
Function.Description3: Is an optional character constant, variable, or expression in which each character modifies the action of the FINDC function. Refer to SAS documentation for list of valid modifiers.

Function.Name: FINDC*3
Function.Definition: Searches a string for any character in a list of characters.
Function.Description1: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the character string to be searched. Enclose a literal string of characters in quotation marks.
Function.Description2: Is an optional constant, variable, or character expression that initializes a list of characters. FINDC searches for the characters in this list provided that you do not specify the K modifier in the modifier argument.
Function.Description3: Is an optional character constant, variable, or expression in which each character modifies the action of the FINDC function. Refer to SAS documentation for list of valid modifiers.
Function.Description4: Is an optional numeric constant, variable, or expression having an integer value that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

Function.Name: FINDC*4
Function.Definition: Searches a string for any character in a list of characters.
Function.Description1: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the character string to be searched. Enclose a literal string of characters in quotation marks.
Function.Description2: Is an optional constant, variable, or character expression that initializes a list of characters. FINDC searches for the characters in this list provided that you do not specify the K modifier in the modifier argument.
Function.Description3: Is an optional numeric constant, variable, or expression having an integer value that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.
Function.Description4: Is an optional character constant, variable, or expression in which each character modifies the action of the FINDC function. Refer to SAS documentation for list of valid modifiers.

Function.Name: FINDW*1
Function.Definition: Returns the character position of a word in a string, or returns the number of the word in a string.
Function.Description1: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the character string to be searched.
Function.Description2: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the word to be searched.
Function.Description3: Is an optional character constant, variable, or expression that initializes a list of characters. The characters in this list are the delimiters that separate words, provided that you do not specify the K modifier in the modifier argument.

Function.Name: FINDW*2
Function.Definition: Returns the character position of a word in a string, or returns the number of the word in a string.
Function.Description1: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the character string to be searched.
Function.Description2: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the word to be searched.
Function.Description3: Is an optional character constant, variable, or expression that initializes a list of characters. The characters in this list are the delimiters that separate words, provided that you do not specify the K modifier in the modifier argument.
Function.Description4: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression in which each non-blank character modifies the action of the FINDW function. Refer to SAS documentation for list of valid modifiers.
Function.Description5: Is an optional numeric constant, variable, or expression with an integer value that specifies the position at which the search should begin and the direction in which to search.

Function.Name: FINDW*3
Function.Definition: Returns the character position of a word in a string, or returns the number of the word in a string.
Function.Description1: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the character string to be searched.
Function.Description2: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the word to be searched.
Function.Description3: Is an optional character constant, variable, or expression that initializes a list of characters. The characters in this list are the delimiters that separate words, provided that you do not specify the K modifier in the modifier argument.
Function.Description4: Is an optional numeric constant, variable, or expression with an integer value that specifies the position at which the search should begin and the direction in which to search.
Function.Description5: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression in which each non-blank character modifies the action of the FINDW function. Refer to SAS documentation for list of valid modifiers.

Function.Name: FINDW*4
Function.Definition: Returns the character position of a word in a string, or returns the number of the word in a string.
Function.Description1: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the character string to be searched.
Function.Description2: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the word to be searched.
Function.Description3: Is an optional numeric constant, variable, or expression with an integer value that specifies the position at which the search should begin and the direction in which to search.
Function.Description4: Is an optional character constant, variable, or expression that initializes a list of characters. The characters in this list are the delimiters that separate words, provided that you do not specify the K modifier in the modifier argument.
Function.Description5: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression in which each non-blank character modifies the action of the FINDW function. Refer to SAS documentation for list of valid modifiers.

Function.Name: FINFO
Function.Definition: Returns the value of a file information item.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the identifier that was assigned when the file was opened, generally by the FOPEN function.
Function.Description2: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the name of the file information item to be retrieved.

Function.Name: FINV
Function.Definition: Returns a quantile from the F distribution.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric probability. Range: 0 ≤ p < 1.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric numerator degrees of freedom parameter. Range: ndf > 0.
Function.Description3: Is a numeric denominator degrees of freedom parameter. Range: ddf > 0.
Function.Description4: Is an optional numeric noncentrality parameter. Range: nc ≥ 0.

Function.Name: FIPNAME
Function.Definition: Converts two-digit FIPS codes to uppercase state names.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression that represents a U.S. FIPS code.

Function.Name: FIPNAMEL
Function.Definition: Converts two-digit FIPS codes to mixed case state names.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression that represents a U.S. FIPS code.

Function.Name: FIPSTATE
Function.Definition: Converts two-digit FIPS codes to two-character state postal codes.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression that represents a U.S. FIPS code.

Function.Name: FIRST
Function.Definition: Returns the first character in a character string.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character string.

Function.Name: FLOOR
Function.Definition: Returns the largest integer that is less than or equal to the argument, fuzzed to avoid unexpected floating-point results.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: FLOORZ
Function.Definition: Returns the largest integer that is less than or equal to the argument, using zero fuzzing.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: FNONCT
Function.Definition: Returns the value of the noncentrality parameter of an F distribution.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric random variable. Range: x ≥ 0.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric numerator degree of freedom parameter. Range: ndf > 0.
Function.Description3: Is a numeric denominator degree of freedom parameter. Range: ddf > 0.
Function.Description4: Is a probability. Range: 0 < prob < 1.

Function.Name: FNOTE
Function.Definition: Identifies the last record that was read, and returns a value that the FPOINT function can use.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the identifier that was assigned when the file was opened, generally by the FOPEN function.

Function.Name: FOPEN
Function.Definition: Opens an external file and returns a file identifier value.
Function.Description1: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the fileref assigned to the external file.
Function.Description2: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the type of access to the file: A (APPEND mode writes new records at end of file), I (INPUT mode allows reading only), O (OUTPUT mode allows writing new records at beginning of file), S (SEQUENTIAL input mode for pipes or ports), U (UPDATE mode allows both reading and writing).
Function.Description3: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the logical record length of the file.
Function.Description4: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the record format of the file. Valid values: B (binary), D (default format), E (editable), F(fixed-length records), P (contains printer carriage control), V (variable-length records).

Function.Name: FOPTNAME
Function.Definition: Returns the name of an item of information about a file.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric variable that specifies the identifier that was assigned when the file was opened, generally by the FOPEN function.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the number of the information item.

Function.Name: FOPTNUM
Function.Definition: Returns the number of information items that are available for an external file.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric variable that specifies the identifier that was assigned when the file was opened, generally by the FOPEN function.

Function.Name: FPOINT
Function.Definition: Positions the read pointer on the next record to be read.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric variable that specifies the identifier that was assigned when the file was opened, generally by the FOPEN function.
Function.Description2: Specifies the identifier that was assigned by the FNOTE function.

Function.Name: FPOS
Function.Definition: Sets the position of the column pointer in the File Data Buffer (FDB).
Function.Description1: Is a numeric variable that specifies the identifier that was assigned when the file was opened, generally by the FOPEN function.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the column at which to set the pointer.

Function.Name: FPUT
Function.Definition: Moves data to the File Data Buffer (FDB) of an external file, starting at the FDB's current column position.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric variable that specifies the identifier that was assigned when the file was opened, generally by the FOPEN function.
Function.Description2: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the file data.

Function.Name: FREAD
Function.Definition: Reads a record from an external file into the File Data Buffer (FDB).
Function.Description1: Is a numeric variable that specifies the identifier that was assigned when the file was opened, generally by the FOPEN function.

Function.Name: FREWIND
Function.Definition: Positions the file pointer to the start of the file.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric variable that specifies the identifier that was assigned when the file was opened, generally by the FOPEN function.

Function.Name: FRLEN
Function.Definition: Returns the size of the last record that was read, or, if the file is opened for output, returns the current record size.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric variable that specifies the identifier that was assigned when the file was opened, generally by the FOPEN function.

Function.Name: FSEP
Function.Definition: Sets the token delimiters for the FGET function.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric variable that specifies the identifier that was assigned when the file was opened, generally by the FOPEN function.
Function.Description2: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies one or more delimiters that separate items in the File Data Buffer (FDB).
Function.Description3: Specifies that the character delimiter is a hexadecimal value.

Function.Name: FUZZ
Function.Definition: Returns the nearest integer if the argument is within 1E-12 of that integer.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: FWRITE
Function.Definition: Writes a record to an external file.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric variable that specifies the identifier that was assigned when the file was opened, generally by the FOPEN function.
Function.Description2: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies a carriage-control character: blank (start record on a new line), 0 (skip one blank line), - (skip two blanks), 1 (start a new page), + (overstrike a previous line), P (computer prompt), = (contains carriage control info), all else (start a new line).

Function.Name: GAMINV
Function.Definition: Returns a quantile from the gamma distribution.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric probability. Range: 0 ≤ p < 1.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric shape parameter. Range: a > 0.

Function.Name: GAMMA
Function.Definition: Returns the value of the gamma function.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: GARKHCLPRC
Function.Definition: Calculates call prices for European options on stocks, based on the Garman-Kohlhagen model.
Function.Description1: Is a non-missing, positive value that specifies the exercise price. Specify E and S in the same units.
Function.Description2: Is a non-missing value that specifies the time to maturity.
Function.Description3: Is a non-missing, positive value that specifies the spot currency price. Specify S and E in the same units.
Function.Description4: Is a non-missing, positive fraction that specifies the risk-free domestic interest rate for period t. Specify a value for Rd for the same time period as the unit of t.
Function.Description5: Is a non-missing, positive fraction that specifies the risk-free foreign interest rate for period t. Specify a value for Rf for the same time period as the unit of t.
Function.Description6: Is a non-missing, positive fraction that specifies the volatility of the currency rate. Specify a value for sigma for the same time period as the unit of t.

Function.Name: GARKHPTPRC
Function.Definition: Calculates put prices for European options on stocks, based on the Garman-Kohlhagen model.
Function.Description1: Is a non-missing, positive value that specifies the exercise price. Specify E and S in the same units.
Function.Description2: Is a non-missing value that specifies the time to maturity.
Function.Description3: Is a non-missing, positive value that specifies the spot currency price. Specify S and E in the same units.
Function.Description4: Is a non-missing, positive fraction that specifies the risk-free domestic interest rate for period t. Specify a value for Rd for the same time period as the unit of t.
Function.Description5: Is a non-missing, positive fraction that specifies the risk-free foreign interest rate for period t. Specify a value for Rf for the same time period as the unit of t.
Function.Description6: Is a non-missing, positive fraction that specifies the volatility of the currency rate. Specify a value for sigma for the same time period as the unit of t.

Function.Name: GCD
Function.Definition: Returns the greatest common divisor for one or more integers.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression that has an integer value.

Function.Name: GEODIST
Function.Definition: Returns the geodetic distance between two latitude and longitude coordinates.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the coordinate of a given position north or south of the equator.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the coordinate of a given position east or west of the prime meridian, which runs through Greenwich, England.
Function.Description3: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the coordinate of a given position north or south of the equator.
Function.Description4: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the coordinate of a given position east or west of the prime meridian, which runs through Greenwich, England.
Function.Description5: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that contains any of the following characters: M (distance in miles), K (distance in kilometers), D (input values in degrees), R (input values in radians).

Function.Name: GEOMEAN
Function.Definition: Returns the geometric mean.
Function.Description1: Is a non-negative numeric constant, variable, or expression. The argument list can consist of a variable list, which is preceded by OF

Function.Name: GEOMEANZ
Function.Definition: Returns the geometric mean, using zero fuzzing.
Function.Description1: Is a non-negative numeric constant, variable, or expression. The argument list can consist of a variable list, which is preceded by OF

Function.Name: GETOPTION
Function.Definition: Returns the value of a SAS system or graphics option.
Function.Description1:
Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the name of the system option (without the equal sign).
    
Tips: Do not put an equal sign after the name. For example, write PAGESIZE= as PAGESIZE. 

SAS options that are passwords, such as EMAILPW and METAPASS, return the value xxxxxxxx, 
and not the actual password.
Function.Description2:
Return Value Options:
DEFAULTVALUE
  returns the default option value.
HOWSCOPE
  returns a character string that specifies the scope of an option.
HOWSET
  returns a character string that specifies how an option value was set.
STARTUPVALUE
  returns the system option value that was used to start SAS either on the command line or in a configuration file.

Return Value Formatting Options:
CM
  reports graphic units of measure in centimeters.
EXPAND
  for options that contain environment variables, returns the option value with the value of the environment variable.
KEYEXPAND
  for options that contain environment variables, returns the value in the format option-name=value.
KEYWORD
  returns option values in a option-name=value format that would be suitable for direct use in the SAS OPTIONS or GOPTIONS global statements.
HEXVALUE
  returns the option value as a hexadecimal value.
IN
  reports graphic units of measure in inches.
LOGNUMBERFORMAT
  formats SAS system option values using locale-specific punctuation.

Function.Name: GETVARC
Function.Definition: Returns the value of a SAS data set character variable.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the data set identifier that the OPEN function returns.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the number of the variable in the Data Set Data Vector (DDV). You can obtain this value by using the VARNUM function.

Function.Name: GETVARN
Function.Definition: Returns the value of a SAS data set numeric variable.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the data set identifier that the OPEN function returns.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the number of the variable in the Data Set Data Vector (DDV). You can obtain this value by using the VARNUM function.

Function.Name: HARMEAN
Function.Definition: Returns the harmonic mean.
Function.Description1: Is a non-negative numeric constant, variable, or expression. The argument list can consist of a variable list, which is preceded by OF

Function.Name: HARMEANZ
Function.Definition: Returns the harmonic mean, using zero fuzzing.
Function.Description1: Is a non-negative numeric constant, variable, or expression. The argument list can consist of a variable list, which is preceded by OF

Function.Name: HBOUND*1
Function.Definition: Returns the upper bound of an array. n is an optional integer constant that specifies the dimension for which you want to know the upper bound. If no n value is specified, the HBOUND function returns the upper bound of the first dimension of the array.
Function.Description1: Is the name of an array that was defined previously in the same DATA step.

Function.Name: HBOUND*2
Function.Definition: Returns the upper bound of an array. n is an optional integer constant that specifies the dimension for which you want to know the upper bound. If no n value is specified, the HBOUND function returns the upper bound of the first dimension of the array.
Function.Description1: Is the name of an array that was defined previously in the same DATA step.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the dimension for which you want to know the upper bound. Use bound-n only if n is not specified.

Function.Name: HMS
Function.Definition: Returns a SAS time value from hour, minute, and second values.
Function.Description1: Is numeric.
Function.Description2: Is numeric.
Function.Description3: Is numeric.

Function.Name: HOLIDAY
Function.Definition: Returns a SAS date value of a specified holiday for a specified year.
Function.Description1: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies one of the holiday values recognized by SAS (refer to SAS documentation for the list).
Function.Description2: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies a four-digit year. If you use a two-digit year, then you must specify the YEARCUTOFF= system option.

Function.Name: HOUR
Function.Definition: Returns the hour from a SAS time or datetime value.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies a SAS time or datetime value.

Function.Name: HTMLDECODE
Function.Definition: Decodes a string that contains HTML numeric character references or HTML character entity references, and returns the decoded string.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: HTMLENCODE
Function.Definition: Encodes characters using HTML character entity references, and returns the encoded string.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description2: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the type of characters to encode. If you use more than one option, separate the options by spaces (eg. 'amp gt lt apos quot').

Function.Name: IBESSEL
Function.Definition: Returns the value of the modified Bessel function.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. Range: V ≥ 0.
Function.Description2: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. Range: x ≥ 0.
Function.Description3: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies a nonnegative integer.

Function.Name: IFC
Function.Definition: Returns a character value based on whether an expression is true, false, or missing.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description2: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that is returned when the value of logical-expression is true.
Function.Description3: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that is returned when the value of logical-expression is false.
Function.Description4: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that is returned when the value of logical-expression is missing.

Function.Name: IFN
Function.Definition: Returns a numeric value based on whether an expression is true, false, or missing.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description2: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression that is returned when the value of logical-expression is true.
Function.Description3: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression that is returned when the value of logical-expression is false.
Function.Description4: Specifies a numeric constant, variable or expression that is returned when the value of logical-expression is missing.

Function.Name: INDEX
Function.Definition: Searches a character expression for a string of characters, and returns the position of the string's first character for the first occurrence of the string.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression to search.
Function.Description2: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the string of characters to search for in source. Enclose a literal string of characters in quotation marks.

Function.Name: INDEXC
Function.Definition: Searches a character expression for any of the specified characters, and returns the position of that character.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression to search.
Function.Description2: Specifies the character constant, variable, or expression to search for in source. If you specify more than one excerpt, separate them with a comma.

Function.Name: INDEXW
Function.Definition: Searches a character expression for a string that is specified as a word, and returns the position of the first character in the word.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression to search.
Function.Description2: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression to search for in source. SAS removes leading and trailing delimiters from excerpt.
Function.Description3: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression containing the characters that you want INDEXW to use as delimiters in the character string. The default delimiter is the blank character.

Function.Name: INPUT
Function.Definition: Returns the value that is produced when SAS converts an expression using the specified informat.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression to which you want to apply a specific informat.
Function.Description2: The SAS informat you want to apply to the source. The optional ? and ?? modifiers suppress error messages and input lines when invalid data are read.

Function.Name: INPUTC
Function.Definition: Enables you to specify a character informat at run time.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression to which you want to apply the informat.
Function.Description2: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that contains the character informat you want to apply to source.
Function.Description3: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies a width to apply to the informat.

Function.Name: INPUTN
Function.Definition: Enables you to specify a numeric informat at run time.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression to which you want to apply the informat.
Function.Description2: Is a character constant, variable or expression that contains the numeric informat you want to apply to source.
Function.Description3: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies a width to apply to the informat.
Function.Description4: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the number of decimal places to use.

Function.Name: INT
Function.Definition: Returns the integer value, fuzzed to avoid unexpected floating-point results.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: INTCINDEX
Function.Definition: Returns the cycle index when a date, time, or datetime interval and value are specified.
Function.Description1: A three-part interval name (WEEK3.2, MONTH2.2, YEAR2.4, or QTR). For example, the interval name MONTH2.2 specifies bimonthly periods starting on the first day of even-numbered months.
Function.Description2: Specifies a date, time, or datetime value that represents a time period of a specified interval.

Function.Name: INTCK
Function.Definition: Returns the count of the number of interval boundaries between two dates, two times, or two datetime values.
Function.Description1: A three-part interval name (WEEK3.2, MONTH2.2, YEAR2.4, or QTR.3). For example, the interval name MONTH2.2 specifies bimonthly periods starting on the first day of even-numbered months.
Function.Description2: Specifies a SAS expression that represents the starting SAS date, time, or datetime value.
Function.Description3: Specifies a SAS expression that represents the ending SAS date, time, or datetime value.

Function.Name: INTCYCLE
Function.Definition: Returns the date, time, or datetime interval at the next higher seasonal cycle when a date, time, or datetime interval is specified.
Function.Description1: A three-part interval name (WEEK3.2, MONTH2.2, YEAR2.4, or QTR.3). For example, the interval name MONTH2.2 specifies bimonthly periods starting on the first day of even-numbered months.

Function.Name: INTFIT
Function.Definition: Returns a time interval that is aligned between two dates.
Function.Description1: Specifies a SAS expression that represents a SAS date or datetime value, or an observation.
Function.Description2: Specifies a SAS expression that represents a SAS date or datetime value, or an observation.
Function.Description3: Specifies whether the arguments are SAS date values, datetime values, or observations. Valid values: d (date), dt (datetime), obs (observations).

Function.Name: INTFMT
Function.Definition: Returns a recommended SAS format when a date, time, or datetime interval is specified.
Function.Description1: A three-part interval name (WEEK3.2, MONTH2.2, YEAR2.4, or QTR.3). For example, the interval name MONTH2.2 specifies bimonthly periods starting on the first day of even-numbered months.
Function.Description2: Specifies either LONG or SHORT. When a format includes a year value, LONG or L specifies a format that uses a four-digit year. SHORT or S specifies a format that uses a two-digit year.

Function.Name: INTGET
Function.Definition: Returns a time interval based on three date or datetime values.
Function.Description1: Specifies a SAS date or datetime value.
Function.Description2: Specifies a SAS date or datetime value.
Function.Description3: Specifies a SAS date or datetime value.

Function.Name: INTINDEX
Function.Definition: Returns the seasonal index when a date, time, or datetime interval and value are specified.
Function.Description1: A three-part interval name (WEEK3.2, MONTH2.2, YEAR2.4, or QTR.3). For example, the interval name MONTH2.2 specifies bimonthly periods starting on the first day of even-numbered months.
Function.Description2: Specifies a date, time, or datetime value that represents a time period of the given interval.

Function.Name: INTNX
Function.Definition: Increments a date, time, or datetime value by a given time interval, and returns a date, time, or datetime value.
Function.Description1: A three-part interval name (WEEK3.2, MONTH2.2, YEAR2.4, or QTR.3). For example, the interval name MONTH2.2 specifies bimonthly periods starting on the first day of even-numbered months.
Function.Description2: Specifies a SAS expression that represents a SAS date, time, or datetime value that identifies a starting point.
Function.Description3: Specifies a negative, positive, or zero integer that represents the number of date, time, or datetime intervals. Increment is the number of intervals to shift the value of start-from.
Function.Description4: Controls the position of SAS dates within the interval. Alignment can be one of these values: BEGINNING|B, MIDDLE|M, END|E, SAME (as the input date).

Function.Name: INTRR
Function.Definition: Returns the internal rate of return as a fraction.
Function.Description1: Is numeric, the number of payments over a specified base period of time that is associated with the desired internal rate of return. Range: freq > 0.
Function.Description2: Are numeric, the optional cash payments.

Function.Name: INTSEAS
Function.Definition: Returns the length of the seasonal cycle when a date, time, or datetime interval is specified.
Function.Description1: A three-part interval name (WEEK3.2, MONTH2.2, YEAR2.4, or QTR.3). For example, the interval name MONTH2.2 specifies bimonthly periods starting on the first day of even-numbered months.

Function.Name: INTSHIFT
Function.Definition: Returns the shift interval that corresponds to the base interval.
Function.Description1: A three-part interval name (WEEK3.2, MONTH2.2, YEAR2.4, or QTR.3). For example, the interval name MONTH2.2 specifies bimonthly periods starting on the first day of even-numbered months.

Function.Name: INTTEST
Function.Definition: Returns 1 if a time interval is valid, and returns 0 if a time interval is invalid.
Function.Description1: A three-part interval name (WEEK3.2, MONTH2.2, YEAR2.4, or QTR.3). For example, the interval name MONTH2.2 specifies bimonthly periods starting on the first day of even-numbered months.

Function.Name: INTZ
Function.Definition: Returns the integer portion of the argument, using zero fuzzing.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: IQR
Function.Definition: Returns the interquartile range.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression for which the interquartile range is to be computed.

Function.Name: IORCMSG
Function.Definition: Returns a formatted error message for _IORC_.

Function.Name: IRR
Function.Definition: Returns the internal rate of return as a percentage.
Function.Description1: Is numeric, the number of payments over a specified base period of time that is associated with the desired internal rate of return.
Function.Description2: Are numeric, the optional cash payments.

Function.Name: JBESSEL
Function.Definition: Returns the value of the Bessel function.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. Range: V > 0.
Function.Description2: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. Range: x > 0.

Function.Name: JULDATE
Function.Definition: Returns the Julian date from a SAS date value.
Function.Description1: Specifies a SAS date value.

Function.Name: JULDATE7
Function.Definition: Returns a seven-digit Julian date from a SAS date value.
Function.Description1: Specifies a SAS date value.

Function.Name: KURTOSIS
Function.Definition: Returns the kurtosis.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. At least four non-missing arguments are required.
Function.Description2: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. At least four non-missing arguments are required.
Function.Description3: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. At least four non-missing arguments are required.
Function.Description4: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. At least four non-missing arguments are required.
Function.Description5: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. At least four non-missing arguments are required.

Function.Name: LAG
Function.Definition: Returns values from a queue. n specifies the number of lagged values.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric or character constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: LARGEST
Function.Definition: Returns the kth largest non-missing value.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies which value to return.
Function.Description2: Specifies the value of a numeric constant, variable, or expression to be processed.

Function.Name: LBOUND*1
Function.Definition: Returns the lower bound of an array. n is an optional integer constant that specifies the dimension for which you want to know the lower bound. If no n value is specified, the LBOUND function returns the lower bound of the first dimension of the array.
Function.Description1: Is the name of an array that was defined previously in the same DATA step.

Function.Name: LBOUND*2
Function.Definition: Returns the lower bound of an array. n is an optional integer constant that specifies the dimension for which you want to know the lower bound. If no n value is specified, the LBOUND function returns the lower bound of the first dimension of the array.
Function.Description1: Is the name of an array that was defined previously in the same DATA step.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the dimension for which you want to know the upper bound. Use bound-n only if n is not specified.

Function.Name: LCM
Function.Definition: Returns the least common multiple.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression that has an integer value.

Function.Name: LCOMB
Function.Definition: Computes the logarithm of the COMB function; that is, the logarithm of the number of combinations of n objects taken r at a time.
Function.Description1: Is a non-negative integer that represents the total number of elements from which the sample is chosen.
Function.Description2: Is a non-negative integer that represents the number of chosen elements. Restriction: r ≤ n.

Function.Name: LEFT
Function.Definition: Left-aligns a character string by removing leading blanks.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: QLEFT
Function.Definition: Left-aligns a character string by removing leading blanks.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that might contain the following special characters and mnemonic operators: .

Function.Name: LENGTH
Function.Definition: Returns the length of a non-blank character string, excluding trailing blanks, and returns 1 for a blank character string.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: LENGTHC
Function.Definition: Returns the length of a character string, including trailing blanks.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: LENGTHM
Function.Definition: Returns the amount of memory (in bytes) that is allocated for a character string.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: LENGTHN
Function.Definition: Returns the length of a character string, excluding trailing blanks.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: LFACT
Function.Definition: Computes the logarithm of the FACT (factorial) function.
Function.Description1: Is an integer that represents the total number of elements from which the sample is chosen.

Function.Name: LGAMMA
Function.Definition: Returns the natural logarithm of the Gamma function.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. Range: must be positive.

Function.Name: LIBNAME
Function.Definition: Assigns or deassigns a libref for a SAS library.
Function.Description1: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the libref that is assigned to a SAS library. The maximum length of libref is eight characters.
Function.Description2: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the physical name of the SAS library that is associated with the libref. is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies one or more valid options for the specified engine, delimited with blanks. This argument can be null.
Function.Description3: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the engine that is used to access SAS files opened in the data library. is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies one or more valid options for the specified engine, delimited with blanks. This argument can be null.
Function.Description4: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies one or more valid options for the specified engine, delimited with blanks. This argument can be null.

Function.Name: LIBREF
Function.Definition: Verifies that a libref has been assigned.
Function.Description1: Specifies the libref to be verified.

Function.Name: LOG
Function.Definition: Returns the natural (base e) logarithm.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. Range: must be positive.

Function.Name: LOG1PX
Function.Definition: Returns the log of 1 plus the argument.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric variable, constant, or expression.

Function.Name: LOG10
Function.Definition: Returns the logarithm to the base 10.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. Range: must be positive.

Function.Name: LOG2
Function.Definition: Returns the logarithm to the base 2.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. Range: must be positive.

Function.Name: LOGBETA
Function.Definition: Returns the logarithm of the beta function.
Function.Description1: Is the first shape parameter, where a > 0.
Function.Description2: Is the second shape parameter, where b > 0.

Function.Name: LOGCDF
Function.Definition: Returns the logarithm of a left cumulative distribution function.
Function.Description1:
Is a character constant, variable, or expression that identifies the distribution. Valid distributions are as follows:

      Bernoulli distribution: 'BERNOULLI'
      Beta distribution: 'BETA'
      Binomial distribution: 'BINOMIAL'
      Cauchy distribution: 'CAUCHY'
      Chi-Square distribution: 'CHISQUARE'
      Conway-Maxwell-Poisson distribution: 'CMP'
      Exponential distribution: 'EXPONENTIAL'
      F distribution: 'F'
      Gamma distribution: 'GAMMA'
      Generalized Poisson distribution: 'GENPOISSON'
      Geometric distribution: 'GEOMETRIC'
      Hypergeometric distribution: 'HYPERGEOMETRIC'
      Laplace distribution: 'LAPLACE'
      Logistic distribution: 'LOGISTIC'
      Lognormal'LOGNORMAL'
      Negative binomial distribution: 'NEGBINOMIAL'
      Normal distribution: 'NORMAL'|'GAUSS'
      Normal mixture distribution: 'NORMALMIX'
      Pareto distribution: 'PARETO'
      Poisson distribution: 'POISSON'
      T distribution: 'T'
      Tweedie distribution: 'TWEEDIE').
      Uniform distribution: 'UNIFORM'
      Wald (inverse Gaussian) distribution: 'WALD'|'IGAUSS'
      Weibull distribution: 'WEIBULL'

Except for T, F, and NORMALMIX, you can minimally identify any distribution by its first four characters.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric variable, constant, or expression that specifies the value of a random variable.
Function.Description3: Are optional shape, location, or scale parameters appropriate for the specific distribution.

Function.Name: LOGPDF
Function.Definition: Returns the logarithm of a probability density (mass) function.
Function.Description1:
Is a character constant, variable, or expression that identifies the distribution. Valid distributions are as follows:

      Bernoulli distribution: 'BERNOULLI'
      Beta distribution: 'BETA'
      Binomial distribution: 'BINOMIAL'
      Cauchy distribution: 'CAUCHY'
      Chi-Square distribution: 'CHISQUARE'
      Conway-Maxwell-Poisson distribution: 'CMP'
      Exponential distribution: 'EXPONENTIAL'
      F distribution: 'F'
      Gamma distribution: 'GAMMA'
      Generalized Poisson distribution: 'GENPOISSON'
      Geometric distribution: 'GEOMETRIC'
      Hypergeometric distribution: 'HYPERGEOMETRIC'
      Laplace distribution: 'LAPLACE'
      Logistic distribution: 'LOGISTIC'
      Lognormal'LOGNORMAL'
      Negative binomial distribution: 'NEGBINOMIAL'
      Normal distribution: 'NORMAL'|'GAUSS'
      Normal mixture distribution: 'NORMALMIX'
      Pareto distribution: 'PARETO'
      Poisson distribution: 'POISSON'
      T distribution: 'T'
      Tweedie distribution: 'TWEEDIE').
      Uniform distribution: 'UNIFORM'
      Wald (inverse Gaussian) distribution: 'WALD'|'IGAUSS'
      Weibull distribution: 'WEIBULL'

      Except for T, F, and NORMALMIX, you can minimally identify any distribution by its first four characters.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric variable, constant, or expression that specifies the value of a random variable.
Function.Description3: Are optional shape, location, or scale parameters appropriate for the specific distribution.

Function.Name: LOGSDF
Function.Definition: Returns the logarithm of a survival function.
Function.Description1:
Is a character constant, variable, or expression that identifies the distribution. Valid distributions are as follows:

      Bernoulli distribution: 'BERNOULLI'
      Beta distribution: 'BETA'
      Binomial distribution: 'BINOMIAL'
      Cauchy distribution: 'CAUCHY'
      Chi-Square distribution: 'CHISQUARE'
      Conway-Maxwell-Poisson distribution: 'CMP'
      Exponential distribution: 'EXPONENTIAL'
      F distribution: 'F'
      Gamma distribution: 'GAMMA'
      Generalized Poisson distribution: 'GENPOISSON'
      Geometric distribution: 'GEOMETRIC'
      Hypergeometric distribution: 'HYPERGEOMETRIC'
      Laplace distribution: 'LAPLACE'
      Logistic distribution: 'LOGISTIC'
      Lognormal'LOGNORMAL'
      Negative binomial distribution: 'NEGBINOMIAL'
      Normal distribution: 'NORMAL'|'GAUSS'
      Normal mixture distribution: 'NORMALMIX'
      Pareto distribution: 'PARETO'
      Poisson distribution: 'POISSON'
      T distribution: 'T'
      Tweedie distribution: 'TWEEDIE').
      Uniform distribution: 'UNIFORM'
      Wald (inverse Gaussian) distribution: 'WALD'|'IGAUSS'
      Weibull distribution: 'WEIBULL'

Note: Except for T, F, and NORMALMIX, you can minimally identify any distribution by its first four characters.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric variable, constant, or expression that specifies the value of a random variable.
Function.Description3: Are optional shape, location, or scale parameters appropriate for the specific distribution.

Function.Name: LOWCASE
Function.Definition: Converts all letters in an argument to lowercase.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: QLOWCASE
Function.Definition: Converts all letters in an argument to lowercase. QLOWCASE produces a result with special characters and mnemonic operators masked.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that might contain the following special characters and mnemonic operators masked: & % ' " ( ) + - * / < > = ¬ ^ ~ ; , # blank AND OR NOT EQ NE LE LT GE GT IN.

Function.Name: LPERM
Function.Definition: Computes the logarithm of the PERM function; that is, the logarithm of the number of permutations of n objects, with the option of including r number of elements.
Function.Description1: Is an integer that represents the total number of elements from which the sample is chosen.
Function.Description2: Is an optional integer value that represents the number of chosen elements. If r is omitted, the function returns the factorial of n. Restriction: r ≤ n.

Function.Name: LPNORM
Function.Definition: Returns the Lp norm of the second argument and subsequent non-missing arguments.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression that is greater than or equal to 1, which is used as the power for computing the Lp norm.
Function.Description2: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description3: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: MAD
Function.Definition: Returns the median absolute deviation from the median.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression of which the median absolute deviation from the median is to be computed.
Function.Description2: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression of which the median absolute deviation from the median is to be computed.

Function.Name: MARGRCLPRC
Function.Definition: Calculates call prices for European options on stocks, based on the Margrabe model.
Function.Description1: Is a non-missing, positive value that specifies the price of the first asset. Specify X1 and X2 in the same units.
Function.Description2: Is a non-missing value that specifies the time to expiration.
Function.Description3: Is a non-missing, positive value that specifies the price of the second asset. Specify X2 and X1 in the same units.
Function.Description4: Is a non-missing, positive fraction that specifies the volatility of the first asset. Specify a value for sigma1 for the same time period as the unit of t.
Function.Description5: Is a non-missing, positive fraction that specifies the volatility of the second asset. Specify a value for sigma2 for the same time period as the unit of t.
Function.Description6: Specifies the correlation between the first and second assets. Range: between -1 and 1.

Function.Name: MARGRPTPRC
Function.Definition: Calculates put prices for European options on stocks, based on the Margrabe model.
Function.Description1: Is a non-missing, positive value that specifies the price of the first asset. Specify X1 and X2 in the same units.
Function.Description2: Is a non-missing value that specifies the time to expiration.
Function.Description3: Is a non-missing, positive value that specifies the price of the second asset. Specify X2 and X1 in the same units.
Function.Description4: Is a non-missing, positive fraction that specifies the volatility of the first asset. Specify a value for sigma1 for the same time period as the unit of t.
Function.Description5: Is a non-missing, positive fraction that specifies the volatility of the second asset. Specify a value for sigma2 for the same time period as the unit of t.
Function.Description6: Specifies the correlation between the first and second assets. Range: between -1 and 1.

Function.Name: MAX
Function.Definition: Returns the largest value. At least two arguments are required.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description2: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description3: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: MD5
Function.Definition: Returns the result of the message digest of a specified string.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression. Enclose a literal string of characters in quotation marks.

Function.Name: MDY
Function.Definition: Returns a SAS date value from month, day, and year values.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression that represents an integer from 1 through 12.
Function.Description2: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression that represents an integer from 1 through 31.
Function.Description3: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression with a value of a two-digit or four-digit integer that represents the year.

Function.Name: MEAN
Function.Definition: Returns the arithmetic mean (average). At least one non-missing argument is required. Otherwise, the function returns a missing value.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. The argument list can consist of a variable list, which is preceded by OF.
Function.Description2: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. The argument list can consist of a variable list, which is preceded by OF.

Function.Name: MEDIAN
Function.Definition: Returns the median value.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: MIN
Function.Definition: Returns the smalles value. At least two arguments are required.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description2: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description3: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: MINUTE
Function.Definition: Returns the minute from a SAS time or datetime value.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies a SAS time or datetime value.

Function.Name: MISSING
Function.Definition: Returns a numeric result that indicates whether the argument contains a missing value.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric or character constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: MOD
Function.Definition: Returns the remainder from the division of the first argument by the second argument, fuzzed to avoid most unexpected floating-point results.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the dividend.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the divisor. Restriction: cannot be 0.

Function.Name: MODULEIC
Function.Definition: Calls an external routine or module that resides in an image that can be shared. Returns a character value.
Function.Description1: Is an optional control string whose first character must be an asterisk (*), followed by any combination of the following characters: I (detects incorrect arguments or attribute tables), E (prints error messages), Sx (uses x as a separator character to separate field definitions), H (provides help on CALL MODULE routine syntax).
Function.Description2: Is the name of the external module to use.
Function.Description3: Is one or more arguments to pass to the requested routine.
Function.Description4: Is one or more arguments to pass to the requested routine.

Function.Name: MODULEIN
Function.Definition: Calls an external routine or module that resides in an image that can be shared. Returns a numeric value.
Function.Description1: Is an optional control string whose first character must be an asterisk (*), followed by any combination of the following characters: I (detects incorrect arguments or attribute tables), E (prints error messages), Sx (uses x as a separator character to separate field definitions), H (provides help on CALL MODULE routine syntax).
Function.Description2: Is the name of the external module to use.
Function.Description3: Is one or more arguments to pass to the requested routine.
Function.Description4: Is one or more arguments to pass to the requested routine.

Function.Name: MODULEC
Function.Definition: Calls an external routine and returns a character value.
Function.Description1: Is an optional control string whose first character must be an asterisk (*), followed by any combination of the following characters: I (detects incorrect arguments or attribute tables), E (prints error messages), Sx (uses x as a separator character to separate field definitions), H (provides help on CALL MODULE routine syntax).
Function.Description2: Is the name of the external module to use.
Function.Description3: Is one or more arguments to pass to the requested routine.
Function.Description4: Is one or more arguments to pass to the requested routine.

Function.Name: MODULEN
Function.Definition: Calls an external routine and returns a numeric value.
Function.Description1: Is an optional control string whose first character must be an asterisk (*), followed by any combination of the following characters: I (detects incorrect arguments or attribute tables), E (prints error messages), Sx (uses x as a separator character to separate field definitions), H (provides help on CALL MODULE routine syntax).
Function.Description2: Is the name of the external module to use.
Function.Description3: Is one or more arguments to pass to the requested routine.
Function.Description4: Is one or more arguments to pass to the requested routine.

Function.Name: MODZ
Function.Definition: Returns the remainder from the division of the first argument by the second argument, using zero fuzzing.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the dividend.
Function.Description2: Is a non-zero numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the divisor.

Function.Name: MONTH
Function.Definition: Returns the month from a SAS date value.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression that represents a SAS date value.

Function.Name: MOPEN
Function.Definition: Opens a file by directory ID and member name, and returns either the file identifier or a 0.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric variable that specifies the identifier that was assigned when the directory was opened, generally by the DOPEN function.
Function.Description2: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the member name in the directory.
Function.Description3: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the type of access to the file: A (APPEND mode writes new records at end of file), I (INPUT mode allows reading only), O (OUTPUT mode allows writing new records at beginning of file), S (SEQUENTIAL input mode for pipes or ports), U (UPDATE mode allows both reading and writing), W (SEQUENTIAL update mode for pipes or ports)
Function.Description4: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the logical record length of the file. To use the existing record length for the file, specify a length of 0, or do not provide a value here.
Function.Description5: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the record format of the file. Valid values: B (binary), D (default format), E (editable), F(fixed-length records), P (contains printer carriage control), V (variable-length records).

Function.Name: MORT
Function.Definition: Returns amortization parameters.
Function.Description1: Is numeric, and specifies the initial amount.
Function.Description2: Is numeric, and specifies the periodic payment.
Function.Description3: Is numeric, and specifies the periodic interest rate that is expressed as a fraction.
Function.Description4: Is an integer, and specifies the number of compounding periods. Range: n ≥ 0.

Function.Name: MSPLINT
Function.Definition: Returns the ordinate of a monotonicity-preserving interpolating spline.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the abscissa for which the ordinate of the spline is to be computed.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the number of knots. N must be a positive integer.
Function.Description3: Are numeric constants, variables, or expressions that specify the abscissas of the knots. These values must be non-missing and listed in nondecreasing order.
Function.Description4: Are numeric constants, variables, or expressions that specify the ordinates of the knots. The number of Y1 through Yn arguments must be the same as the number of X1 through Xn arguments.
Function.Description5: Are optional numeric constants, variables, or expressions that specify the derivatives of the spline at X1 and Xn.

Function.Name: N
Function.Definition: Returns the number of non-missing numeric values. At least one argument is required.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description2: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: NETPV
Function.Definition: Returns the net present value as a fraction.
Function.Description1: Is numeric, the interest rate over a specified base period of time expressed as a fraction. Range: r ≥ 0.
Function.Description2: Is numeric, the number of payments during the base period of time that is specified with the rate r. Range: freq > 0. Exception: The case freq=0 is a flag to allow continuous discounting.
Function.Description3: Are numeric cash flows that represent cash outlays (payments) or cash inflows (income) occurring at times 0, 1, ...n.

Function.Name: NLITERAL
Function.Definition: Converts a character string that you specify to a SAS name literal.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that is to be converted to a SAS name literal. Enclose a literal string of characters in quotation marks.

Function.Name: NMISS
Function.Definition: Returns the number of missing numeric values. At least one argument is required.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description2: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: NOTALNUM
Function.Definition: Searches a character string for a non-alphanumeric character, and returns the first position at which the character is found.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression to search.
Function.Description2: Is an optional numeric constant, variable, or expression with an integer value that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

Function.Name: NOTALPHA
Function.Definition: Searches a character string for a nonalphabetic character, and returns the first position at which the character is found.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression to search.
Function.Description2: Is an optional numeric constant, variable, or expression with an integer value that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

Function.Name: NOTCNTRL
Function.Definition: Searches a character string for a character that is not a control character, and returns the first position at which that character is found.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression to search.
Function.Description2: Is an optional numeric constant, variable, or expression with an integer value that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

Function.Name: NOTDIGIT
Function.Definition: Searches a character string for any character that is not a digit, and returns the first position at which that character is found.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression to search.
Function.Description2: Is an optional numeric constant, variable, or expression with an integer value that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

Function.Name: NOTE
Function.Definition: Returns an observation ID for the current observation of a SAS data set.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric variable that specifies the data set identifier that the OPEN function returns.

Function.Name: NOTFIRST
Function.Definition: Searches a character string for an invalid first character in a SAS variable name under VALIDVARNAME=V7, and returns the first position at which that character is found.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression to search.
Function.Description2: Is an optional numeric constant, variable, or expression with an integer value that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

Function.Name: NOTGRAPH
Function.Definition: Searches a character string for a non-graphical character, and returns the first position at which that character is found.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression to search.
Function.Description2: Is an optional numeric constant, variable, or expression with an integer value that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

Function.Name: NOTLOWER
Function.Definition: Searches a character string for a character that is not a lowercase letter, and returns the first position at which that character is found.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression to search.
Function.Description2: Is an optional numeric constant, variable, or expression with an integer value that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

Function.Name: NOTNAME
Function.Definition: Searches a character string for an invalid character in a SAS variable name under VALIDVARNAME=V7, and returns the first position at which that character is found.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression to search.
Function.Description2: Is an optional numeric constant, variable, or expression with an integer value that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

Function.Name: NOTPRINT
Function.Definition: Searches a character string for a nonprintable character, and returns the first position at which that character is found.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression to search.
Function.Description2: Is an optional numeric constant, variable, or expression with an integer value that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

Function.Name: NOTPUNCT
Function.Definition: Searches a character string for a character that is not a punctuation character, and returns the first position at which that character is found.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression to search.
Function.Description2: Is an optional numeric constant, variable, or expression with an integer value that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

Function.Name: NOTSPACE
Function.Definition: Searches a character string for a character that is not a white-space character (blank, horizontal and vertical tab, carriage return, line feed, and form feed), and returns the first position at which that character is found.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression to search.
Function.Description2: Is an optional numeric constant, variable, or expression with an integer value that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

Function.Name: NOTUPPER
Function.Definition: Searches a character string for a character that is not an uppercase letter, and returns the first position at which that character is found.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression to search.
Function.Description2: Is an optional numeric constant, variable, or expression with an integer value that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

Function.Name: NOTXDIGIT
Function.Definition: Searches a character string for a character that is not a hexadecimal character, and returns the first position at which that character is found.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression to search.
Function.Description2: Is an optional numeric constant, variable, or expression with an integer value that specifies the position at which the search should start and the direction in which to search.

Function.Name: NPV
Function.Definition: Returns the net present value with the rate expressed as a percentage.
Function.Description1: Is numeric, the interest rate over a specified base period of time expressed as a percentage.
Function.Description2: Is numeric, the number of payments during the base period of time specified with the rate r. Range: freq > 0. Exception: The case freq=0 is a flag to allow continuous discounting.
Function.Description3: Are numeric cash flows that represent cash outlays (payments) or cash inflows (income) occurring at times 0, 1, ...n.

Function.Name: NVALID
Function.Definition: Checks the validity of a character string for use as a SAS variable name.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression which will be checked to determine whether its value can be used as a SAS variable name. Trailing blanks are ignored.
Function.Description2: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies one of the following values: V7, ANY, NLITERAL

Function.Name: NWKDOM
Function.Definition: Returns the date for the nth occurrence of a weekday for the specified month and year.
Function.Description1: Specifies the numeric week of the month that contains the specified day. Range: 1-5.
Function.Description2: Specifies the number that corresponds to the day of the week. Range: 1-7. Tip: Sunday is considered the first day of the week and has a weekday value of 1.
Function.Description3: Specifies the number that corresponds to the month of the year. Range: 1-12.
Function.Description4: Specifies a four-digit calendar year.

Function.Name: OPEN
Function.Definition: Opens a SAS data set.
Function.Description1: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the name of the SAS data set or SAS SQL view to be opened. The value of this character string should be of the form <libref.>member-name<(data-set-options)>
Function.Description2: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the type of access to the data set: I (INPUT mode, for read only), IN (sequential INPUT mode, with revisit of observations allowed), IS (sequential INPUT mode, with revisit of observations not allowed).

Function.Name: ORDINAL
Function.Definition: Returns the kth smallest of the missing and nonmissing values. At least two arguments are required.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression with an integer value that is less than or equal to the number of subsequent elements in the list of arguments.
Function.Description2: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description3: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description4: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: PATHNAME
Function.Definition: Returns the physical name of an external file or a SAS library, or returns a blank.
Function.Description1: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies either the fileref that is assigned to an external file or the libref that is assigned to a SAS library.
Function.Description2: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies whether to search for a fileref or a libref. Values: F (to search for a fileref) or L (to search for a libref).

Function.Name: PCTL
Function.Definition: Returns the percentile that corresponds to the percentage. n is a digit from 1 to 5 which specifies the definition of the percentile to be computed.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the percentile to be computed. Range: 0 ≤ percentage ≤ 100, and is numeric.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric variable, constant, or expression.

Function.Description1: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that identifies the distribution.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric random variable that denotes the number of failures before the first success. Range: m ≥ 0.
Function.Description3: Is a numeric probability of success. Range: 0 ≤ p ≤ 1.

Function.Name: SDF*12
Function.Definition: The SDF function computes the survival function (upper tail) from various continuous and discrete distributions.
Function.Description1: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that identifies the distribution.
Function.Description2: Is an integer random variable.
Function.Description3: Is an integer population size parameter. Range: N = 1, 2, ...
Function.Description4: Is an integer number of items in the category of interest. Range: R = 0, 1, ..., N
Function.Description5: Is an integer sample size parameter. Range: n = 1, 2, ..., N
Function.Description6: Is an optional numeric odds ratio parameter. Range: o > 0.

Function.Name: SDF*22
Function.Definition: The SDF function computes the survival function (upper tail) from various continuous and discrete distributions.
Function.Description1: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that identifies the distribution.
Function.Description2:
Is a random variable.

      Range: y ≥0
      Notes:  This argument is required.
      When y>1, y is numeric. When p=1, y is an integer.
Function.Description3:
Is the power parameter.

      Range: p ≥1
      Note:  This argument is required.
Function.Description4:
Is the mean.

      Default: 1
      Range: μ > 0
Function.Description5:
Is the dispersion parameter.

      Default: 1
      Range: φ>0

Function.Description1: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that identifies the distribution.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric random variable.
Function.Description3:
Is a numeric shape parameter.

      Range: λ > 0
Function.Description4:
Is the mean.

      Default: 1
      Range: μ > 0

Function.Name: SQUANTILE*25
Function.Definition: The SQUANTILE function computes the quantile from the specified continuous or discrete distribution, based on the probability value that is provided.
Function.Description1: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that identifies the distribution.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric random variable.
Function.Description3: Is a numeric shape parameter. Range: a > 0.
Function.Description4: Is a numeric scale parameter. Default: 1. Range: λ > 0.

Function.Name: PEEK
Function.Definition: Stores the contents of a memory address in a numeric variable on a 32-bit platform.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the memory address.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the data length. Range: 2 to 8.

Function.Name: PEEKC
Function.Definition: Stores the contents of a memory address in a character variable on a 32-bit platform.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the memory address.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the data length. Default: 8. Range: 1 to 32,767.

Function.Name: PEEKCLONG
Function.Definition: Stores the contents of a memory address in a character variable on 32-bit and 64-bit platforms.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that contains the binary pointer address.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the length of the character data. Default: 8. Range: 1 to 32,767.

Function.Name: PEEKLONG
Function.Definition: Stores the contents of a memory address in a numeric variable on 32-bit and 64-bit platforms.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that contains the binary pointer address.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the length of the character data. Default: 4 on 32-bit computers; 8 on 64-bit computers. Range: 1 -4 on 32-bit computers; 1-8 on 64-bit computers.

Function.Name: PERM
Function.Definition: Computes the number of permutations of n items that are taken r at a time.
Function.Description1: Is an integer that represents the total number of elements from which the sample is chosen.
Function.Description2: Is an integer value that represents the number of chosen elements. If r is omitted, the function returns the factorial of n. Restriction: r ≤ n.

Function.Name: POINT
Function.Definition: Locates an observation that is identified by the NOTE function.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric variable that specifies the data set identifier that the OPEN function returns.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric variable that specifies the identifier assigned to the observation by the NOTE function.

Function.Name: POISSON
Function.Definition: Returns the probability from a Poisson distribution.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric mean parameter. Range: m ≥ 0.
Function.Description2: Is an integer random variable. Range: n ≥ 0.

Function.Name: PROBBETA
Function.Definition: Returns the probability from a beta distribution.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric random variable. Range: 0 ≤ x ≤ 1.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric shape parameter. Range: a > 0.
Function.Description3: Is a numeric shape parameter. Range: b > 0.

Function.Name: PROBBNML
Function.Definition: Returns the probability from a binomial distribution.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric probability of success parameter. Range: 0 ≤ p ≤ 1.
Function.Description2: Is an integer number of independent Bernoulli trials parameter. Range: n > 0.
Function.Description3: Is an integer number of successes random variable. Range: 0 ≤ m ≤ n.

Function.Name: PROBBNRM
Function.Definition: Returns a probability from a bivariate normal distribution.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description2: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.
