Function.Description3: Is a numeric correlation coefficient. Range: -1 ≤ r ≤ 1.

Function.Name: PROBCHI
Function.Definition: Returns the probability from a chi-square distribution.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric random variable. Range: x ≥ 0.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric degrees of freedom parameter. Range: df ≥ 0.
Function.Description3: Is an optional numeric noncentrality parameter. Range: nc ≥ 0.

Function.Name: PROBF
Function.Definition: Returns the probability from an F distribution.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric random variable. Range: x ≥ 0.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric numerator degrees of freedom parameter. Range: ndf ≥ 0.
Function.Description3: Is a numeric denominator degrees of freedom parameter. Range: ddf ≥ 0.
Function.Description4: Is an optional numeric noncentrality parameter. Range: nc ≥ 0.

Function.Name: PROBGAM
Function.Definition: Returns the probability from a gamma distribution.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric random variable. Range: x ≥ 0.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric shape parameter. Range: a ≥ 0.

Function.Name: PROBHYPR
Function.Definition: Returns the probability from a hypergeometric distribution.
Function.Description1: Is an integer population size parameter. Range: N ≥ 1.
Function.Description2: Is an integer number of items in the category of interest parameter.  Range: 0 ≤ K ≤ N.
Function.Description3: Is an integer sample size parameter.  Range: 0 ≤ n ≤ N.
Function.Description4: Is an integer random variable.  Range: max(0, K + n-N) ≤ n ≤ min(K,n).
Function.Description5: Is an optional numeric odds ratio parameter. Range: r ≥ 0.

Function.Name: PROBIT
Function.Definition: Returns a quantile from the standard normal distribution.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric probability.  Range: 0 < p < 1.

Function.Name: PROBMC
Function.Definition: Returns a probability or a quantile from various distributions for multiple comparisons of means.
Function.Description1: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that identifies the distribution. Valid distributions: ANOM (Analysis of Means), DUNNETT1 (One-sided Dunnett), DUNNETT2 (Two-sided Dunnett), MAXMOD (Maximum Modulus), PARTRANGE (Partitioned Range), RANGE (Studentized Range), WILLIAMS.
Function.Description2: Is the quantile from the distribution.
Function.Description3: Is the left probability from the distribution. Restriction: Either prob or q can be specified, but not both.
Function.Description4: Is the degrees of freedom.
Function.Description5: Is the number of treatments. For DUNNETT1 and DUNNETT2, the control group is not counted.
Function.Description6: Is an optional set of nparms parameters that must be specified to handle the case of unequal sample sizes. The meaning of parameters depends on the value of distribution. If parameters is not specified, equal sample sizes are assumed, which is usually the case for a null hypothesis.

Function.Name: PROBNEGB
Function.Definition: Returns the probability from a negative binomial distribution.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric probability of success parameter.  Range: 0 ≤ p ≤ 1.
Function.Description2: Is an integer number of successes parameter. Range: n ≥ 0.
Function.Description3: Is a positive integer random variable, the number of failures. Range: m ≥ 0.

Function.Name: PROBNORM
Function.Definition: Returns the probability from the standard normal distribution.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric random variable.

Function.Name: PROBT
Function.Definition: Returns the probability from a t distribution.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric random variable.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric degrees of freedom parameter. Range: df ≥ 0.
Function.Description3: Is an optional numeric noncentrality parameter.

Function.Name: PROPCASE
Function.Definition: Converts all words in an argument to proper case.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description2: Specifies one or more delimiters that are enclosed in quotation marks. The default delimiters are blank, forward slash, hyphen, open parenthesis, period, and tab.

Function.Name: PRXCHANGE
Function.Definition: Performs a pattern-matching replacement.
Function.Description1: Specifies either a character constant, variable, or expression with a value that is a Perl regular expression, or a numeric variable with a value that is a pattern identifier that is returned from the PRXPARSE function.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the number of times to search for a match and replace a matching pattern. Use -1 to do replacements until the end of the source.
Function.Description3: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that you want to search.

Function.Name: PRXMATCH
Function.Definition: Searches for a pattern match and returns the position at which the pattern is found.
Function.Description1: Specifies either a numeric variable with a value that is a pattern identifier that is returned from the PRXPARSE function, or a character constant, variable, or expression with a value that is a Perl regular expression.
Function.Description2: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that you want to search.

Function.Name: PRXPAREN
Function.Definition: Returns the last bracket match for which there is a match in a pattern.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric variable with a value that is an identification number that is returned by the PRXPARSE function.

Function.Name: PRXPARSE
Function.Definition: Compiles a Perl regular expression (PRX) that can be used for pattern matching of a character value.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character value that is a Perl regular expression.

Function.Name: PRXPOSN
Function.Definition: Returns a character string that contains the value for a capture buffer.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric variable with a value that is a pattern identifier that is returned by the PRXPARSE function.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that identifies the capture buffer for which to retrieve a value: 0 returns the entire match; between 1 and the number of open parentheses returns the value for that capture buffer; greater than the number of open parentheses returns a missing value.
Function.Description3: Specifies the text from which to extract capture buffers.

Function.Name: PTRLONGADD
Function.Definition: Returns the pointer address as a character variable on 32-bit and 64-bit platforms.
Function.Description1: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the pointer address.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the amount to add to the address.

Function.Name: PUT
Function.Definition: Returns a value using a specified format.
Function.Description1: Identifies the constant, variable, or expression whose value you want to reformat.
Function.Description2: Contains the SAS format that you want applied to the value that is specified in the source. The format. must be of the same type as the source.

Function.Name: PUTC
Function.Definition: Enables you to specify a character format at run time.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression to which you want to apply the format.
Function.Description2: Is a character constant, variable, or expression with a value that is the character format you want to apply to source.
Function.Description3: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies a width to apply to the format. It overrides any width specification in the format. argument.

Function.Name: PUTN
Function.Definition: Enables you to specify a numeric format at run time.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression to which you want to apply the format.
Function.Description2: Is a character constant, variable, or expression with a value that is the numeric format you want to apply to source.
Function.Description3: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies a width to apply to the format. It overrides any width specification in the format. argument.
Function.Description4: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the number of decimal places to use.

Function.Name: PVP
Function.Definition: Returns the present value for a periodic cash flow stream (such as a bond), with repayment of principal at maturity.
Function.Description1: Specifies the par value. Range: A > 0.
Function.Description2: Specifies the nominal per-year coupon rate, expressed as a fraction. Range: 0 ≤ c ≤ 1.
Function.Description3: Specifies the number of coupons per year. Range: n > 0 and is an integer.
Function.Description4: Specifies the number of remaining coupons. Range: K > 0 and is an integer.
Function.Description5: Specifies the time from the present date to the first coupon date, expressed in terms of the number of years. Range: 0 ≤ ko ≤ 1/n.
Function.Description6: Specifies the nominal per-year yield-to-maturity, expressed as a fraction. Range: y > 0.

Function.Name: TR
Function.Definition: Returns the quarter of the year from a SAS date value.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression that represents a SAS date value.

Function.Name: QUANTILE
Function.Definition: Returns the quantile from a distribution when you specify the left probability (CDF).
Function.Description1:
Is a character constant, variable, or expression that identifies the distribution. Valid distributions are as follows:

      Bernoulli distribution: 'BERNOULLI'
      Beta distribution: 'BETA'
      Binomial distribution: 'BINOMIAL'
      Cauchy distribution: 'CAUCHY'
      Chi-Square distribution: 'CHISQUARE'
      Conway-Maxwell-Poisson distribution: 'CMP'
      Exponential distribution: 'EXPONENTIAL'
      F distribution: 'F'
      Gamma distribution: 'GAMMA'
      Generalized Poisson distribution: 'GENPOISSON'
      Geometric distribution: 'GEOMETRIC'
      Hypergeometric distribution: 'HYPERGEOMETRIC'
      Laplace distribution: 'LAPLACE'
      Logistic distribution: 'LOGISTIC'
      Lognormal'LOGNORMAL'
      Negative binomial distribution: 'NEGBINOMIAL'
      Normal distribution: 'NORMAL'|'GAUSS'
      Normal mixture distribution: 'NORMALMIX'
      Pareto distribution: 'PARETO'
      Poisson distribution: 'POISSON'
      T distribution: 'T'
      Tweedie distribution: 'TWEEDIE').
      Uniform distribution: 'UNIFORM'
      Wald (inverse Gaussian) distribution: 'WALD'|'IGAUSS'
      Weibull distribution: 'WEIBULL'

Note: Except for T, F, and NORMALMIX, you can minimally identify any distribution by its first four characters.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the value of a random variable.
Function.Description3: Are optional shape, location, or scale parameters appropriate for the specific distribution.

Function.Name: QUOTE
Function.Definition: Adds double quotation marks to a character value.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: RANBIN
Function.Definition: Returns a random variate from a binomial distribution.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression with an integer value. If seed ≤ 0, the time of day is used to initialize the seed stream. Range: seed<(2³¹)-1.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression with an integer value that specifies the number of independent Bernoulli trials parameter. Range: n > 0.
Function.Description3: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the probability of success. Range: 0 < p < 1.

Function.Name: RANCAU
Function.Definition: Returns a random variate from a Cauchy distribution.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression with an integer value. If seed ≤ 0, the time of day is used to initialize the seed stream. Range: seed<(2³¹)-1.

Function.Name: RAND
Function.Definition: Generates random numbers from a distribution that you specify.
Function.Description1: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that identifies the distribution. Refer to SAS documentation for valid distributions (eg. 'NORMAL', 'CHISQUARE', 'F', 'T', etc.).
Function.Description2: Are shape, location, or scale parameters appropriate for the specific distribution.

Function.Name: RANEXP
Function.Definition: Returns a random variate from an exponential distribution.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression with an integer value. If seed ≤ 0, the time of day is used to initialize the seed stream. Range: seed<(2³¹)-1.

Function.Name: RANGAM
Function.Definition: Returns a random variate from a gamma distribution.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression with an integer value. If seed ≤ 0, the time of day is used to initialize the seed stream. Range: seed<(2³¹)-1.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the shape parameter. Range: a > 0

Function.Name: RANGE
Function.Definition: Returns the range of the nonmissing values. At least one nonmissing argument is required.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description2: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: RANK
Function.Definition: Returns the position of a character in the ASCII or EBCDIC collating sequence.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: RANUNI
Function.Definition: Returns a random variate from a uniform distribution.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression with an integer value. If seed ≤ 0, the time of day is used to initialize the seed stream. Range: seed<(2³¹)-1.

Function.Name: RENAME
Function.Definition: Renames a member of a SAS library, an entry in a SAS catalog, an external file, or a directory.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that is the current name of a member of a SAS library, an entry in a SAS catalog, an external file, or an external directory.
Function.Description2: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that is the new one-level name for the library member, catalog entry, external file, or directory.
Function.Description3: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the type of element to rename. Values: 'ACCESS' (SAS/ACCESS), 'CATALOG', 'DATA', 'VIEW', 'FILE'. Default: 'DATA'
Function.Description4: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that is the description of a catalog entry. You can specify description only when the value of type is CATALOG. Description can be a null argument.
Function.Description5: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the password for the data set that is being renamed. Password can be a null argument.
Function.Description6: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the generation number of the data set that is being renamed. Generation can be a null argument.

Function.Name: REPEAT
Function.Definition: Returns a character value that consists of the first argument repeated n+1 times.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description2: Specifies the number of times to repeat argument. Restriction: n must be greater than or equal to 0.

Function.Name: RESOLVE
Function.Definition: Returns the resolved value of the argument after it has been processed by the macro facility.
Function.Description1: Is a character constant, variable, or expression with a value that is a macro expression.

Function.Name: REVERSE
Function.Definition: Reverses a character string.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: REWIND
Function.Definition: Positions the data set pointer at the beginning of a SAS data set.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric variable that specifies the data set identifier that the OPEN function returns.

Function.Name: RIGHT
Function.Definition: Right aligns a character expression.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: RMS
Function.Definition: Returns the root mean square of the nonmissing arguments.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression. The argument list can consist of a variable list, which is preceded by OF.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression. The argument list can consist of a variable list, which is preceded by OF.

Function.Name: ROUND
Function.Definition: Rounds the first argument to the nearest multiple of the second argument, or to the nearest integer when the second argument is omitted.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression to be rounded.
Function.Description2: Is a positive, numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the rounding unit.

Function.Name: ROUNDE
Function.Definition: Rounds the first argument to the nearest multiple of the second argument, and returns an even multiple when the first argument is halfway between the two nearest multiples.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression to be rounded.
Function.Description2: Is a positive, numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the rounding unit.

Function.Name: ROUNDZ
Function.Definition: Rounds the first argument to the nearest multiple of the second argument, using zero fuzzing.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression to be rounded.
Function.Description2: Is a positive, numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the rounding unit.

Function.Name: SAVING
Function.Definition: Returns the future value of a periodic saving.
Function.Description1: Is numeric, the future amount (at the end of n periods). Range: f ≥ 0.
Function.Description2: Is numeric, the fixed periodic payment. Range: p ≥ 0.
Function.Description3: Is numeric, the periodic interest rate expressed as a decimal. Range: r ≥ 0.
Function.Description4: Is an integer, the number of compounding periods. Range: n ≥ 0.

Function.Name: SCAN*1
Function.Definition: Returns the nth word from a character string.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description2: Is a nonzero numeric constant, variable, or expression that has an integer value that specifies the number of the word in the character string that you want SCAN to select. For example, a value of 1 indicates the first word.
Function.Description3: Specifies an optional character expression that initializes a list of characters. By default, all characters in charlist are used as delimiters.
Function.Description4: Specifies a character constant, a variable, or an expression in which each non-blank character modifies the action of the SCAN function. Refer to SAS documentation for the list of valid modifiers.

Function.Name: SCAN*2
Function.Definition: This CALL SCAN routine returns the position and length of the nth word from a character string.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description2: Is a non-zero numeric constant, variable, or expression that has an integer value that specifies the number of the word in the character string that you want the CALL SCAN routine to select.
Function.Description3: Specifies a numeric variable in which the position of the word is returned. If count exceeds the number of words in the string, then the value that is returned in position is zero. If count is zero or missing, then the value that is returned in position is missing.
Function.Description4: Specifies a numeric variable in which the length of the word is returned. If count exceeds the number of words in the string, then the value that is returned in length is zero. If count is zero or missing, then the value that is returned in length is missing.
Function.Description5: Specifies an optional character constant, variable, or expression that initializes a list of characters. This list determines which characters are used as the delimiters that separate words.
Function.Description6: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression in which each non-blank character modifies the action of the CALL SCAN routine. Blanks are ignored.

Function.Name: SCAN*3
Function.Definition: Searches for a word and masks special characters and mnemonic operators.
Function.Description1: Is a character string or a text expression. If argument contains a special character or mnemonic operator, use %QSCAN.
Function.Description2: Is an integer or a text expression that yields an integer, which specifies the position of the word to return.
Function.Description3: Specifies an optional list of one or more characters that separate "words" or text expressions that yield one or more characters. Possible delimiters: blank . < ( + & ! $ * ) ; ^ - / , % |.

Function.Name: SCANQ*1
Function.Definition: Returns the nth word from a character expression, ignoring delimiters that are enclosed in quotation marks.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that has an integer value that specifies the number of the word in the character string that you want QSCAN to select. If n is positive, CALL SCANQ counts words from left to right. If n is negative, SCANQ counts words from right to left. If n is zero, or |n| is greater than the number of words in the character string, CALL SCANQ returns a position and length of zero.
Function.Description3: Specifies an optional character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the characters that you want SCANQ to use to separate words in the character string. Restriction: You cannot use single or double quotation marks as delimiters. Default: If you omit delimiter, SCANQ uses white space characters (blank, horizontal and vertical tab, carriage return, line feed, and form feed) as delimiters.

Function.Name: SCANQ*2
Function.Definition: Returns the position and length of a given word from a character expression, and ignores delimiters that are enclosed in quotation marks.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that has an integer value that specifies the number of the word in the character string that you want QSCAN to select. If n is positive, CALL SCANQ counts words from left to right. If n is negative, SCANQ counts words from right to left. If n is zero, or |n| is greater than the number of words in the character string, CALL SCANQ returns a position and length of zero.
Function.Description3: Specifies a numeric variable in which the position of the word is returned.
Function.Description4: Specifies a numeric variable in which the length of the word is returned.
Function.Description5: Specifies an optional character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the characters that you want SCANQ to use to separate words in the character string. Restriction: You cannot use single or double quotation marks as delimiters. Default: If you omit delimiter, SCANQ uses white space characters (blank, horizontal and vertical tab, carriage return, line feed, and form feed) as delimiters.

Function.Name: SDF
Function.Definition: Returns a survival function.
Function.Description1:
Is a character string that identifies the distribution. Valid distributions are as follows:

      Bernoulli distribution: 'BERNOULLI'
      Beta distribution: 'BETA'
      Binomial distribution: 'BINOMIAL'
      Cauchy distribution: 'CAUCHY'
      Chi-Square distribution: 'CHISQUARE'
      Conway-Maxwell-Poisson distribution: 'CMP'
      Exponential distribution: 'EXPONENTIAL'
      F distribution: 'F'
      Gamma distribution: 'GAMMA'
      Generalized Poisson distribution: 'GENPOISSON'
      Geometric distribution: 'GEOMETRIC'
      Hypergeometric distribution: 'HYPERGEOMETRIC'
      Laplace distribution: 'LAPLACE'
      Logistic distribution: 'LOGISTIC'
      Lognormal'LOGNORMAL'
      Negative binomial distribution: 'NEGBINOMIAL'
      Normal distribution: 'NORMAL'|'GAUSS'
      Normal mixture distribution: 'NORMALMIX'
      Pareto distribution: 'PARETO'
      Poisson distribution: 'POISSON'
      T distribution: 'T'
      Tweedie distribution: 'TWEEDIE').
      Uniform distribution: 'UNIFORM'
      Wald (inverse Gaussian) distribution: 'WALD'|'IGAUSS'
      Weibull distribution: 'WEIBULL'

      Note: Except for T, F, and NORMALMIX, you can minimally identify any distribution by its first four characters.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric constant, variable or expression that specifies the value of a random variable.
Function.Description3: Are optional shape, location, or scale parameters appropriate for the specific distribution.

Function.Name: SECOND
Function.Definition: Returns the second from a SAS time or datetime value.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression with a value that represents a SAS time or datetime value.

Function.Name: SIGN
Function.Definition: Returns the sign of a value.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: SIN
Function.Definition: Returns the sine.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression and is expressed in radians.

Function.Name: SINH
Function.Definition: Returns the hyperbolic sine.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: SKEWNESS
Function.Definition: Returns the skewness of the nonmissing arguments. At least 3 arguments are required.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description2: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description3: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description4: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: SLEEP
Function.Definition: For a specified period of time, suspends the execution of a program that invokes this function or call routine.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the number of units of time for which you want to suspend execution of a program. Range: n ≥ 0
Function.Description2: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies the unit of time, as a power of 10, which is applied to n. For example, 1 corresponds to a second, and .001 to a millisecond.

Function.Name: SMALLEST
Function.Definition: Returns the kth smallest nonmissing value.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that specifies which value to return.
Function.Description2: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: SOUNDEX
Function.Definition: Encodes a string to facilitate searching.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: SPEDIS
Function.Definition: Determines the likelihood of two words matching, expressed as the asymmetric spelling distance between the two words.
Function.Description1: Identifies the word to query for the likelihood of a match. SPEDIS removes trailing blanks before comparing the value.
Function.Description2: Specifies a target word for the query. SPEDIS removes trailing blanks before comparing the value.

Function.Name: SQRT
Function.Definition: Returns the square root of a value.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. Argument must be nonnegative.

Function.Name: STD
Function.Definition: Returns the standard deviation of the nonmissing arguments. At least two nonmissing arguments are required.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description2: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description3: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: STDERR
Function.Definition: Returns the standard error of the mean of the nonmissing arguments. At least two nonmissing arguments are required.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description2: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description3: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: STFIPS
Function.Definition: Converts state postal codes to FIPS state codes.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character expression that contains the two-character standard state postal code. Characters can be mixed case. The function ignores trailing blanks, but generates an error if the expression contains leading blanks.

Function.Name: STNAME
Function.Definition: Converts state postal codes to uppercase state names.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character expression that contains the two-character standard state postal code. Characters can be mixed case. The function ignores trailing blanks, but generates an error if the expression contains leading blanks.

Function.Name: STNAMEL
Function.Definition: Converts state postal codes to mixed case state names.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character expression that contains the two-character standard state postal code. Characters can be mixed case. The function ignores trailing blanks, but generates an error if the expression contains leading blanks.

Function.Name: STRIP
Function.Definition: Returns a character string with all leading and trailing blanks removed.
Function.Description1: Is a character constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: SUBPAD
Function.Definition: Returns a substring that has a length you specify, using blank padding if necessary.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description2: Is a positive integer that specifies the position of the first character in the substring.
Function.Description3: Is a non-negative integer that specifies the length of the substring. If you do not specify length, the SUBPAD function returns the substring that extends from the position that you specify to the end of the string.

Function.Name: SUBSTR*1
Function.Definition: Extracts a substring from an argument. Appropriate for a SUBSTR (right of =) function, of the form <variable=> SUBSTR(string, position<,length>.)
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description2: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression that is the beginning character position.
Function.Description3: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression that is the length of the substring to extract.

Function.Name: SUBSTR*2
Function.Definition: Replaces character value contents. Appropriate for a SUBSTR (left of =) function, of the form SUBSTR(variable, position<,length>)=characters-to-replace.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character variable.
Function.Description2: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression that is the beginning character position.
Function.Description3: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression that is the length of the substring that will be replaced.

Function.Name: SUBSTR*3
Function.Definition: %SUBSTR produces a substring of a character string.
Function.Description1: Is a character string or a text expression.
Function.Description2: Is an integer or an expression (text, logical, or arithmetic) that yields an integer, which specifies the position of the first character in the substring.
Function.Description3: Is an optional integer or an expression (text, logical, or arithmetic) that yields an integer that specifies the number of characters in the substring.

Function.Name: QSUBSTR
Function.Definition: %QSUBSTR produces a substring of a character string, masking special characters and mnemonic operators.
Function.Description1: Is a character string or a text expression that might contain special characters and mnemonic operators such as & % ' " ( ) + - * / < > = ¬ ^ ~ ; , #  blank AND OR NOT EQ NE LE LT GE GT IN.
Function.Description2: Is an integer or an expression (text, logical, or arithmetic) that yields an integer, which specifies the position of the first character in the substring.
Function.Description3: Is an optional integer or an expression (text, logical, or arithmetic) that yields an integer that specifies the number of characters in the substring.

Function.Name: SUBSTRN
Function.Definition: Returns a substring, allowing a result with a length of zero.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description2: Is an integer that specifies the position of the first character in the substring.
Function.Description3: Is an integer that specifies the length of the substring. If you do not specify length, the SUBSTRN function returns the substring that extends from the position that you specify to the end of the string.

Function.Name: SUM
Function.Definition: Returns the sum of the nonmissing arguments.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. If all the arguments have missing values, the result is a missing value.

Function.Name: SUMABS
Function.Definition: Returns the sum of the absolute values of the non-missing arguments.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric expression.
Function.Description2: Specifies a numeric expression.

Function.Name: SYMEXIST
Function.Definition: Returns an indication of the existence of a macro variable.
Function.Description1: Can be one of the following items: (1) the name of a macro variable within double quotation marks but without an ampersand; (2) the name of a DATA step character variable, specified with no quotation marks, which contains a macro variable name; (3) a character expression that constructs a macro variable name.

Function.Name: SYMGET
Function.Definition: Returns the value of a macro variable during DATA step execution.
Function.Description1: Can be one of the following items: (1) the name of a macro variable within double quotation marks but without an ampersand; (2) the name of a DATA step character variable, specified with no quotation marks, which contains a macro variable name; (3) a character expression that constructs a macro variable name.

Function.Name: SYMGLOBL
Function.Definition: Returns an indication of whether a macro variable is in global scope to the DATA step during DATA step execution.
Function.Description1: Can be one of the following items: (1) the name of a macro variable within double quotation marks but without an ampersand; (2) the name of a DATA step character variable, specified with no quotation marks, which contains a macro variable name; (3) a character expression that constructs a macro variable name.

Function.Name: SYMLOCAL
Function.Definition: Returns an indication of whether a macro variable is in local scope to the DATA step during DATA step execution.
Function.Description1: Can be one of the following items: (1) the name of a macro variable within double quotation marks but without an ampersand; (2) the name of a DATA step character variable, specified with no quotation marks, which contains a macro variable name; (3) a character expression that constructs a macro variable name.

Function.Name: SYSGET
Function.Definition: Returns the value of the specified operating environment variable.
Function.Description1: Is a character constant, variable, or expression with a value that is the name of an operating environment variable. The case of operating-environment-variable must agree with the case that is stored in the operating environment. Trailing blanks in the argument of SYSGET are significant. Use the TRIM function to remove them.

Function.Name: SYSMSG
Function.Definition: Returns error or warning message text from processing the last data set or external file function.

Function.Name: SYSPARM
Function.Definition: Returns the system parameter string.

Function.Name: SYSPROCESSID
Function.Definition: Returns the process ID of the current process.

Function.Name: SYSPROCESSNAME
Function.Definition: Returns the process name that is associated with a given process ID, or returns the name of the current process.
Function.Description1: Specifies a 32-character hexadecimal process id.

Function.Name: SYSPROD
Function.Definition: Determines whether a product is licensed.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression with a value that is the name of a SAS product.

Function.Name: SYSRC
Function.Definition: Returns a system error number.

Function.Name: SYSTEM
Function.Definition: Issues an operating environment command during a SAS session, and returns the system return code.
Function.Description1: Specifies any of the following: a system command that is enclosed in quotation marks (explicit character string), an expression whose value is a system command, or the name of a character variable whose value is a system command that is executed.

Function.Name: TAN
Function.Definition: Returns the tangent.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression and is expressed in radians.

Function.Name: TANH*1
Function.Definition: Returns the hyperbolic tangent.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: TANH*2
Function.Definition: This CALL TANH routine returns the hyperbolic tangent.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric variable. Do not use a constant or a SAS expression because the CALL routine is unable to update these arguments.
Function.Description2: Specifies a numeric variable. Do not use a constant or a SAS expression because the CALL routine is unable to update these arguments.

Function.Name: TIME
Function.Definition:
Returns the current time of day as a numeric SAS time value. 
    
Interaction:
If the value of the TIMEZONE= system option is set to a time zone name or time zone ID, the date and time values that are returned for this function are determined by the time zone.

Function.Name: TIMEPART
Function.Definition: Extracts a time value from a SAS datetime value.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric constant, variable, or expression that represents a SAS datetime value.

Function.Name: TINV
Function.Definition: Returns a quantile from the t distribution.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric probability. Range: 0 < p < 1
Function.Description2: Is a numeric degrees of freedom parameter. Range: df > 0.
Function.Description3: Is an optional numeric noncentrality parameter.

Function.Name: TNONCT
Function.Definition: Returns the value of the noncentrality parameter from the Student's t distribution.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric random variable.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric degrees of freedom parameter. Range: df > 0.
Function.Description3: Is a probability. Range: 0 < prob < 1

Function.Name: TODAY
Function.Definition:
Returns the current date as a numeric SAS date value. 
    
Alias: DATE 

Interaction:
If the value of the TIMEZONE= system option is set to a time zone name or time zone ID, the date and time values that are returned for this function are determined by the time zone.

Function.Name: TRANSLATE
Function.Definition: Replaces specific characters in a character string.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that contains the original character string.
Function.Description2: Specifies the characters that you want TRANSLATE to use as substitutes.
Function.Description3: Specifies the characters that you want TRANSLATE to replace.
Function.Description4: Additional to and from arguments.

Function.Name: TRANSTRN
Function.Definition: Replaces all occurrences of a substring found in a character string, allowing a zero-length replacement string.
Function.Description1: Specifies the input string.
Function.Description2: Specifies the string to be searched for.
Function.Description3: Specifies what each occurrence of the from argument will be changed to.

Function.Name: TRANWRD
Function.Definition: Replaces or removes all occurrences of a substring in a character string.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that you want to translate.
Function.Description2: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that is searched for in source.
Function.Description3: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that replaces target.

Function.Name: TRIGAMMA
Function.Definition: Returns the value of the trigamma function.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. Nonpositive integers are invalid.

Function.Name: TRIM
Function.Definition: Removes trailing blanks from a character string, and returns one blank if the string is missing.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: QTRIM
Function.Definition: Removes trailing blanks from a character string, and returns one blank if the string is missing. QTRIM produces a result with special characters and mnemonic operators masked.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or text expression that might contain special characters and/or mnemonic operators such as & % ' " ( ) + - * / < > = ¬ ^ ~ ; , # blank AND OR NOT EQ NE LE LT GE GT IN.

Function.Name: TRIMN
Function.Definition: Removes trailing blanks from character expressions, and returns a string with a length of zero if the expression is missing.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: TRUNC
Function.Definition: Truncates a numeric value to a specified number of bytes.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description2: Specifies an integer.

Function.Name: UNIFORM
Function.Definition: Returns a random variate from a uniform distribution.
Function.Description1: Is the seed value. A new value for seed is returned each time CALL RANUNI is executed. Range: seed < 2³¹ - 1.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric variable. A new value for the random variate x is returned each time CALL RANUNI is executed.

Function.Name: UPCASE
Function.Definition: Converts all letters in an argument to uppercase.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: QUPCASE
Function.Definition: Converts all letters in an argument to uppercase. %QUPCASE masks special characters and mnemonic operators in its result.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or text expression that might contain special characters and/or mnemonic operators such as & % ' " ( ) + - * / < > = ¬ ^ ~ ; , # blank AND OR NOT EQ NE LE LT GE GT IN.

Function.Name: URLDECODE
Function.Definition: Returns a string that was decoded using the URL escape syntax.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: URLENCODE
Function.Definition: Returns a string that was encoded using the URL escape syntax.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: USS
Function.Definition: Returns the uncorrected sum of squares of the nonmissing arguments. At least one nonmissing argument is required.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description2: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression.

Function.Name: UUIDGEN
Function.Definition: Returns the short or binary form of a Universal Unique Identifier (UUID).
Function.Description1: Specifies an integer value that represents the maximum number of warnings that this function writes to the log. Default: 1.
Function.Description2: Specifies an integer value that indicates whether this function should return a binary result. Nonzero indicates a binary result should be returned. Zero indicates that a character result should be returned. Default: 0.

Function.Name: VAR
Function.Definition: Returns the variance of the nonmissing arguments. At least two nonmissing arguments are required.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. The argument list can consist of a variable list, which is preceded by OF.
Function.Description2: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. The argument list can consist of a variable list, which is preceded by OF.
Function.Description3: Specifies a numeric constant, variable, or expression. The argument list can consist of a variable list, which is preceded by OF.

Function.Name: VARFMT
Function.Definition: Returns the format that is assigned to a SAS data set variable.
Function.Description1: Specifies the data set identifier that the OPEN function returns.
Function.Description2: Specifies the number of the variable's position in the SAS data set.

Function.Name: VARINFMT
Function.Definition: Returns the informat that is assigned to a SAS data set variable.
Function.Description1: Specifies the data set identifier that the OPEN function returns.
Function.Description2: Specifies the number of the variable's position in the SAS data set.

Function.Name: VARLABEL
Function.Definition: Returns the label that is assigned to a SAS data set variable.
Function.Description1: Specifies the data set identifier that the OPEN function returns.
Function.Description2: Specifies the number of the variable's position in the SAS data set.

Function.Name: VARLEN
Function.Definition: Returns the length of a SAS data set variable.
Function.Description1: Specifies the data set identifier that the OPEN function returns.
Function.Description2: Specifies the number of the variable's position in the SAS data set.

Function.Name: VARNAME
Function.Definition: Returns the name of a SAS data set variable.
Function.Description1: Specifies the data set identifier that the OPEN function returns.
Function.Description2: Specifies the number of the variable's position in the SAS data set.

Function.Name: VARNUM
Function.Definition: Returns the number of a variable's position in a SAS data set.
Description1: Specifies the data set identifier that the OPEN function returns.
Function.Description2: Specifies the variable's name.

Function.Name: VARRAY
Function.Definition: Returns a value that indicates whether the specified name is an array.
Function.Description1: Specifies a name that is expressed as a scalar or as an array reference.

Function.Name: VARRAYX
Function.Definition: Returns a value that indicates whether the value of the specified argument is an array.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression. The value of the specified expression cannot denote an array reference.

Function.Name: VARTYPE
Function.Definition: Returns the data type of a SAS data set variable.
Function.Description1: Specifies the data set identifier that the OPEN function returns.
Function.Description2: Specifies the number of the variable's position in the SAS data set.

Function.Name: VERIFY
Function.Definition: Returns the position of the first character in a string that is not in any of several other strings.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression.
Function.Description2: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression. If you specify more than one excerpt, separate them with a comma.
Function.Description3: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression. If you specify more than one excerpt, separate them with a comma.

Function.Name: VFORMAT
Function.Definition: Returns the format that is associated with the specified variable.
Function.Description1: Specifies a variable that is expressed as a scalar or as an array reference. You cannot use an expression as an argument.

Function.Name: VFORMATD
Function.Definition: Returns the decimal value of the format that is associated with the specified variable.
Function.Description1: Specifies a variable that is expressed as a scalar or as an array reference. You cannot use an expression as an argument.

Function.Name: VFORMATDX
Function.Definition: Returns the decimal value of the format that is associated with the value of the specified argument.
Function.Description1: Specifies a SAS character constant, variable, or expression that evaluates to a variable name. The value of the specified expression cannot denote an array reference.

Function.Name: VFORMATN
Function.Definition: Returns the format name that is associated with the specified variable.
Function.Description1: Specifies a variable that is expressed as a scalar or as an array reference. You cannot use an expression as an argument.

Function.Name: VFORMATNX
Function.Definition: Returns the format name that is associated with the value of the specified argument.
Function.Description1: Specifies a SAS character constant, variable, or expression that evaluates to a variable name. The value of the specified expression cannot denote an array reference.

Function.Name: VFORMATW
Function.Definition: Returns the format width that is associated with the specified variable.
Function.Description1: Specifies a variable that is expressed as a scalar or as an array reference. You cannot use an expression as an argument.

Function.Name: VFORMATWX
Function.Definition: Returns the format width that is associated with the value of the specified argument.
Function.Description1: Specifies a SAS character constant, variable, or expression that evaluates to a variable name. The value of the specified expression cannot denote an array reference.

Function.Name: VFORMATX
Function.Definition: Returns the format that is associated with the value of the specified argument.
Function.Description1: Specifies a SAS character constant, variable, or expression that evaluates to a variable name. The value of the specified expression cannot denote an array reference.

Function.Name: VINARRAY
Function.Definition: Returns a value that indicates whether the specified variable is a member of an array.
Function.Description1: Specifies a variable that is expressed as a scalar or as an array reference. You cannot use an expression as an argument.

Function.Name: VINARRAYX
Function.Definition: Returns a value that indicates whether the value of the specified argument is a member of an array.
Function.Description1: Specifies a SAS character constant, variable, or expression that evaluates to a variable name. The value of the specified expression cannot denote an array reference.

Function.Name: VINFORMAT
Function.Definition: Returns the informat that is associated with the specified variable.
Function.Description1: Specifies a variable that is expressed as a scalar or as an array reference. You cannot use an expression as an argument.

Function.Name: VINFORMATD
Function.Definition: Returns the decimal value of the informat that is associated with the specified variable.
Function.Description1: Specifies a variable that is expressed as a scalar or as an array reference. You cannot use an expression as an argument.

Function.Name: VINFORMATDX
Function.Definition: Returns the decimal value of the informat that is associated with the value of the specified variable.
Function.Description1: Specifies a SAS character constant, variable, or expression that evaluates to a variable name. The value of the specified expression cannot denote an array reference.

Function.Name: VINFORMATN
Function.Definition: Returns the informat name that is associated with the specified variable.
Function.Description1: Specifies a variable that is expressed as a scalar or as an array reference. You cannot use an expression as an argument.

Function.Name: VINFORMATNX
Function.Definition: Returns the informat name that is associated with the value of the specified argument.
Function.Description1: Specifies a SAS character constant, variable, or expression that evaluates to a variable name. The value of the specified expression cannot denote an array reference.

Function.Name: VINFORMATW
Function.Definition: Returns the informat width that is associated with the specified variable.
Function.Description1: Specifies a variable that is expressed as a scalar or as an array reference. You cannot use an expression as an argument.

Function.Name: VINFORMATWX
Function.Definition: Returns the informat width that is associated with the value of the specified argument.
Function.Description1: Specifies a SAS character constant, variable, or expression that evaluates to a variable name. The value of the specified expression cannot denote an array reference.

Function.Name: VINFORMATX
Function.Definition: Returns the informat that is associated with the value of the specified argument.
Function.Description1: Specifies a SAS character constant, variable, or expression that evaluates to a variable name. The value of the specified expression cannot denote an array reference.

Function.Name: VLABEL
Function.Definition: Returns the label that is associated with the specified variable.
Function.Description1: Specifies a variable that is expressed as a scalar or as an array reference. You cannot use an expression as an argument.

Function.Name: VLABELX
Function.Definition: Returns the label that is associated with the value of the specified argument.
Function.Description1: Specifies a SAS character constant, variable, or expression that evaluates to a variable name. The value of the specified expression cannot denote an array reference.

Function.Name: VLENGTH
Function.Definition: Returns the compile-time (allocated) size of the specified variable.
Function.Description1: Specifies a variable that is expressed as a scalar or as an array reference. You cannot use an expression as an argument.

Function.Name: VLENGTHX
Function.Definition: Returns the compile-time (allocated) size for the variable that has a name that is the same as the value of the argument.
Function.Description1: Specifies a SAS character constant, variable, or expression that evaluates to a variable name. The value of the specified expression cannot denote an array reference.

Function.Name: VNAME*1
Function.Definition: Returns the name of the specified variable.
Function.Description1: Specifies a variable that is expressed as a scalar or as an array reference. You cannot use an expression as an argument.

Function.Name: VNAME*2
Function.Definition: Assigns a variable name as the value of a specified variable (variable-2).
Function.Description1: Specifies any SAS variable.
Function.Description2: Specifies any SAS character variable. Because SAS variable names can contain up to 32 characters, the length of variable-2 should be at least 32.

Function.Name: VNAMEX
Function.Definition: Validates the value of the specified argument as a variable name.
Function.Description1: Specifies a SAS character constant, variable, or expression that evaluates to a variable name. The value of the specified expression cannot denote an array reference.

Function.Name: VTYPE
Function.Definition: Returns the type (character or numeric) of the specified variable.
Function.Description1: Specifies a variable that is expressed as a scalar or as an array reference. You cannot use an expression as an argument.

Function.Name: VTYPEX
Function.Definition: Returns the type (character or numeric) for the value of the specified argument.
Function.Description1: Specifies a SAS character constant, variable, or expression that evaluates to a variable name. The value of the specified expression cannot denote an array reference.

Function.Name: VVALUE
Function.Definition: Returns the formatted value that is associated with the variable that you specify.
Function.Description1: Specifies a variable that is expressed as a scalar or as an array reference. You cannot use an expression as an argument.

Function.Name: VVALUEX
Function.Definition: Returns the formatted value that is associated with the argument that you specify.
Function.Description1: Specifies a SAS character constant, variable, or expression that evaluates to a variable name. The value of the specified expression cannot denote an array reference.

Function.Name: WEEK
Function.Definition: Returns the week-number value.
Function.Description1: Specifies a SAS date value. If the SAS date argument is not specified, the WEEK function returns the week-number value of the current date.
Function.Description2: Specifies the value of the descriptor. The following descriptors can be specified in uppercase or lowercase characters: 'U' (Default; SAS date specified as number-of-week value in decimal number 0-53; Sunday first day of week); 'V' (SAS date specified as number-of-week value in decimal number 1-53; Monday first day of week); 'W' (SAS date specified as number-of-week value in decimal number 0-53; Monday first day of week);

Function.Name: WEEKDAY
Function.Definition: From a SAS date value, returns an integer that corresponds to the day of the week.
Function.Description1: Specifies a SAS expression that represents a SAS date value.

Function.Name: WHICHC
Function.Definition: Searches for a character value that is equal to the first argument, and returns the index of the first matching value.
Function.Description1: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the value to search for.
Function.Description2: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the value to be searched.
Function.Description3: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the value to be searched.

Function.Name: WHICHN
Function.Definition: Searches for a numeric value that is equal to the first argument, and returns the index of the first matching value.
Function.Description1: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the value to search for.
Function.Description2: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the value to be searched.
Function.Description3: Is a character constant, variable, or expression that specifies the value to be searched.

Function.Name: YEAR
Function.Definition: Returns the year from a SAS date value.
Function.Description1: Specifies a SAS expression that represents a SAS date value.

Function.Name: YIELDP
Function.Definition: Returns the yield-to-maturity for a periodic cash flow stream, such as a bond.
Function.Description1: Specifies the face value. Range: A > 0.
Function.Description2: Specifies the nominal annual coupon rate, expressed as a fraction. Range: 0 ≤ c < 1.
Function.Description3: Specifies the number of coupons per year. Range: n > 0.
Function.Description4: Specifies the number of remaining coupons from settlement date to maturity. Range: K > 0 and is an integer.
Function.Description5: Specifies the time from settlement date to the next coupon as a fraction of the annual basis.  Range: 0 < c ≤ 1/n.
Function.Description6: Specifies the price with accrued interest. Range: p > 0.

Function.Name: YRDIF
Function.Definition: Returns the difference in years between two dates.
Function.Description1: Specifies a SAS date value that identifies the starting date.
Function.Description2: Specifies a SAS date value that identifies the ending date.
Function.Description3: Identifies a character constant or variable that describes how SAS calculates the date difference in the securities industry. The following character strings are valid: '30/360' (30-day month and a 360-day year), 'ACT/ACT' (uses actual number of days between dates), 'ACT/360' (uses actual number of calendar days in a month, and 360 days for the year), 'ACT/365' (uses actual number of calendar days for each month, and 365 days for the year).

Function.Name: YYQ
Function.Definition: Returns a SAS date value from year and quarter year values.
Function.Description1: Specifies a two-digit or four-digit integer that represents the year. The YEARCUTOFF= system option defines the year value for two-digit dates.
Function.Description2: Specifies the quarter of the year (1, 2, 3, or 4).

Function.Name: ZIPCITY
Function.Definition: Returns a city name and the two-character postal code that corresponds to a zip code.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric or character expression that contains a five-digit zip code.

Function.Name: ZIPCITYDISTANCE
Function.Definition: Returns the geodetic distance between two zip code locations.
Description1: Specifies a numeric or character expression that contains the zip code of a location in the United States of America.
Specifies a numeric or character expression that contains the zip code of a location in the United States of America.

Function.Name: ZIPFIPS
Function.Definition: Converts zip codes to two-digit FIPS codes.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric or character expression that contains a five-digit zip code.

Function.Name: ZIPNAME
Function.Definition: Converts zip codes to uppercase state names.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric or character expression that contains a five-digit zip code.

Function.Name: ZIPNAMEL
Function.Definition: Converts zip codes to mixed case state names.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric or character expression that contains a five-digit zip code.

Function.Name: ZIPSTATE
Function.Definition: Converts zip codes to two-character state postal codes.
Function.Description1: Specifies a numeric or character expression that contains a five-digit zip code.

Function.Name: ASCEBC
Function.Definition: Converts an input character string from ASCII to EBCDIC.
Function.Description1: Is any ASCII string, and can be a character variable, a character literal enclosed in double quotation marks, or another character expression. The value of in-string is limited to 200 characters.

Function.Name: EBCASC
Function.Definition: Converts an input character string from EBCDIC to ASCII.
Function.Description1: Is any EBCDIC string, and can be a character variable, a character literal enclosed in double quotation marks, or another character expression. The value of in-string is limited to 200 characters.

Function.Name: FILEATTR
Function.Definition: Returns the attribute information for a specified file.
Function.Description1: Is the file for which you are requesting information. It can be a character variable, a character literal enclosed in double quotation marks, or another character expression.
Function.Description2: Specifies which attribute of the file you are requesting. It can be a character variable, a character literal enclosed in double quotation marks, or another character expression.

Function.Name: FINDFILE
Function.Definition: Searches a directory for a file.
Function.Description1: Specifies the file specification of the file that you are searching for. It can contain any valid OpenVMS file specification, including wildcards. The value for file-specification can be a character variable, a character literal enclosed in double quotation marks, or another character expression.
Function.Description2: Is a variable used internally by SAS to maintain the search context between executions of FINDFILE. It must be initialized to 0 before the first execution of FINDFILE for a given file-specification and must not be modified between executions.

Function.Name: GETDVI
Function.Definition: Returns a specified item of information from a device.
Function.Description1: Specifies a physical device name or a logical name equated to a physical device name. Specify the device name as a character-string expression.
Function.Description2: Is a character variable that contains any item accepted by the F$GETDVI lexical function (for example, the physical device name).

Function.Name: GETJPI
Function.Definition: Retrieves job-process information.
Function.Description1: Is a character variable that contains any item accepted by the F$GETJPI lexical function, for example, a user process name.
Function.Description2: Can be either character (process-name variable) or numeric (process-ID variable).

Function.Name: GETLOG
Function.Definition: Returns information about a DCL logical name.
Function.Description1: Can be a character variable, character literal enclosed in double quotation marks, or another character expression.
Function.Description2: Is an optional character parameter that is the name of a DCL logical name table. It can be a character variable, a character literal enclosed in double quotation marks, or another character expression.
Function.Description3: Is an optional numeric parameter that indicates the number of the translation to return if a logical name has multiple translations. This argument can be either a numeric literal or numeric variable. The default value is 0.
Function.Description4: Is an optional character parameter that contains the access mode to be used for translation. It can be a character variable, a character literal enclosed in double quotation marks, or another character expression. The default is "USER".
Function.Description5: Is an optional character parameter that determines the case to be used for translation. Values: "CASE_BLIND" | "CASE_SENSITIVE".
Function.Description6: Is an optional character parameter that specifies what type of information is to be returned about a logical name. It can be a character variable, a character literal enclosed in double quotation marks, or another character expression. The default value is "VALUE".

Function.Name: GETMSG
Function.Definition: Translates an OpenVMS error code into text.
Function.Description1: Is an OpenVMS status code. It is usually returned from one of the other functions that return an OpenVMS status code on failure.

Function.Name: GETQUOTA
Function.Definition: Retrieves disk quota information.
Function.Description1: Is the device that you want to gather disk quota information for.
Function.Description2: Receives your numeric user identification code (UIC) on the disk. The UICw. format can be used to format the numeric value. This variable must be initialized to 0 before the first execution.
Function.Description3: Receives your current disk usage in blocks. This variable must be initialized to 0 before the first execution.
Function.Description4: Receives your permanent quota. This variable must be initialized to 0 before the first execution.
Function.Description5: Receives your allowed overdraft. This variable must be initialized to 0 before the first execution.
Function.Description6: Is a numeric variable that must be initialized to 0 before the first execution and must not be modified between calls.
Function.Description7: Is a numeric variable that must be initialized to 0 before the first execution and must not be modified between calls.

Function.Name: GETSYM
Function.Definition: Returns the value of a DCL symbol.
Function.Description1: Is the name of a DCL symbol defined in your process. It can be a character variable, character literal enclosed in double quotation marks, or another character expression. If symbol-name is more than 200 characters long, it is truncated.

Function.Name: GETTERM
Function.Definition: Returns the characteristics of your terminal device.
Function.Description1: Is the name of the terminal characteristic to be returned. The argument can be a character variable, character literal enclosed in double quotation marks, or another character expression. If characteristic-name is longer than 200 characters, it is truncated.

Function.Name: NODENAME
Function.Definition: Returns the name of the current node.

Function.Name: PUTLOG
Function.Definition: Creates an OpenVMS logical-name in your process-level logical name table.
Function.Description1: The name of the OpenVMS logical name that you want to create. It can be a character variable, a character literal enclosed in double quotation marks, or another character expression.
Function.Description2: Is the string to be assigned to the symbol. It can be a character variable, a character literal enclosed in double quotation marks, or another character expression.

Function.Name: PUTSYM
Function.Definition: Creates a DCL symbol in the parent SAS process.
Function.Description1: Is the name of the DCL symbol that you want to create. It can be a character variable value, a character literal enclosed in double quotation marks, or another character expression.
Function.Description2: Is the string to be assigned to the symbol. It can be a character variable, a character literal enclosed in double quotation marks, or another character expression.
Function.Description3: Defines whether the symbol is a local or global symbol. If the value of scope is 1, the symbol is defined as a local symbol. If the value of scope is 2, the symbol is defined as a global symbol. The scope argument can be either a numeric literal or a numeric variable.

Function.Name: SETTERM
Function.Definition: Modifies a characteristic of your terminal device.
Function.Description1: Is the name of the terminal characteristic to be modified. The argument can be a character variable, a character literal enclosed in double quotation marks, or another character expression.
Function.Description2: Is the new setting for the characteristic.

Function.Name: TERMIN
Function.Definition: Allows simple input from SYS$INPUT.
Function.Description1: Is the prompt printed on the monitor. It can be a character variable, a character literal enclosed in double quotation marks, or another character expression.

Function.Name: TERMOUT
Function.Definition: Allows simple output to SYS$OUTPUT.
Function.Description1: Is a character string to write to SYS$OUTPUT. It can be a character variable, character literal enclosed in double quotation marks, or another character expression.

Function.Name: TTCLOSE
Function.Definition: Closes a channel that was previously assigned by TTOPEN.
Function.Description1: Is the channel variable returned from the TTOPEN function.

Function.Name: TTCONTRL
Function.Definition: Modifies the characteristics of a channel that was previously assigned by TTOPEN.
Function.Description1: Is the control string as described for the TTOPEN function. The syntax for control-specification is the same as for TTOPEN, except that the DEVICE= attribute cannot be changed.
Function.Description2: Is the channel variable that was returned from the TTOPEN function.

Function.Name: TTOPEN
Function.Definition: Assigns an I/O channel to a terminal.
Function.Description1: Is the control string that specifies the terminal and processing options, separated from each other by blanks. It can be a character variable, a character literal enclosed in double quotation marks, or another character expression.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric variable into which the TTOPEN function places the channel number.

Function.Name: TTREAD
Function.Definition: Reads characters from the channel assigned by TTOPEN.
Function.Description1: Is the channel variable returned from the TTOPEN function.
Function.Description2: Is the character variable where the returned characters are stored.
Function.Description3: Is an optional numeric variable, numeric literal, or an expression which indicates the maximum number of characters to read and receives the number of characters read. If you do not specify size, the TTREAD function reads characters up to the size of buffer.

Function.Name: TTWRITE
Function.Definition: Writes characters to the channel assigned by TTOPEN.
Function.Description1: Is the channel variable returned from the TTOPEN function.
Function.Description2: Is the character variable, character literal, or an expression that contains the data to be written.
Function.Description3: Is an optional numeric variable, numeric literal, or expression that specifies how many characters to write from buffer. If you do not specify size, the entire buffer is sent, including any trailing blanks.

Function.Name: VMS
Function.Definition: Spawns a subprocess and executes a DCL command.
Function.Description1: Is the DCL command that is passed to the subprocess. It can be a character variable, a character literal enclosed in double quotation marks, or another character expression.

Function.Name: BQUOTE
Function.Definition: Mask special characters and mnemonic operators in a resolved value at macro execution.
Function.Description1: Character string or text expression.

Function.Name: NRBQUOTE
Function.Definition: Mask special characters and mnemonic operators in a resolved value at macro execution.
Function.Description1: Character string or text expression.

Function.Name: EVAL
Function.Definition: Evaluates arithmetic and logical expressions using integer arithmetic.
Function.Description1: Integer arithmetic or logical expression.

Function.Name: NRQUOTE
Function.Definition: Masks special characters, including & and %, and mnemonic operators in a resolved value at macro execution.
Function.Description1: Character string or text expression.

Function.Name: STR
Function.Definition: Masks special characters, excluding & and %, and mnemonic operators in constant text during macro compilation.
Function.Description1: A character string that may contain special characters and/or mnemonic operators such as + - * / < > = ¬ ^ ~ ; ,  # blank AND OR NOT EQ NE LE LT GE GT IN.

Function.Name: NRSTR
Function.Definition: Masks special characters, including & and %, and mnemonic operators in constant text during macro compilation.
Function.Description1: A character string that may contain special characters and/or mnemonic operators such as + - * / < > = ¬ ^ ~ ; ,  # blank AND OR NOT EQ NE LE LT GE GT IN & %.

Function.Name: QSCAN
Function.Definition: Searches for a word and masks special characters and mnemonic operators.
Function.Description1: Is a character string or a text expression. If argument might contain a special character or mnemonic operator, listed below, use %QSCAN.
Function.Description2: Is an integer or a text expression that yields an integer, which specifies the position of the word to return.
Function.Description3: Specifies an optional list of one or more characters that separate "words" or text expressions that yield one or more characters. Possible delimiters: blank . < ( + & ! $ * ) ; ^ - / , % |.

Function.Name: SUPERQ
Function.Definition: Masks all special characters and mnemonic operators at macro execution but prevents further resolution of the value.
Function.Description1: Is the name of a macro variable with no leading ampersand or a text expression that produces the name of a macro variable with no leading ampersand.

Function.Name: SYMEXIST
Function.Definition: Returns an indication of the existence of a macro variable.
Function.Description1: Is the name of a macro variable or a text expression that yields the name of a macro variable.

Function.Name: SYSEVALF
Function.Definition: Evaluates arithmetic and logical expressions using floating-point arithmetic.
Function.Description1: Is an arithmetic or logical expression to evaluate.
Function.Description2: Converts the value returned by %SYSEVALF to the type of value specified. Valid values: BOOLEAN (returns 0 if result is 0 or missing; 1 if any other value); CEIL (returns a character value representing the smallest integer that is greater than or equal to the result of the expression.); FLOOR (returns a character value representing the largest integer that is less than or equal to the result of the expression.); INTEGER (returns a character value representing the integer portion of the result, truncating the decimal portion.)

Function.Name: SYSFUNC
Function.Definition: Execute SAS functions or user-written functions.
Function.Description1: Is the function to execute, including one or more arguments used by the function. You cannot nest functions to be used with a single %SYSFUNC. However, you can nest %SYSFUNC calls.
Function.Description2: Is an optional format to apply to the result of function. This format can be provided by SAS, generated by PROC FORMAT, or created with SAS/TOOLKIT.

Function.Name: QSYSFUNC
Function.Definition: Execute SAS functions or user-written functions. %QSYSFUNC masks special characters and mnemonic operators such as & % ' " ( ) + - * / < > = ¬ ^ ~ ; , #  blank AND OR NOT EQ NE LE LT GE GT IN.
Function.Description1: Is the function to execute, including one or more arguments used by the function. You cannot nest functions to be used with a single %SYSFUNC. However, you can nest %SYSFUNC calls.
Function.Description2: Is an optional format to apply to the result of function. This format can be provided by SAS, generated by PROC FORMAT, or created with SAS/TOOLKIT.

Function.Name: SYSGET
Function.Definition: Returns the value of the specified operating environment variable.
Function.Description1: Is the name of an environment variable. The case of environment-variable must agree with the case that is stored on the operating environment.

Function.Name: SYSPROD
Function.Definition: Reports whether a SAS software product is licensed at the site.
Function.Description1: Can be a character string or text expression that yields a code for a SAS product: AF CPE GRAPH PH-CLINICAL ASSIST EIS IML QC BASE ETS INSIGHT  SHARE CALC FSP  LAB STAT CONNECT GIS OR TOOLKIT.

Function.Name: UNQUOTE
Function.Definition: During macro execution, unmasks all special characters and mnemonic operators for a value.
Function.Description1: Character string or text expression that might contain special characters and/or mnemonic operators.

Function.Name: CMPRES
Function.Definition: Compress multiple blanks and remove leading and trailing blanks.
Function.Description1: A character constant or expression.

Function.Name: QCMPRES
Function.Definition: Compress multiple blanks and remove leading and trailing blanks.  QCMPRES produces a result with special characters and mnemonic operators masked.
Function.Description1: A character constant or expression that might contain special characters and/or mnemonic operators such as & % ' " ( ) + - * / < > = ¬ ^ ~ ; , # blank AND OR NOT EQ NE LE LT GE GT IN.

Function.Name: COMPSTOR
Function.Definition: Compiles macros and stores them in a catalog in a permanent SAS library.
Function.Description1: SAS-data-library is the physical name of a SAS library on your host system.

Function.Name: DATATYP
Function.Definition: Returns the data type of a value.
Function.Description1: A character constant or expression.

Function.Name: VERIFY
Function.Definition: Returns the position of the first character unique to an expression. %VERIFY returns the position of the first character in source that is not also present in excerpt. If all characters in source are present in excerpt, %VERIFY returns 0.
Function.Description1: Is text or a text expression that you want to examine for characters that do not exist in excerpt.
Function.Description2: Is text or a text expression. This is the text that defines the set of characters that %VERIFY uses to examine source.

Function.Name: DQLOAD
Function.Definition: Sets system option values and loads locales into memory.
Function.Description1: Specifies a value for the DQLOCALE= system option to load an ordered list of locales into memory.
Function.Description2: Specifies a value for the system option DQSETUPLOC=.
Function.Description3: Generates additional information in the SAS log about the status of the locale load operation. The default value is DQINFO=0.

Function.Name: DQPUTLOC
Function.Definition: Displays current information on a specified locale in the SAS log.
Function.Description1: Specifies the locale of interest. The value can be a locale name in quotation marks or the name of a variable whose value is a locale name or an expression that evaluates to a locale name.
Function.Description2: Shortens the length of the entry in the SAS log. Specify SHORT=1 to remove the descriptions of how the definitions are used. The default value is SHORT=0, which displays the descriptions of how the definitions are used.
