Function.Description3: Lists with each gender analysis definition and each match definition the related parse definition, if such a parse definition exists. The default value PARSEDEFN=1 lists the related parse definition. PARSEDEFN=0 does not list the related parse definition.

Function.Name: DQCASE
Function.Definition: Returns a character value with standardized capitalization.
Function.Description1: Is the value that is transformed, according to the specified case definition. The value can be the name of a character variable, a character value in quotation marks, or an expression that evaluates to a variable name or a quoted value.
Function.Description2: Specifies the name of the case definition that will be referenced during the transformation.
Function.Description3: Specifies the name of the locale that contains the specified case definition. The value can be a name in quotation marks, the name of a variable whose value is a locale name, or an expression that evaluates to a variable name or to a quoted locale name.

Function.Name: DQGENDER
Function.Definition: Returns a gender determination from the name of an individual.
Function.Description1: Is the name of a character variable, a character value in quotation marks, or an expression that evaluates to a variable name or a quoted value.
Function.Description2: Specifies the name of the gender analysis definition, which must exist in the specified locale.
Function.Description3: Specifies the name of the locale that contains the specified gender analysis definition. The value can be a name in quotation marks, the name of a variable whose value is a locale name, or an expression that evaluates to a variable name or to a quoted locale name.

Function.Name: DQGENDERINFOGET
Function.Definition: Returns the name of the parse definition that is associated with the specified gender definition.
Function.Description1: Specifies the name of the gender analysis definition, which must exist in the specified locale.
Function.Description2: Specifies the name of the locale that contains the specified gender analysis definition. The value can be a name in quotation marks, the name of a variable whose value is a locale name, or an expression that evaluates to a variable name or to a quoted locale name.

Function.Name: DQGENDERPARSED
Function.Definition: Returns a gender determination from the parsed name of an individual.
Function.Description1: Is a parsed value that contains the name of an individual. The value can be expressed as the name of a character variable, a character value in quotation marks, or an expression that evaluates to a variable name or a quoted value.
Function.Description2: Specifies the name of the gender analysis definition that will be referenced to determine gender. The specified gender analysis definition has a related parse definition. To return an accurate gender determination, the related parse definition must be the same parse definition that was used to parse the parsed-char.
Function.Description3: Specifies the name of the locale that contains the specified gender analysis definition. The value can be a name in quotation marks, the name of a variable whose value is a locale name, or an expression that evaluates to a variable name or to a quoted locale name.

Function.Name: DQIDENTIFY
Function.Definition: Returns a category name from a character value.
Function.Description1: Is the value that is transformed, according to the specified identification definition. The value can be the name of a character variable, a character value in quotation marks, or an expression that evaluates to a variable name or a quoted value.
Function.Description2: Specifies the name of the identification definition, which must exist in the specified locale.
Function.Description3: Specifies the name of the locale that contains the specified identification definition. The value can be a name in quotation marks, the name of a variable whose value is a locale name, or an expression that evaluates to a variable name or to a quoted locale name.

Function.Name: DQLOCALEGUESS
Function.Definition: Returns the name of the locale that is most likely represented by a character value.
Function.Description1: Is the value that is analyzed to determine a locale, according to the specified guess definition. The value can be the name of a character variable, a character value in quotation marks, or an expression that evaluates to a variable name or a quoted value.
Function.Description2: Specifies the name of the guess definition.

Function.Name: DQLOCALEINFOGET
Function.Definition: Returns information about locales.
Function.Description1: Specifies the type of locale information that is to be returned. The only valid value is LOADED. If no parameter is specified, LOADED is used by default.

Function.Name: DQLOCALEINFOLIST
Function.Definition: Displays the names of the definitions in a locale and returns a count of those definitions.
Function.Description1: Specifies the definitions that are displayed. Valid values are ALL CASE GENDER GUESS IDENTIFICATION MATCH PARSE PATTERN STANDARDIZATION.
Function.Description2: Specifies the name of the locale. The value can be a name in quotation marks, the name of a variable whose value is a locale name, or an expression that evaluates to a variable name or to a quoted locale name.

Function.Name: DQMATCH
Function.Definition: Returns a match code from a character value.
Function.Description1: Is the value for which a match code is created, according to the specified match definition. The value can be the name of a character variable, a character value in quotation marks, or an expression that evaluates to a variable name or a quoted value.
Function.Description2: Specifies the name of the match definition.
Function.Description3: Specifies an integer value that determines the amount of information in the returned match code. Valid values range from 50 to 95. The default value is 85. A higher sensitivity value includes more information in the match code.
Function.Description4: Specifies the name of the locale that contains the specified match definition. The value can be a name in quotation marks, the name of a variable whose value is a locale name, or an expression that evaluates to a variable name or to a quoted locale name.

Function.Name: DQMATCHINFOGET
Function.Definition: Returns the name of the parse definition that is associated with a match definition.
Function.Description1: Specifies the name of the match definition, which must exist in the specified locale.
Function.Description2: Specifies the name of the locale that contains the specified match definition. The value can be a name in quotation marks, the name of a variable whose value is a locale name, or an expression that evaluates to a variable name or to a quoted locale name.

Function.Name: DQMATCHPARSED
Function.Definition: Returns a match code from a parsed character value.
Function.Description1: Is a parsed character value for which a match code will be created. The value can be the name of a character variable, a character value in quotation marks, or an expression that evaluates to a variable name or a quoted value. The value must have been parsed with the parse definition that is associated with the specified match definition.
Function.Description2: Specifies the name of the match definition.
Function.Description3: Specifies an integer value that determines the amount of information in the returned match code. Valid values range from 50 to 95. The default value is 85. A higher sensitivity value includes more information in the match code.
Function.Description4: Specifies the name of the locale that contains the specified match definition. The value can be a name in quotation marks, the name of a variable whose value is a locale name, or an expression that evaluates to a variable name or to a quoted locale name.

Function.Name: DQPARSE*1
Function.Definition: Returns a parsed character value and a status flag.
Function.Description1: Is the input value that is parsed according to the specified parse definition. The value can be the name of a character variable, a character value in quotation marks, or an expression that evaluates to a variable name or a quoted value.
Function.Description2: Specifies the name of the parse definition.
Function.Description3: Specifies the name of the locale that contains the specified parse definition. The value can be a name in quotation marks, the name of a variable whose value is a locale name, or an expression that evaluates to a variable name or to a quoted locale name.

Function.Name: DQPARSE*2
Function.Definition: Returns a parsed character value and a status flag.
Function.Description1: Is the input value that is parsed according to the specified parse definition. The value can be the name of a character variable, a character value in quotation marks, or an expression that evaluates to a variable name or a quoted value.
Function.Description2: Specifies the name of the parse definition
Function.Description3: Is an output character variable that receives the result of the parse operation.
Function.Description4: Is an output numeric variable that returns 1.0 when the parse operation is successful. Otherwise, this variable receives a 0.
Function.Description5: Specifies the name of the locale that contains the specified match definition. The value can be a name in quotation marks, the name of a variable whose value is a locale name, or an expression that evaluates to a variable name or to a quoted locale name.

Function.Name: DQPARSEINFOGET
Function.Definition: Returns the token names in a parse definition.
Function.Description1: Specifies the name of the parse definition.
Function.Description2: Specifies the name of the locale that contains the specified parse definition. The value can be a name in quotation marks, the name of a variable whose value is a locale name, or an expression that evaluates to a variable name or to a quoted locale name.

Function.Name: DQPARSETOKENGET
Function.Definition: Returns a token from a parsed character value.
Function.Description1: Is the parsed character value from which the value of the specified token will be returned. The parsed-char can be the name of a character variable, a character value in quotation marks, or an expression that evaluates to a variable name or a quoted value.
Function.Description2: Specifies the name of the token that is returned from the parsed value. The token must be enabled by the specified parse definition.
Function.Description3: Specifies the name of the parse definition that will be used to obtain the value of the token. The parse definition must be the same as the parse definition that originally parsed the parsed-char value.
Function.Description4: Specifies the name of the locale that contains the specified match definition. The value can be a name in quotation marks, the name of a variable whose value is a locale name, or an expression that evaluates to a variable name or to a quoted locale name.

Function.Name: DQPARSETOKENPUT
Function.Definition: Inserts a token into a parsed character value and returns the updated parsed character value.
Function.Description1: Is the parsed character value that receives the new token value, according to the specified parse definition. The parsed-char value can be the name of a character variable, a character value in quotation marks, or an expression that evaluates to a variable name or a quoted value.
Function.Description2: Specifies the value of the token that is to be inserted into the parsed value.
Function.Description3: Specifies the name of the token that is to be inserted into the parsed value. The specified token must be enabled by the specified parse definition.
Function.Description4: Specifies the name of the parse definition, which must exist in the specified locale. The specified parse definition must be the same definition that was used to parse the parsed-char value.
Function.Description5: Specifies the name of the parse definition, which must exist in the specified locale. The specified parse definition must be the same definition that was used to parse the parsed-char value.

Function.Name: DQPATTERN
Function.Definition: Returns a pattern analysis from an input character value.
Function.Description1: Is the name of the value that will be analyzed. The value can be a character variable, a character value in quotation marks, or an expression that evaluates to a variable name or a quoted value.
Function.Description2: Specifies the name of the definition that will be referenced during the creation of the pattern analysis. The definition must exist in the specified locale.
Function.Description3: Specifies the name of the locale that contains the specified pattern analysis definition. The value can be a name in quotation marks, the name of a variable whose value is a locale name, or an expression that evaluates to a variable name or to a quoted locale name.

Function.Name: DQSCHEMEAPPLY*1
Function.Definition: Applies a scheme and returns a transformed value.
Function.Description1: Is the value to which the specified scheme will be applied. The value can be the name of a character variable, a character value in quotation marks, or an expression that evaluates to a variable name or a quoted value.
Function.Description2: Identifies the scheme that is applied to the input value. For schemes using SAS format, the scheme argument is a fully-qualified SAS data set name in quotation marks.
Function.Description3:
Identifies the file format of the scheme. Valid values are as follows:

      BFD
      indicates that the specified scheme is stored in Blue Fusion Data format. This is the default value.

      NOBFD
      indicates that the specified scheme is stored in SAS format.
Function.Description4:
Specifies how the scheme is to be applied to the values of the input character variable. Valid values for the mode argument are defined as follows:

      PHRASE
      compares the entire input character value to the entirety of each of the DATA values in the scheme.

      ELEMENT
      compares each element in the input character value to each of the DATA values in the scheme.
Function.Description5:
Specifies one of three mutually-exclusive methods of applying the scheme. Valid values are as follows:

      EXACT
      this default value specifies that the input value is to be compared to the DATA values in the scheme without changing the input value in any way.

      IGNORE_CASE
      specifies that capitalization is to be ignored when the input value is compared to the DATA values in the scheme.

      USE_MATCHDEF
      specifies that the match code of the input value is to be compared to the match codes of the DATA values in the scheme.
Function.Description6: Specifies the name of the match definition in the specified locale that will be used to create match codes during the application of the scheme.
Function.Description7: Specifies the amount of information in the match codes that are created during the application of the scheme. With higher sensitivity values, two values must be increasingly similar to create the same match code. At lower sensitivity values, values can receive the same match code despite their dissimilarities. Valid values range from 50 to 95.
Function.Description8: Specifies the locale that contains the specified match definition that will be referenced during the application of the scheme. The value can be a locale name in quotation marks, or the name of a variable whose value resolves to a locale name.

Function.Name: DQSCHEMEAPPLY*2
Function.Definition: Applies a scheme and returns a transformed value and a transformation flag.
Function.Description1: Is the value to which the specified scheme will be applied. The value can be the name of a character variable, a character value in quotation marks, or an expression that evaluates to a variable name or a quoted value.
Function.Description2: Identifies the character variable that receives the transformed input value.
Function.Description3: Identifies the scheme that is applied to the input value.
Function.Description4:
Identifies the file format of the scheme. Valid values are as follows:

      BFD
      indicates that the specified scheme is stored in Blue Fusion Data format. This is the default value.

      NOBFD
      indicates that the specified scheme is stored in SAS format.
Function.Description5:
Specifies how the scheme is to be applied to the values of the input character variable. Valid values for the mode argument are defined as follows:

      PHRASE
      compares the entire input character value to the entirety of each of the DATA values in the scheme.

      ELEMENT
      compares each element in the input character value to each of the DATA values in the scheme.
Function.Description6: Identifies the numeric variable that receives the returned number of transformations that were performed on the input value.
Function.Description7:
Specifies one of three mutually-exclusive methods of applying the scheme. Valid values are as follows:

      EXACT
      this default value specifies that the input value is to be compared to the DATA values in the scheme without changing the input value in any way.

      IGNORE_CASE
      specifies that capitalization is to be ignored when the input value is compared to the DATA values in the scheme.

      USE_MATCHDEF
      specifies that the match code of the input value is to be compared to the match codes of the DATA values in the scheme.
Function.Description8: Specifies the name of the match definition in the specified locale that will be used to create match codes during the application of the scheme.
Function.Description9: Specifies the amount of information in the match codes that are created during the application of the scheme. With higher sensitivity values, two values must be increasingly similar to create the same match code. At lower sensitivity values, two values receive the same match code despite their dissimilarities. Valid values range from 50 to 95.
Function.Description10: Specifies the locale that contains the specified match definition that will be referenced during the application of the scheme. The value can be a locale name in quotation marks or the name of a variable whose value resolves to a locale name.

Function.Name: DQSRVARCHJOB
Function.Definition: Runs an dfPower Architect job on a DataFlux Integration Server and returns a job identifier.
Function.Description1: Identifies the dfPower Architect job as it exists on the specified DataFlux Integration Server.
Function.Description2: Identifies the host of the DataFlux Integration Server. If this value is not specified, then the local host is used by default.
Function.Description3: Identifies the port through which the local host communicates with the DataFlux Integration Server. If this argument is not specified, or if the value is 0 or a negative number, then the default port number is used. The default port number is 21036.
Function.Description4: Identifies an dfPower Architect macro that exists on the DataFlux Integration Server. The value of macro-nameX can be specified as text, or as the name of a character variable.
Function.Description5: Specifies the character value that will be used by the associated dfPower Architect macro. Macro-value1 is used by macro-name1. The value of macro-valueX can be specified as text, or as the name of a character variable.
Function.Description6: Identifies an dfPower Architect macro that exists on the DataFlux Integration Server. The value of macro-nameX can be specified as text, or as the name of a character variable.
Function.Description7: Specifies the character value that will be used by the associated dfPower Architect macro. Macro-value1 is used by macro-name1. The value of macro-valueX can be specified as text, or as the name of a character variable.

Function.Name: DQSRVCOPYLOG
Function.Definition: Copies a job's log file from a DataFlux Integration Server.
Function.Description1: Identifies the job that was submitted to a DataFlux Integration Server. The identifier was previously returned by a function such as DQSRVARCHJOB or DQSRVPROFJOBFILE.
Function.Description2: Identifies the host of the DataFlux Integration Server. If this value is not specified, then the local host is used by default.
Function.Description3: Identifies the port through which the local host communicates with the DataFlux Integration Server. If this argument is not specified, or if the value is 0 or a negative number, then the default port number is used. The default port number is 21036.
Function.Description4: Identifies where the log file will be copied on the local host.

Function.Name: DQSRVDELETELOG
Function.Definition: Deletes a job's log file from a DataFlux Integration Server.
Function.Description1: Identifies the job that was submitted to a DataFlux Integration Server. The identifier was previously returned by a function such as DQSRVARCHJOB or DQSRVPROFJOBFILE.
Function.Description2: Identifies the host of the DataFlux Integration Server. If this value is not specified, then the local host is used by default.
Function.Description3: Identifies the port through which the local host communicates with the DataFlux Integration Server. If this argument is not specified, or if the value is 0 or a negative number, then the default port number is used. The default port number is 21036.

Function.Name: DQSRVJOBSTATUS
Function.Definition: Returns the status of a job that was submitted to a DataFlux Integration Server.
Function.Description1: Identifies the job that was submitted to a DataFlux Integration Server. The identifier was previously returned by a function such as DQSRVARCHJOB or DQSRVPROFJOBFILE.
Function.Description2: Identifies the host of the DataFlux Integration Server. If this value is not specified, then the local host is used by default.
Function.Description3: Identifies the port through which the local host communicates with the DataFlux Integration Server. If this argument is not specified, or if the value is 0 or a negative number, then the default port number is used. The default port number is 21036.
Function.Description4:
Specifies a time in seconds that determines when status information is returned from the host. Valid values are defined as follows:

      -1 
      returns status information only when the job is finished. Return values are 0 (job completed successfully) or 1 (job failed).

      0 
      returns status information immediately. Return values are 0 (job completed successfully), 1 (job failed), or 2 (job running).

      greater-than-zero: 
      specifies a time limit for the interval argument. If the job is still running after the timeout value, another value is returned only when the job is finished.
Function.Description5: Specifies the repeat period for the return of status information, within the limit that is imposed by the timeout argument.

Function.Name: DQSRVKILLJOB
Function.Definition: Terminates a job that is running on a DataFlux Integration Server.
Function.Description1: Identifies the job that was submitted to a DataFlux Integration Server. The identifier was previously returned by a function such as DQSRVARCHJOB or DQSRVPROFJOBFILE.
Function.Description2: Identifies the host of the DataFlux Integration Server. If this value is not specified, then the local host is used by default.
Function.Description3: Identifies the port through which the local host communicates with the DataFlux Integration Server. If this argument is not specified, or if the value is 0 or a negative number, then the default port number is used. The default port number is 21036.

Function.Name: DQSRVPROFJOBFILE
Function.Definition: Runs a file-type Profile job on a DataFlux Integration Server and returns a job identifier.
Function.Description1: Identifies the dfPower Architect job as it exists on the specified DataFlux Integration Server.
Function.Description2: Identifies the host of the DataFlux Integration Server. If this value is not specified, then the local host is used by default.
Function.Description3: Identifies the port through which the local host communicates with the DataFlux Integration Server. If this argument is not specified, or if the value is 0 or a negative number, then the default port number is used. The default port number is 21036.
Function.Description4: Identifies the file that receives job results.
Function.Description5:
Valid values are defined as follows:

      0 appends job results below any existing content in the results file.

      1 overwrites any existing content in the results file.
Function.Description6: Identifies a character variable whose value describes the current run of the job. The descriptive text is added either to the top of the results file or above the results that will be appended to the bottom of the results file.
Function.Description7: Identifies an dfPower Architect macro that exists on the DataFlux Integration Server. The value of macro-nameX can be specified as text, or as the name of a character variable.
Function.Description8: Specifies the character value that will be used by the associated dfPower Architect macro. Macro-value1 is used by macro-name1. The value of macro-valueX can be specified as text, or as the name of a character variable.
Function.Description9: Identifies an dfPower Architect macro that exists on the DataFlux Integration Server. The value of macro-nameX can be specified as text, or as the name of a character variable.
Function.Description10: Specifies the character value that will be used by the associated dfPower Architect macro. Macro-value1 is used by macro-name1. The value of macro-valueX can be specified as text, or as the name of a character variable.

Function.Name: DQSRVPROFJOBREP
Function.Definition: Runs a repository-type Profile job on a DataFlux Integration Server and returns a job identifier.
Function.Description1: Identifies the dfPower Architect job as it exists on the specified DataFlux Integration Server.
Function.Description2: Identifies the host of the DataFlux Integration Server. If this value is not specified, then the local host is used by default.
Function.Description3: Identifies the port through which the local host communicates with the DataFlux Integration Server. If this argument is not specified, or if the value is 0 or a negative number, then the default port number is used. The default port number is 21036.
Function.Description4: Identifies the repository on the DataFlux Integration Server that contains the dfPower Profile job.
Function.Description5: Identifies the file that receives the report that is generated by the dfPower Profile job.
Function.Description6: Identifies a character variable whose value describes the current run of the job. The descriptive text is added either to the top of the results file or above the results that will be appended to the bottom of the results file.
Function.Description7: Identifies an dfPower Architect macro that exists on the DataFlux Integration Server. The value of macro-nameX can be specified as text, or as the name of a character variable.
Function.Description8: Specifies the character value that will be used by the associated dfPower Architect macro. Macro-value1 is used by macro-name1. The value of macro-valueX can be specified as text, or as the name of a character variable.
Function.Description9: Identifies an dfPower Architect macro that exists on the DataFlux Integration Server. The value of macro-nameX can be specified as text, or as the name of a character variable.
Function.Description10: Specifies the character value that will be used by the associated dfPower Architect macro. Macro-value1 is used by macro-name1. The value of macro-valueX can be specified as text, or as the name of a character variable.

Function.Name: DQSRVUSER
Function.Definition: Authenticates a user on a DataFlux Integration Server.
Function.Description1: Identifies the user according to the registry in a DataFlux Integration Server.
Function.Description2: Authenticates the user according to the registry in the DataFlux Integration Server. The password can be plain text or SAS-encoded.

Function.Name: DQSTANDARDIZE
Function.Definition: Returns a character value after standardizing casing, spacing, and format, and applies a common representation to certain words and abbreviations.
Function.Description1: Is the value that will be standardized according to the specified standardization definition. The value can be the name of a character variable, a character value in quotation marks, or an expression that evaluates to a variable name or a quoted value.
Function.Description2: Specifies the name of the standardization definition, which must exist in the specified locale.
Function.Description3: Specifies the name of the locale that contains the specified standardization definition. The value can be a name in quotation marks, the name of a variable whose value is a locale name, or an expression that evaluates to a variable name or to a quoted locale name.

Function.Name: DQTOKEN
Function.Definition: Returns a token from a character value.
Function.Description1: Is the value from which the specified token will be returned, according to the specified parse definition. The value can be the name of a character variable, a character value in quotation marks, or an expression that evaluates to a variable name or a quoted value.
Function.Description2: Identifies the token that is returned.
Function.Description3: Specifies the name of the parse definition, which must exist in the specified locale.
Function.Description4: Specifies the name of the locale that contains the specified parse definition. The value can be a name in quotation marks, the name of a variable whose value is a locale name, or an expression that evaluates to a variable name or to a quoted locale name.

Function.Name: TPLOT
Function.Definition: Creates a triangular plot that graphically displays genetic marker test results.
Function.Description1: Specifies the name of the SAS data set that is the output data set from the ALLELE procedure, containing the linkage disequilibrium test and HWE test p-values.
Function.Description2: Specifies the name of the SAS data set that contains the p-values for the marker-trait association tests. This data set can be the output data set from the CASECONTROL procedure, the FAMILY procedure, or the PSMOOTH procedure, or it can be created by the user.
Function.Description3: Names the variable that contains the marker-trait association p-values in the SAS data set that is specified in the second argument.
Function.Description4: Specifies the significance level for the marker-trait association test. This level is used as a cut-off for the p-value range corresponding to the symbol shape on the plot. This number must be between 0 and 1. The default is ALPHA=0.05.

Function.Name: DEFINE
Function.Definition: Sets the value of an attribute for a particular column in the current row.
Function.Description1: Specifies a column name or a column number (that is, the position of the column from the left edge of the report). _ROW_ is an automatic variable that indicates the entire current row.
Function.Description2: Is the attribute to define. Valid attributes are: BLINK, COLOR, COMMAND, FORMAT, HIGHLIGHT, RVSVIDEO, URL, URLBP, and URLP.
Function.Description3: Sets the value for the attribute.

Function.Name: FOREACH
Function.Definition: The FOREACH statement iteratively applies a constraint over an array of variables.
Function.Description1: An array defined in the ARRAY statement.
Function.Description2: The type of the constraint.
Function.Description3: The optional offset parameter is an integer and is interpreted in the context of the constraint type.

Function.Name: ContinueFor
Function.Definition: Sets the number of additional iterations for the genetic algorithm optimization
Function.Description1: Specifies that the optimization continue for niter more iterations. To stop at the current iteration, set niter to 0.

Function.Name: Cross
Function.Definition: Executes a genetic crossover operator from within a user subroutine.
Function.Description1: Is an array that specifies the solutions to be crossed.
Function.Description2: Is the desired segment of the solution to which the crossover operator should be applied.
Function.Description3: Is the type of crossover operator to apply, which also determines the number and type of parameters expected. The accepted values for type are: 'arithmetic', cycle', heuristic', 'null', 'order', pmatch', 'simple', twopoint', and 'uniform'.
Function.Description4: Optional parameter applicable to some operators.
Function.Description5: Optional parameter(s) applicable to some operators.

Function.Name: Dynamic_array
Function.Definition: Allocates a numeric array.
Function.Description1: Is a previously declared array, whose dimensions are to be re-allocated.
Function.Description2: Is the size of the first dimension.
Function.Description3: Are optional. Up to six dimensions can be specified.

Function.Name: EvaluateLC
Function.Definition: Evaluates linear constraints.
Function.Description1: Is a two-dimensional array representing the linear constraints.
Function.Description2: Is a numeric array to receive the magnitude of the constraint violation for each linear constraint.
Function.Description3: Is a variable to receive the sum of the constraint violations over all the constraints.
Function.Description4: Is an array identifying the selected solution.
Function.Description5: Is the segment of the solution to which the linear constraints apply.
Function.Description6: Is an optional parameter, and should be specified only when EvaluateLC is called from a user crossover operator.

Function.Name: GetDimensions
Function.Definition: Gets the dimensions of an array variable.
Function.Description1: Is the array variable whose dimensions are desired.
Function.Description2: Is an array to receive the dimensions of source.

Function.Name: GetObjValues
Function.Definition: Retrieves objective function values from the current solution generation.
Function.Description1: Is an array to receive the objective values.
Function.Description2: Is the number of objective values to get.

Function.Name: GetSolutions
Function.Definition: Retrieves solutions from the current generation.
Function.Description1: Is an array to receive the solution elements.
Function.Description2: Is the number of solutions to get.
Function.Description3: Is the segment of the solution to retrieve.

Function.Name: Initialize
Function.Definition: Creates the initial solution generation.
Function.Description1:
Is a string that specifies an initialization option. The available options and their effect are as follows:

      '_uniform_'     generate uniformly distributed solutions
      _dataset_'      read solutions from the data set specified in a FIRSTGEN= option.
      'default'       read solutions from the data set specified in a FIRSTGEN= option, if one was specified.
      '_retain_'      bring forward the best solutions from the current generation.
      'user-routine'  Any string not matching the preceding options is interpreted to be a user-defined initialization routine.
Function.Description2: Is the number of solutions to create by using a given option.
Function.Description3: More option-size pairs (optional).

Function.Name: MarkPareto
Function.Definition: Identifies the Pareto-optimal set from a population of solutions
Function.Description1: Is a one-dimensional array to accept the results of the evaluation.
Function.Description2: Is a variable to receive the number of Pareto-optimal solutions.
Function.Description3: Is a two-dimensional array that contains the multiple objective values for each solution.
Function.Description4: Is a one-dimensional array to specify how the objective values are to be used.

Function.Name: Mutate
Function.Definition: Executes a genetic mutation operator from within a user subroutine.
Function.Description1: Is an array that specifies the solution to be mutated.
Function.Description2: Is the desired segment of the solution to which the mutation should be applied.
Function.Description3: Is the type of mutation operator to apply, which also determines the number and type of parameters expected. The accepted values for type are: 'delta', 'invert', swap', and 'uniform'.
Function.Description4: Are optional parameters applicable to some operators.

Function.Name: Objective
Function.Definition: Evaluates a standard objective function from within a user subroutine.
Function.Description1: Is an array that specifies the solution to be evaluated.
Function.Description2: Is the desired segment of the solution to be evaluated.
Function.Description3: Is objective function name, which also determines the number and type of parameters expected. The accepted value for type is 'TSP'.
Function.Description4: Are optional parameters applicable to particular objective functions.

Function.Name: PackBits
Function.Definition: Writes bits to a packed integer array.
Function.Description1: Is an array to which the value is to be assigned.
Function.Description2: Is the starting position for the bit assignments.
Function.Description3: Is the number of bits to assign.
Function.Description4: Is the value to be assigned to the bits. For a single bit, this should be 0 or 1.

Function.Name: ReadChild
Function.Definition: Reads a segment from a selected child solution into an array, within a user crossover operator.
Function.Description1: Specifies the family (parents and children) obtained from the selection process.
Function.Description2: Specifies the solution segment to be read.
Function.Description3: Specifies the child in the family from which to read the solution segment.
Function.Description4: Specifies an array to receive the solution elements.

Function.Name: ReadCompare
Function.Definition: Reads a segment from a selected solution into an array, within a user fitness comparison subroutine.
Function.Description1: Specifies the pair of solutions to be compared, obtained from the selection process.
Function.Description2: Specifies the solution segment to be read.
Function.Description3: Specifies the solution (1 or 2) from which to read the segment.
Function.Description4: Specifies an array to receive the solution elements.

Function.Name: ReadMember
Function.Definition: Reads the selected solution into an array for a user objective function or mutation operator
Function.Description1: Is a parameter passed to the user subroutine by the GA procedure, which points to the selected solution.
Function.Description2: Specifies which segment of the solution to retrieve.
Function.Description3: Specifies an array in which to store the solution elements.

Function.Name: ReadParent
Function.Definition: Reads selected solution elements into an array in a user crossover subroutine.
Function.Description1: Is a parameter passed to the user subroutine by the GA procedure, which points to the selected solution family.
Function.Description2: Is the segment of the desired parent solution to be obtained
Function.Description3: Is the number of the parent, starting at 1.
Function.Description4: Is an array in which to store the solution elements.

Function.Name: ReEvaluate
Function.Definition: Reruns the evaluation phase of the genetic algorithm.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric scalar or array that specifies the indices of the solutions to be updated. The indices correspond to the order of the solutions obtained from a GetSolutions call.

Function.Name: SetBounds
Function.Definition: The SetBounds subroutine is used to establish upper and lower bounds on the solution space.
Function.Description1: Is a lower bound for the solution components.
Function.Description2: Is an upper bound for the solution components.
Function.Description3: Is optional, and specifies a segment of the solution to which the bounds apply. If seg is not specified, then it defaults to a value of 1.

Function.Name: SetCross
Function.Definition: The SetCross routine is used to assign a standard crossover operator.
Function.Description1: Is the name of the crossover operator to be applied. The accepted values for type are: 'arithmetic', 'cycle', 'heuristic', order', 'pmatch', simple', twopoint', and 'uniform'.
Function.Description2: Is optional, and specifies a segment of the solution to which the operator should be applied. If seg is not specified, then it defaults to a value of 1.
Function.Description3: Is optional, and specifies the name of a particular property to be set for the crossover operator.
Function.Description4: specifies the value to be assigned to the corresponding property name.
Function.Description5: More optional pname-pvalue pairs.

Function.Name: SetCrossProb
Function.Definition: The SetCrossProb subroutine is used to set the crossover probability for the genetic algorithm optimization process.
Function.Description1: Is the crossover probability.

Function.Name: SetCrossRoutine
Function.Definition: Installs a user subroutine for the crossover operator.
Function.Description1: Is the name of a subroutine you have defined, which is called when the mutation operator is applied. This parameter must be a string literal; a variable is not accepted.
Function.Description2: Is optional, and specifies the number of parent solutions the operator requires. If not specified, 2 is assumed.
Function.Description3: Is optional, and specifies the number of children solutions the operator will generate. If not specified, 2 is assumed.

Function.Name: SetElite
Function.Definition: Sets the number of best solutions to pass to the next generation.
Function.Description1: Is the number of best solutions to be passed unmodified from the current solution generation to the next.

Function.Name: SetEncoding
Function.Definition: The SetEncoding subroutine is used to establish the type of problem solution encoding.
Function.Description1: Is a string used to specify the form of the solution.

Function.Name: SetFinalize
Function.Definition: Designates a user subroutine to perform post processing at the end of the optimization process.
Function.Description1: Is the name of a subroutine you have defined, which is called when the optimization process ends. This parameter must be a string literal; a variable is not accepted.

Function.Name: SetMut
Function.Definition: The SetMut routine is used to assign a standard mutation operator.
Function.Description1: Is the name of the mutation operator to be applied. The accepted values for type are: 'delta', 'invert', 'null', 'swap'. and 'uniform'.
Function.Description2: Is optional, and specifies a segment of the solution to which the operator should be applied.
Function.Description3: Is optional, and specifies the name of a particular property to be set for the mutation operator.
Function.Description4: Specifies the value to be assigned to the corresponding property name.
Function.Description5: More optional pname-pvalue pairs.

Function.Name: SetMutProb
Function.Definition: The SetMutProb subroutine is used to set the mutation probability for the genetic algorithm optimization.
Function.Description1: Is the mutation probability.

Function.Name: SetMutRoutine
Function.Definition: The SetMutRoutine call enables you to designate a subroutine you have defined to be used for the mutation operator.
Function.Description1: Is the name of a subroutine you have defined, which is called when the mutation operator is applied. This parameter must be a string literal; a variable is not accepted.

Function.Name: SetObj
Function.Definition: The SetObj routine is used to assign a procedure-supplied objective function.
Function.Description1: Is the name of the objective function to be used. The accepted value for type is 'TSP'.
Function.Description2: Is an indicator to maximize or minimize the objective. A value of 0 is used to specify a minimization, and a value of 1 to specify maximizing the objective.
Function.Description3: Is optional, and specifies a segment of the solution to which the objective function should be applied.
Function.Description4: Is optional, and specifies the name of a particular property to be set for the objective function.
Function.Description5: Specifies the value to be assigned to the corresponding property name.
Function.Description6: More optional pname-pvalue pair(s).

Function.Name: SetObjFunc
Function.Definition: The SetObjFunc subroutine is used to designate a user function to be the objective for the optimization process.
Function.Description1: Is the name of a user objective function. This parameter must be a literal string.
Function.Description2: Is set to 0 to minimize the objective, 1 to maximize.

Function.Name: SetProperty
Function.Definition: The SetProperty call is used to set or modify properties of a genetic operator, objective function, or a selector.
Function.Description1: Is the type of operator. It should have a value of 'cross' for a crossover operator, 'mut' for a mutation operator, 'obj' for an objective function, or 'sel' for a selector.
Function.Description2: Is optional, used only for mutation and crossover operators, and specifies the segment in which the operator resides. It is necessary only for multisegment encoding. The default value if seg is not specified is 1.
Function.Description3: Specifies the name of a particular property to be set.
Function.Description4: specifies the value to be assigned to the corresponding property name.
Function.Description5: Additional pname-pvalue pair(s) (optional).

Function.Name: SetSel
Function.Definition: The SetSel call is used to specify a selector for the regeneration process, which selects members of the current generation to be propagated to the next.
Function.Description1: Is the type of selection strategy to be used.
Function.Description2: Is optional, and specifies the name of a particular property to be set for the selector operator.
Function.Description3: Specifies the value to be assigned to the corresponding property name.
Function.Description4: Additional optional pname-pvalue pair(s).

Function.Name: SetUpdateRoutine
Function.Definition: Designates a control subroutine to be called at each iteration.
Function.Description1: Is the name of a subroutine you have defined that is called once during each iteration of the optimization process. This parameter must be a string literal; a variable is not accepted.

Function.Name: ShellSort
Function.Definition: Sorts a numeric array.
Function.Description1: Is a one or two dimensional array to be sorted.
Function.Description2: Is an optional numeric scalar or array that specifies the columns by which the array is to be sorted. If not specified, column 1 is the default.
Function.Description3: Is an optional numeric scalar or array used to specify which columns in the by parameter are to be in descending order. Any columns not specified in a descend parameter will be in ascending order.

Function.Name: Shuffle
Function.Definition: The Shuffle subroutine randomly rearranges the elements of the x array.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric array to be randomly shuffled.

Function.Name: UnpackBits
Function.Definition: The UnpackBits function facilitates the extraction of bit values from arbitrary locations in an integer array.
Function.Description1: Is an array containing the packed bit values.
Function.Description2: Is the starting bit, with the lowest bit starting at 1.
Function.Description3: Is the number of bits to retrieve. A value of 1 retrieves a single bit.

Function.Name: UpdateSolutions
Function.Definition: The UpdateSolutions subroutine is used to replace the values of the selected solution segment with new values computed in an update routine.
Function.Description1: Is an array containing the replacement solution elements.
Function.Description2: Is the number of solutions to update.
Function.Description3: Is the segment of the solution to replace.

Function.Name: WriteChild
Function.Definition: The WriteChild subroutine is called inside a user crossover operator subroutine to assign to the elements of a selected child solution.
Function.Description1: Is an array specifying the selected family of solutions.
Function.Description2: Is the segment to which the elements are to be written.
Function.Description3: Is the child within the family to which the elements are to be written. A value of 1 is for the first child, 2 for the second, and so on.
Function.Description4: Is an array containing the values to be written.

Function.Name: WriteMember
Function.Definition: Assigns values to a selected solution from within a user objective function or mutation operator.
Function.Description1: Is an array specifying the selected family of solutions.
Function.Description2: Is the segment to which the elements are to be written.
Function.Description3: Is an array containing the values to be written.

Function.Name: RANCOMB
Function.Definition: Permutes the values of the arguments, and returns a random combination of k out of n values.
Function.Description1: Is a numeric variable that contains the random number seed.
Function.Description2: Is the number of values that you want to have in the random combination.
Function.Description3: Specifies all numeric variables, or all character variables that have the same length. K values of these variables are randomly permuted.
Function.Description4: Specifies all numeric variables, or all character variables that have the same length. K values of these variables are randomly permuted.

Function.Name: EFFRATE
Function.Definition: Returns the effective annual interest rate.
Function.Description1: Is a SAS interval. This value represents how often rate compounds.
Function.Description2: Is numeric. rate is a nominal annual interest rate (expressed as a percentage) that is compounded at each compounding interval.

Function.Name: MVALID
Function.Definition: Checks the validity of a character string for use as a SAS member name.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that associates a SAS library with a libref. Leading and trailing blanks are ignored.
Function.Description2: Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that is checked to determine whether its value can be used as a SAS member name. Leading and trailing blanks are ignored.
Function.Description3:
Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression that is the member type of the member name that you are using. Leading and trailing blanks are ignored. The value of memtype is not validated. The following member types are available: 

  ACCESS specifies access descriptor files that are created by SAS/ACCESS.  
  CATALOG specifies SAS catalogs. 
  DATA specifies SAS data files. 
  FDB specifies a financial database. 
  ITEMSTOR specifies a SAS data set that consists of pieces of information that can be accessed independently. The SAS Registry is an example of an item store.  
  MDDB specifies a multidimensional database. 
  PROGRAM specifies stored compiled SAS programs. 
  VIEW specifies SAS views.
Function.Description4:
Specifies a character constant, variable, or expression. The values for validmemname can be uppercase or lowercase. Leading and trailing blanks are ignored. The following list contains the values that you can use with validmemname: 

  COMPAT | COMPATIBLE
  EXTEND      
    
Default: VALIDMEMNAME= is set to COMPAT.

Function.Name: NOMRATE
Function.Definition: Returns the nominal annual interest rate.
Function.Description1: Is a SAS interval. This value represents how often the returned value is compounded.
Function.Description2: Is numeric. rate is the effective annual interest rate (expressed as a percentage) that is compounded at each interval.

Function.Name: SAVINGS
Function.Definition: Returns the balance of a periodic savings by using variable interest rates.
Function.Description1: Is a SAS date. The value that is returned is the balance of the savings at base-date.
Function.Description2: Is a SAS date. initial-deposit-date is the date of the first deposit. Subsequent deposits are at the beginning of subsequent deposit intervals.
Function.Description3: Is numeric. All deposits are assumed constant. deposit-amount is the value of each deposit.
Function.Description4: Is a positive integer. deposit-number is the number of deposits.
Function.Description5: Is a SAS interval. deposit-interval is the frequency at which deposits are made.
Function.Description7: Is a SAS interval. compounding-interval is the compounding interval.
Function.Description8: Is a numeric percentage. Each rate is paired with a date. rate is the interest rate that starts on date.

Function.Name: SOAPWEB
Function.Definition: Calls a Web service by using basic Web authentication; credentials are provided in the arguments.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character value that is the fileref. IN is used to input XML data that contains the SOAP request.
Function.Description2: Specifies a character value that is the URL of the Web service endpoint.
Function.Description3:
Optional Arguments:
    
OUT 
  specifies a character value that is the fileref where the SOAP response output XML will be written. 
SOAPACTION 
  specifies a character value that is a SOAPAction element to invoke on the Web service. 
WEBUSERNAME 
  specifies a character value that is a user name for either basic or NTLM Web authentication. 
WEBPASSWORD 
  specifies a character value that is a password for either basic or NTLM Web authentication. 
  Encodings that are produced by PROC PWENCODE are supported. 
WEBDOMAIN 
  specifies a character value that is the domain or realm for the user name and password 
  for NTLM authentication. 
MUSTUNDERSTAND 
  specifies a numeric value that is the setting for the mustUnderstand attribute in the SOAP header. 
PROXYPORT 
  specifies a numeric value that is an HTTP proxy server port. 
PROXYHOST 
  specifies a character value that is an HTTP proxy server host. 
PROXYUSERNAME 
  specifies a character value that is an HTTP proxy server user name. 
PROXYPASSWORD 
  specifies a character value that is an HTTP proxy server password. Encodings that are produced 
  by PROC PWENCODE are supported. 
CONFIGFILE 
  specifies a character value that is a Spring configuration file that is used primarily to 
  set time-out values. 
DEBUG 
  specifies a character value that is the full path to a file that is used for debugging 
  logging output.

Function.Name: SOAPWEBMETA
Function.Definition: Calls a Web service by using basic Web authentication; credentials for the authentication domain are retrieved from metadata.
Function.Description1: Specifies a character value that is the fileref. IN is used to input XML data that contains the SOAP request.
Function.Description2: Specifies a character value that is the URL of the Web service endpoint.
Function.Description3:
Optional Arguments:
    
OUT 
  specifies a character value that is the fileref where the SOAP response output XML will be written. 
SOAPACTION 
  specifies a character value that is a SOAPAction element to invoke on the Web service. 
WEBAUTHDOMAIN 
  specifies a character value that is the authentication domain from which to retrieve a user 
  name and password from metadata for basic Web authentication. 
MUSTUNDERSTAND 
  specifies a numeric value that is the setting for the mustUnderstand attribute in the SOAP header. 
PROXYPORT 
  specifies a numeric value that is an HTTP proxy server port. 
PROXYHOST 
  specifies a character value that is an HTTP proxy server host. 
PROXYUSERNAME 
  specifies a character value that is an HTTP proxy server user name. 
PROXYPASSWORD 
  specifies a character value that is an HTTP proxy server password. Encodings that are produced 
  by PROC PWENCODE are supported. 
CONFIGFILE 
  specifies a character value that is a Spring configuration file that is used primarily to 
  set time-out values. 
DEBUG 
  specifies a character value that is the full path to a file that is used for debugging 
  logging output.

Function.Description1: Specifies a character value that is the fileref. IN is used to input XML data that contains the SOAP request.

Function.Description3:
Optional Arguments:
    
OUT 
  specifies a character value that is the fileref where the SOAP response output XML will be written. 
SOAPACTION 
  specifies a character value that is a SOAPAction element to invoke on the Web service. 
WSSUSERNAME
